30368544.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is a mix of different genres, RPG, Hidden Object, Clicker, Point and Click, and it doesn't go into any depth for any of them, yet, the formula seems to work, as I sat down and played through it in one sitting without losing interest.

You play a farmer's son who needs to go on a quest to rescue your father after an encounter with bandits. As you explore, more of the map opens up, you discover crafting, magic, and the ability to level up, none of these is in any depth however, and the toughest challenge you will face is managing your economy, as most quests require objects that more often than not, require gold to obtain. So exploring whether or not hunting, herb gathering, fishing, delivery services etc. are enough to earn a profit is about the only learning curve in the game. Many resources are hidden within the world, giving it a slight hidden object vibe, but they aren't very difficult.

The graphics are good for the type of game it is, the music fits the theme, and the hours role by. Rather than playing the game for a challenge, you play the game for the story or for the satisfaction you get from completing quests and checking them off your list. Hero of the Kingdom offers casual, stress-free gameplay, and is worth the journey.

30283176.review:
[i]Hero of the Kingdom – странный предмет. Вроде игра. А вроде и нет. [/i]

И для такой мысли место действительно есть, ведь по большей части Герой Королевства представляет собой point'n'click-адвенчуру, сиречь заниматься мы будем сплошными путешествиями и пиксельхантингом в промышленных масштабах. 

Что же отличает эти два момента от какой-нибудь Deponia? 

Простота. Казуальность. Линейность. 

Да, в Hero of the Kingdom практически невозможно запороть прохождение: 

Срубить дерево за выносливость ⇒ наловить две рыбы за выносливость ⇒ восстановить выносливость за рыбу ⇒ продать дрова за монету ⇒ и так далее...

Вариативность минимальна. Щедрость к игроку не знает границ. Покупаешь рыбу за 1 монету и жаришь эту рыбу за 1 монету, после чего идёшь и продаёшь торговцу жареную рыбу за 3 монеты. Повторяешь. Торговцу не надоедает. Да, полное олицетворение того анекдота про покупку всё большего количества яблок: "а потом у меня дядя умер и оставил в наследство миллион долларов", только вот "схема с яблоками" тут реально работает. Такие дела. 

По сюжету тут тоже всё достаточно просто. Это насквозь пропитанный старыми добрыми клише рассказ о рыцарях, демонах и героических подвигах, в промежутках между которыми главный герой рубит деревья, собирает ромашки и ловит рыбу. Да.

Есть в нынешней истории место и рептилоидам. Только тихо, не шумите. А то ведь сами знаете. Помните Серёгу? Вот и я не помню, а ведь все его знали, пока он о них не заговорил. Так что думайте головой в следующий раз. 

Не знаю, чем именно берёт игрока Hero of the Kingdom. По моим ощущениям: именно незамысловатым геймплеем. Здесь почти невозможно проиграть, интерес поддерживается пиксельхантингом и поручениями неписей, а постоянная награда за исследование новых территорий и поиск скрытых предметом щёлкает каким-то древним рычажком в мозгу Homo Sapiens. Как будто прямой электрод к центру удовольствий в мозгу. Чёртовы рептилоиды!

30090174.review:
i didn't expect much from this game and i was very pleasantly surprised.

the graphics are neat, sound fits in just fine and the music is relaxing as well.
obviously it's a casual game. there is no real difficulty at all but the game certainly knows how to keep you busy. and that's no problem at all since it comes with all the quality of life features you need. it even has a map with fast travel so you don't need to curse if you are missing a healing potion or two arrows for your next adventure. 
even the story is rather decent and the fixed screen resolution isn't such a big deal after all.
 

the game was finished in 4.5 hours and i grabbed all the achievements in the same run. if you feel bored during the weekend or you're sick at home and can't game as hard as usual then it's perfectly fine.

if it looks interesting to you and you even take the time to read the reviews then i don't see why you shouldn't enjoy this game as well.

30068498.review:
Pokud bychom hledali na hře Hero of the Kingdom originální prvky, tak naše pátrání bude neúspěšné. Tuctový a tisíckrát viděný příběh, popisující hledání uneseného otce a navazující záchranu království před zlým mágem, kovaný hráč ohodnotí unaveným zívnutím. Avšak hra nabízí překvapivou směsici adventury říznuté špetkou obchodního taktizování s prvky hidden object hry. 

Hra se odehrává na zcela statických obrazovkách s titěrnou a poměrně propracovanou grafikou plnou detailů. Zpočátku se příběhová linka vine zcela lineárně a připomíná facebookové RPG klikačky blahé paměti. Namažte si šlachy, klikání bude vaší hlavní náplní. Každá postava po vás něco žádá, a tak si mnohdy připadáte jako kurýr PPL. Nebo Maxipes Fík ve známém příběhu, kdy se stává mistrem světa ve skoku pro něco. Ale po absolvování několika prvních lokací nastává změna. 

Příběh se začíná větvit do více směrů, úkolů přibývá a záhy zjistíte, že k jejich plnění potřebujete neuvěřitelné množství věcí - nářadí, zbraně, námezdní pomocníky, vojáky, lektvary, jídlo. A taky, že obsah vašeho míšku se zlaťáky na všechny požadované úkony nedostačuje. Nastupuje tak péče o vaše finance, strategický sběr surovin a obchodování a směňování s mnoha hospodáři. Obchodníků je tolik, že jsem měl mnohdy problémy, zapamatovat si, kde se který prodejce s požadovanými komoditami nachází. Naštěstí se dá mezi oblastmi rychle přenášet pomocí mapy. Pomohl jsem si nakonec chytrým trikem s obilím, mlýnem a následným prodejem pečiva, což zajišťuje prakticky neomezený zdroj zlaťáků, pokud jste v nouzi.

Při hraní jsou potřeba bystré oči. Všude jsou roztroušeny skryté houbičky, bylinky, krabice s poklady, na březích nacházíme raky, vše se dá prodat nebo vyměnit a získat cenné zlatáky. A také achievementy, které za ostrý zrak a nalezené předměty získáte ocenění vašeho snažení. Takže příznivce hidden object her bude spokojen také. Občas se dostanete do křížku s divou zvěří nebo se utkáte v soubojích. Jediné co potřebujete, je mít požadované zdroje, finance nebo potřebné mužstvo, takže příznivce akčních her si souboje rozhodně neužije.

Hero of the Kingdom tak není vůbec obtížná, jedná se opravdu o casual “pohodovku” s jednoduchou, ale pěknou grafikou a intuitivním rozhraním i ovládáním. K mému překvapení mě upoutala, přitáhla a udržela bez přítomnosti nudy. Snaha o nalezení všech předmětů docílila podle Steamu herní dobu 10 hodin, i když příběh se dá zvládnout za poloviční čas. I tak jsem neuspěl a pár beden a houbiček zůstalo někde skryto. 

Hledáte-li příjemné relaxační ukrácení dlouhé chvíle jednoduchou adventurou, Hero of the Kingdom je jasná volba.

Hodnocení: 70%

29569148.review:
我个人认为这款游戏适合在手机上玩，电脑点来点去真的很累。
2D风格的RPG游戏，上手很简单，虽然是英文可是基本不难，剧情能看懂一些就行。基本上你需要做的事情都会在游戏里很显眼的标出来，而且每个任务都会在右下提示你该怎么做，感觉翻译一下可以当做官方攻略放出来。
BGM是循环播放的几首曲子，听到烦的时候可以自己开歌听，基本不会对游戏体验产生任何影响。
这游戏的全成就是真的有毒，找蛋，找箱子，找蘑菇简直要命。不过有个小技巧，每一次日夜交替或者回到主菜单再进游戏，游戏里的地图就会刷新，也就是说可收集物品的地点会随机刷新，实在找不到的时候可以刷新一下地图，找起来快一点。
前期钱基本是不够的，建议买几个篮子去采药，然后卖回给那个老太太，收入还是挺可观的。后期可以卖小龙虾，卖宝箱，卖首饰戒指什么，蘑菇尽量留着，后期对药水的需求量相当高。
这游戏做的还不错，而且价格也不贵（我忘了是入的一刀包还是某网站赠送），可以考虑买来玩玩，打发打发时间。

29560546.review:
Hero Of The Kingdom is an adventure point and click R.P.G. developed and published by Lonely Troops. You are the young son of a humble farmer and you're thoroughly enjoying your peaceful life of agricultural management until one day when malicious bandits suddenly raid your homestead and burn it to the ground. Worse yet your beloved father has also gone missing just as a darkness begins to fall over the entire kingdom. What's a boy to do...overcome his fear and set off for adventure on a dangerous journey to places unknown as you try to find your father of course!!! 

Hero Of The Kingdom does an excellent job of mixing multiple genres into one solid package...lite roleplaying, adventure, hidden object and point and click. This was my very first foray into a hidden objects game and I must admit that I rather enjoyed it. The visuals and animation are nicely done and fit the game perfectly. The title has a terrific soundtrack and the sound effects are fantastic as well. One downside, however, is the length of the title as I finished this game in under five hours but it was well worth the time spent. There are also some achievements to hunt for if that is your bailiwick.

I was also pleasantly suprised to find out that there is a sequel available, Hero Of The Kingdom II, which I plan to play as soon as I pick up a copy. Anyone looking for a casual game that covers more than one base, genre-wise that is, would be remiss to give this little title a chance. I don't think you will regret it...recommended.

29439036.review:
Экономический стратегия как она есть. Вам нужны деньги. Много денег. Эй, солдаты не будут работать бесплатно! Даже ради спасения мира. И жалование им вы почему-то должны платить из своего кармана. И вон тот подозрительный рыбак ничему вас не научит, пока вы не начнёте ни с того ни с сего без причины осыпать его золотом. Так что вперёд - собирать грибы, чтобы продавать их, чтобы покупать корзины, чтобы собирать цветы, чтобы покупать стрелы, чтобы убивать живность, чтобы продавать шкуры, чтобы покупать зелья, чтобы убивать более сильную живность, чтобы продавать шкуры подороже. Или пеките хлеб.
И не забудьте найти время, чтобы построить дом для сына ювелира. Ведь Тёмный Властелин никуда не торопится.
А ещё вам предстоит грабить могилы, если вы хотите ачивку за поиск сокровищ. Просто убедитесь, что об этом никто не узнает.

29436875.review:
Summary excerpt from original review post.
For full review please visit - http://thewirednomad.com/2017/01/10/hero-of-the-kingdom-review/

Hero of the Kingdom is simply a classic bite-sized indie game made by passionate people. It’s beatable in just a few hours with almost no replay value (save for achievements). So I wouldn’t pay much more then you’d throw at a decent mobile game for it. But it’s enjoyable. And you can do a lot worse for a dollar on Steam (trust me). So if you happen to catch it on sale, I would say go for it. If the cynicism of your first click doesn’t make you close it instantly, you might just find yourself making a lot more clicks. You might even start enjoying those clicks and become a Hero.

Got this game at 90% off. I would ahve paied the price at 50% off if I had known what a great little gem this is.
It's a really short game though. It took me 4 hours to complete (getting all the achievements) and I think about 1 hour of that was spend looking for mushrooms, crates and eggs.

The storyline is linear and there's no choice option in the game, so basically you're clicking your way through a nice little story of the hero of a kingdom.
There's quite a few quests that might look like sidequests, but they're almost all needed in order to complete the main story (otherwise you'll just run out of gold).

Get this game if its on sale and you want to relax with a small, not too challenging story.

29188163.review:
This game is so simple but awesome enough to play twice! It doesn't take a nice PC/Mac to play this because it's simply clicking (but it feels like you're doing more). Here are the things I love about this game:

It's sort of like an I Spy game in which you're trying to find resources in various landscapes - so that feels like a mini game in and of itself. And as you progress, you have to go back and look at old maps/landscapes to see what suddenly appears now that you have the skill to gather/hunt it, etc.

There are a few crafting/assembly lines you can use to make money. Many you must use to progress in the game because you need a various item. For example, you end up needing bread quite often to heal/sleep and to help others. You can buy the grain, take it to the mill and pay for it to be ground into flour, then you take it to the bread maker, and then you sell it for a small profit. It takes patience but I love that it does because the reward is all the greater. 

It has acheivements which are super fun for completionists. I am still trying to get all of them - so close! I can't find a couple of things on any of the maps! But that is fun to me because it means more time playing the game of I Spy.

The story progresses perfectly without hitches. There are no glitches and everything you need is basically given to you if you focus on progressing through each map before you complete everything in it. The more maps you have the more opportunities you have to gather/hunt/find the stuff you need for free. It also unlocks more things in the maps you need to go back to anyway. I can tell this game has been thouroughly tested for bugs.

It's fun to make money in this game! Due to the assemply-line type of things like bread or potions, you end up doing some simple math to figure out who gives you the best deal on the supplies to gather, and who will buy what you've gathered for the highest price. Also, it's fun to figure out which camp is cheaper to camp in based on what resources you need to camp there. 

I can easily play this game in windowed mode at work. When I have nothing to do but want to look busy, I just pull it up and play. The simplicity of it makes it easy to be disracted from and come back to just to pick up where you left off. 

My only complaint is that the story is your typical saving someone you love just to find out that you have to defeat a bad guy to save everyone. That being said though, the story was fun enough.

This game has obviously been translated from another language and is hilarious to read sometimes. Everything makes perfect sense but it's said in a way that sounds like a literal translation from one language to another with no account for the differences in grammar/common use of words between the languages. 


I think anyone who likes the types of things I mentioned above would love this game. My mom doesn't like most games, especially not adventure/RPG games, but I honestly think she would find this fun due to the "puzzles" (where to go to get what to solve various tasks) and the I Spy part of it. Be warned though - if you play windowed you need good glasses or good eyesight because things are tiny and very subtle. To me that makes it more fun though. 

PS the only reason I have logged over 100 hours on the game is because I've left it open in the background at work. Being anal about all the acheivements has given me about 10 hours of gameplay, versus the 4 others claim to have gotten out of it.

Imagine Heroes of Might and Magic turned into a Point&Click adventure, on easiest of easy modes. The hardest part being clickety click. BUT! Quite in a good way.

A perfect game for relaxing or someone new to gaming as you can't actually fail. It really is simple, basic would probably even make it sound more complex than it is. You start out as farm boy witnessing your home being ravaged only to find out there's far more behind it (and your family) than your innocent farm boy's ambition could have asked for. And yet, although the linearity is strong in this one, the backtracking is real, sending you from A to B to C often enough to make this tiny world feel more lively and bigger.



100%ed the game in one session of 5.6 hours which bore little to no let-down. It only presented me with very few issues, like the final battle being rather bland compared to other ones, one or two grammar related issues and one quest that didn't give directions...of course that's not much of an issue as relevant NPCs are highlighted and the world is small, but still. Something that was merely an issue for me personally is the lack character and representation. A minor model with simple animations couldn't have hurt ;-)

Ah, en voilà un jeu intéressant !
Je l'ai récupéré dans un bundle de RPG, m'attendant pourtant à une sim de ville médievale, surtout en voyant les captures d'écran. Mais il n'en est rien, je ne sais même pas trop comment qualifier ce jeu, une gestion/aventure point'n'click avec du semblant de RPG ?
Je ne vais pas trop en dire, car assez a été dit et résumé dans un avis précédent, le 23 novembre par Ageferix.
Tout ce que je peux dire, c'est qu'il s'agit là d'un jeu très calme, sans réelle prise de tête avec un rythme lent et une ambiance et donc une bande son des plus décontractées. L'aventure, assez stéréotypée, piochant dans diverses références est malgré tout, assez courte, 4h en prenant mon temps, plus deux autres pour compléter à 100% (en utilisant quelques soluces par ci, par là, je dirais que c'est le seul point noir du jeu) et trouver ces satanés coffres, champignons et autres œufs cachés dans les divers tableaux. Tableaux, donc tout en 2D et en relief assez agréables à l'œil avec des couleurs pétillantes au naturel, ce que j'aime voir bien que j'aurais aimé un peu plus d'animation, car à part la fumée, l'eau et quelques détails mineurs, ça manque un peu de vie. 
Je regrette aussi des quêtes un peu trop répétitives, où tout se résout par l'obtention d'objets et d'or.
Je conseille plutôt ce jeu aux joueurs patients et aux amateurs d'énigmes faciles.
En tout cas je suis tenté de commencer le deuxième maintenant.

Hero of the Kingdom is a point-and-click role-playing game.  It's more casual and story-driven than the average role-playing game.  It is well-written and comes together naturally.  After this game you could buy the sequel that's similar but has a different character and storyline.

28156279.review:
Незамысловатый сказочный сюжет, простенький геймплей — но затягивает! Если во всяких масштабных играх вроде Skyrim мы бегаем и выполняем квесты непосредственно управляя персонажам, то тут сражения, метания между NPC и сбор лута сводятся к паре кликов. Это не плохо — наоборот, есть где развернуться собственной фантазии, как это происходит в форумных и настольных RPG. Всё делается легко и ненапряжно — нужно тыкать по карте, чтобы обнаружить всякие полезные штуки, да лениво заниматься менеджментом ресурсов. Со временем, конечно, это начинает надоедать, но тут-то игра и заканчивается (проходится часов за 5). Графический стиль здесь своеобразный: вид сверху, лёгкая размытость и чрезвычайно мелкие фигурки персонажей. Однако и это оборачивается плюсом — от картинки веет ностальгией по старым добрым стратегиям, в частности Heroes of Might & Magic III. В целом игра довольно атмосферная, домашняя, уютная и неплохо подходит, чтобы просто расслабиться.

6 / 10

28108211.review:
Overall, I would have to say that I do recommend this game.  The gameplay mechanics and graphics are incredibly simplistic, but design choices and details help give the player motivation to keep playing.  A simple one was how as you progress through the game you'll not just expand your inventory, but also develop skills, which give you more options on tasks that you can complete.  This ranges from fishing to hunting, though the chief mechanic doesn't change at all; everything is accomplished with a simple click, if you have the necessary tools and stamina for it.  Part of me thinks that some simple mini-games might liven up those tasks, but part of me also thinks that could become tedious with how often you do it.  Regardless, as you complete quests you will advance in these skills, allowing you to achieve more, and find more hidden objects lurking on the screen.  I found this motivating, as I would scour the screen looking for items that I could sell, as gold is absolutely vital to get anywhere in the game.  In general the game gives you enough freedom to achieve certain things in the order you deem fit, as well as how far to advance in certain aspects, that you don't feel stuck or too tied down, even if there is a degree of linearity in quest advancement.  It does help that the game is short as you never feel like you're straying too far away from your main quest, as inevitably you will finish any side quests and only have one method available to you to move forward.

I wouldn't say this game couldn't stand some improvements though, as there were some design choices that I wasn't a fan of.  For starters, considering how simplistic everything is in the game, I would have hoped that when you click on a task to complete that it would process almost instantly so you wouldn't have to wait to get your results.  This was especially annoying as you discovered mushrooms, eggs, and chests, as you'd see several of them in a new area, but have to wait on each one before you could click on the next one.  This same issue plagued the market system, as you could only purchase in the increments shown, which was usually only one and you have to pause inbetween each individual click.  Streamlining these aspects would make the flow feel better.  

Another aspect that disappointed me was that despite starting off the game using an axe and saw in order to chop down trees and produce lumber that mechanic was very sparsely used throughout the entirety of the game.  Other tools, like the sickle, were used heavily to gather flowers, so it felt a bit misleading to start off that way and almost never do that again.  That seemed especially pertinent when you'd need to get lumber a few times in order to build things like a water mill and a house, so I would have liked to see a bit more balance and distribution of those less utilized abilities/tools.

This might be something only I missed, but one aspect of the game that threw me off was replenishing stamina.  Since the game throws you out of your home after you've only regained stamina once, as I progressed and kept healing, I was under the impression that the cap on my hearts was something like 20.  That's the highest amount you can heal yourself for and what you start off with in the game, so I never questioned it.  As I got to the point where tasks took 8+ hearts, you can imagine how often I was going back and forth in the game.  However, I eventually experimented and found I could go higher than 100 actually.  If I had known that sooner, I would have spammed those camp sites in order to stock up on several hearts before getting back into completing tasks.  

A word of advice if you're going for all of the achievements - I found the last treasure when I robbed the three crypts in the cemetary.  Since that lowered my fame after I robbed the first one I didn't end up going through the other two.  After all, I was afraid I'd end the game with too low fame to get my achievement or otherwise harm my ending somehow, but as long as you complete everything you'll be just fine in both the storyline and in achievement hunting.  So you may as well just do it when you can, or otherwise you could miss out on that last treasure by accident.

I already said that I do recommend this game, but it's the sort of experience I'll likely only play through once.  Maybe years from now I might want another go through, but there's little to offer for a 2nd playthrough in either the gameplay or the story.  Also, I have played games just like this for free before, that varied only slightly in overall game mechanics or even in the overlying plot behind the gameplay, which doesn't motivate me to want to pay for a game like this (or in my case trade it for another game).  I doubt I'll bother getting the sequel, as I don't think it'd offer anything more than this game did.  A one time playthrough that's harmless enough, but doesn't give very much meat or fulfillment either.

26945846.review:
I'm honestly surprised at how much I enjoyed this game. Bought it for a mere $.49 on sale a few months ago. Just today, I was able to 100% it in one sitting. It was a perfect rainy afternoon or "home sick with the flu" pasttime.

It feels like a well done independent flash game. I would categorize it as a casual hybrid between lite RPG, point-&-click adventure, puzzler, and hidden pictures game. Several of the genres Hero of the Kingdom taps do not often count amongst my favorites. But for some reason, this game was a perfect balance of these different genres as well as what it demanded of me as the gamer. It concluded at just the right moment when I was starting to grow weary of the main plot. And I was able to find that last clutch of eggs for the final achievement just as I was starting to get bored with the task.

If it's on sale at $1 or less, I'd definitely say this is a must have.

An additional recommendation—I think that parents of sharp eyed 8-12 year olds might want to consider this as an option for their kids. Good diversion for the backseat, train, or airport.

26794882.review:
Avant de vous donnez mon avis et de vous expliquez le principe du jeu, je veux commencer par vous dire une chose : On est bien dans ce jeu. Qu'est ce qu'on y est bien...on mène notre aventure, on se détend, on admire la beauté du monde, on écoute les sons et la musique, et on est vraiment à l'aise : à la cool.

Hero of the Kingdom est un point n' click / gestion / lecture de tableaux. C'est un jeu ou vous collectez des objets, résolvez des énigmes liés à la gestion de vos ressources et surtout ou vous observez chaque détails de votre environnement. Le scenario qui vous amène à parcourir la région part d'une idée simple et mille fois vue dans l'Heroic Fantasy, mais dans un sens c'est ce qui rend le jeu si bon. Le pitch étant tellement basique qu'il élève l'aventure au niveau d'un conte classique en quelque sorte. Par de retournement de situation extraordinaire, une histoire toute simple qui n'est rien d'autre qu'attachante et agréable.

Vous vivez paisiblement avec votre père à la lisière d'un bois, vous partez quelques heures loin de votre refuge pour aller chercher des ressources, et pendant cette petite escapade votre père se fait enlever par des bandits de grands chemins. Qu'a cela ne tienne, morbleu ! Vous décidez de partir à sa recherche. Au cours de votre périple, vous devrez rendre service à monsieur et madame tout le monde pour progresser plus loin dans la vallée et obtenir certains éléments rares. Tout ce travail développera vos capacités dans beaucoup de domaines, ce qui finira par vous élever au rang de héros dans ce petit monde médiéval saupoudré de Fantasy, à la fois sympathique et hostile.

Le principe de jeu repose essentiellement sur un sous-genre du point n'click que l'on voit de moins en moins de nos jours, à savoir les jeux de lecture de tableaux. Pas de surbrillance pour les items à collecter, à vous de dénicher sur de grandes fresques les éléments allant du sanglier au plus petit champignon. Les jeux de ce type reposent souvent sur des artworks somptueux sur lequel on a plaisir à passer des heures à scruter chaque éléments du décor. Mais Hero of the Kingdom à une esthétique particulière : Le jeu n'est pas magnifique au sens ou on peut l'entendre, mais sa direction artistique « à l'ancienne » est tout à fait géniale, une sorte de floue sépia qui recouvre globalement les tableaux et est associé à des bruitages ultra clairs qui rendent le tout extrêmement vivant. A l'écran vous avez devant vous une image statique si vous coupez le son du jeu, mais dès qu'il est activé, tout semble s'animer. L'aspect visuel de Hero of the Kingdom m'a beaucoup rappelé l’esthétique des vieux jeux Sierra, ce qui a sûrement contribué à booster mon plaisir sur ce titre.

Le jeu n'est vraiment pas cher, et vous pouvez le trouver pour quelques centimes en période de soldes. C'est un jeu à jouer pour se détendre, pour explorer, se laisser porter par l'ambiance visuelle et auditive, pour le plaisir de farmer, de scruter. Je suis sur que Geralt de Riv joue à Hero of the Kingdom à Kaer Mohren quand il est en vacances.

Un beau 18/20 pour un classique du genre, un souffle d'air frais qui dépoussière un style malheureusement trop souvent oublié.

Jeudi 14 novembre est apparu sur Steam un jeu d'aventure/indépendant et RPG : Hero of the Kingdom. Comme j'aime bien embêter Megamat et lui faire faire des fiches de jeux pour le site dès que je vois le terme RPG apparaître, il m'a renvoyé la vanne de tester le jeu. Alors, ni une ni deux, tel un gosse qui a fait un pari débile, je me suis lancé dans l'aventure. Seulement, en moins de dix secondes, c'était terminé. En effet, sur ma machine, le jeu freezait et renvoyait aussi sec sous Windows. Il a fallu attendre samedi 16 pour que les développeurs nous sortent une solution. C'est donc après trois heures de jeu que je reviens vers vous avec mon avis. Oui, trois heures !

La suite du test : http://rpgjeuxvideo.eklablog.fr/hero-of-the-kingdom-a127287004

En conclusion, c'est peut être un très bon point and click, mais absolument pas un bon RPG.

26611459.review:
So this was a quirky little game I've had my eyes on for a while. Having picked it up on offer, I decided to give it a run-through, and it was a generally pleasant experience. Nothing that stands out in particular in terms of what would set it apart from other games, but nothing that felt like it hampered my experiences either. If you have a few hours to spare and a bit of change, this is worth at least one playthrough to pass the time away. It doesn't have much of worth to bring you back for a second playthrough, but given a reasonable price point and it's worth the one time.

The game is essentially a resource management simulation where you have to manage what you have, your energy, money and your skills to eventually become the "Hero of the Kingdom", and honestly, it's not too challenging provided that methodical progression is applied to everything, from levelling your capabilities to ensuring you have enough food or money for the next event you have to overcome. It does have some strategical layer of depth to it (case in point, you can simply buy certain things you need, but if you work on your skills you can get items for much cheaper than you would buying them) and I appreciated the layers that had been taken to reward those who did go a little extra in managing their resources more efficiently

A lot of the gameplay elements are easily visible event points, though one of the other draws of the game is an element of hidden object games, where you find items such as mushrooms or crates for extra items and money. Beyond these elements, it tends to play forward in a more point-and-click adventure game than your typical RPG (a great number of RPG elements are not present here, so if you are looking for an RPG experience, I would advise seeking this elsewhere) and the story it does tell through the story is a simple one, with a neat bow finish after the ending progresses. If any complaint could be thought of, it would be that there's no real sense of time passing by as any of these events transpire - and given that you can rest in camps without any effect to the story does not help in this regard.

In terms of the art assets, the landscapes, the various icons and the people you get to see are pleasant to look at, with nothing looking out of the ordinary for a fantasy adventure. The game has a good sound quality to it, from the effects to the music, though it can sometimes be distracting when the track suddenly changes while you've been on a screen for a while without any change. All-in-all, though, the complaints that I have are minor and nit-picky, and did not detract from the fact that I did get enjoyment from the game overall, and while I clocked only about 4-5 hours and obtained all achievements (with others completing it in less time), it was a worthwhile 4-5 hours that I had spent without any regrets.

In summary: While a short point-and-click adventure experience, it's hidden object and resource management elements helped keep the gameplay varied and entertaining, while the story and progression was balanced enough that it did not feel like it carried on for too long or too short a time, and it didn't leave any loose ends. It's lack of difficulty or replay value is an appeal for anyone seeking something to plug into for a few hours of their time, and the price value makes this at least worth a purchase on a sale, if not at full price.

26542321.review: Hero of the Kingdom - это пошаговая Point and Click игра, что могу сказать по поводу игры: "игра оправдывает своё название и качество проделанной работы, а она на высоте"! Рассмотрим всё детально игра пошаговая и с вполне интересным сюжетом играя якобы за главного героя паренька которому сожгли его "виллу" его дом там где жил, он и его отец.... Вскоре после таких событий парень пошёл искать своего отца и тут и начался сюжет игры, во множественных квестах! Головоломок не было но хотелось бы совсем чуть-чуть! Игра проста как 2+2... сюжет не особо навязан игроку, нету видео вставок, всё просто и легко летит своим чередом. Игра проходится за 5 часов. Скажу так я не ожидал, что пройду её так быстро, но и не скажу, что было не интересно, хочу потом взять продолжение, потому как оптимизация и такие поинт клик игры лёгкие мне понравились, куча диалогов и различных ситуаций, да и фпс всегда 60. В общем игра для меня на 100% оправдала деньги затраченные на неё!  Забыл сказать, что приобрёл я её на распродаже за 14 рублей (вполне оправданные деньги). Жду следующих скидок на вторую часть Hero of the Kingdom 2. И обязательно постараюсь её взять!

26487071.review:
Oddly enough, it was a negative review that actually convinced me to buy this (on sale). I was looking for something casual that wouldn't frustrate me with arbitrarily difficult mechanics. Six hours later, I'm exactly 15 mushrooms away from completing every "achievement" in the game (37 of 38). All the little side quests and object hunts kept me happily engaged and distracted, going back and forth through various areas to discover newly revealed items, and kept my completionist impulse throughly fed. For $0.59, the value can't be beat (even if, as I suspect, the game offers no replayability of substance).

Fulfilling the requirements to complete the major "quests" required at least a little thought and planning to ensure that I did everything in the right order and didn't run short of resources in the process. I agree with critics who say this game is not difficult. If you're looking for hardcore gameplay, this is not the game for you. Short of being so stoned that you fail to figure out the basic resource gathering / cash generation loop, there's no real "challenge" to speak of, no combat mechanics, and the game, while not putting you "on rails" completely, doesn't let you get ahead of yourself... you have to complete each step before new areas open up for exploration.

I'm pretty sure it is impossible to "lose" the game, or to "die". The "hint" mechanism is helpful, but barely necessary... the game makes what needs to be done next pretty obvious, if you're paying attention. You're free to roam around within explored areas, and to pursue quests given in whatever order seems sensible (not all quests are immediately achieveable, you have to build up to them by gathering resources and generating "fame" through completing a large variety of simple side quests), but as indicated, unexplored areas can only be opened up by completing quests, and the mechanics ensure you complete the quests in the appropriate order.

All in all, a nice, satisfying, rewarding "casual" gameplay experience. 7/10, and that's not a complaint. No regrets about the six hours / sixty cents invested. Sometimes, you just want to "play", not "compete". I'll buy the sequel whenever it comes on sale, too.

26360935.review:
I wish there was a neutral selection.  Because that's really how I feel about this game.

I don't hate it, but it really isn't very interesting either.  

I don't mind the almost entire lack of graphics - graphics in the game pretty much consists of still painted scenarios.  

But there is really very little going on in the game.  Oh sure there are step-n-fetchit "quests", but the game is so entirely linear that its like reading a choose-your-own-adventure that somebody else has already gone through, and you have to follow in their footsteps.  There is really very little choice in the game.

Also this is THE GRINDIEST game I have ever had the misfortune to come across. 

One of the major flaws in this game (so far) is that you are constantly being given "quests" that you have to spend your own money on - of which you have very little.

And more often than not, these quests don't even make sense.  For example, once you join the army, you are given quest after quest that requires you to go out and hire workers, hunters, and soldiers, and buy materials, weapons, and supplies, to perform tasks for the army - and you are expected to pay for ALL of this out of pocket.

In what army are the privates and new enlistees expected to pay their fellow soldiers to do the jobs those soldiers joined the army to do, such as fight battles with goblins and bandits?  And in what army do enlisted personell go to the armorer and then have to PAY for their weapons, supplies, and armor?

While there are mushrooms to pick and sell, and fish to catch, etc, these items quickly disappear and then you have to wait a long time for them to respawn.  So you can't really forage your way to wealth.

The only way I've found to make enough money to do the quests is to literally grind - grain into flour, then take the flour back to the baker and trade it for bread, then take the bread into town and sell it at the inn.  And you have to do that a looooooong time, over and over and over again, as you are only making a little over 1 gold per loaf.  

Some of these early quests take THOUSANDS of gold worth of materials and hired help.  And you can't "sell all" - you have to click to sell each individual loaf of bread.  I literally have spent hours reading a book with one hand and methodically clicking over and over again to make enough money to do the stupid quest that I shouldn't have to pay for anyway because its the armies job in the first place.  What IS the general doing with all that money he gets from the royal exchequer?  He's sure not spending it on personell or supplies.

Overall I'd not recommend this game.  People complained about Titan's Quest being too linear - they should take a look at THIS one.  This has got to be The Definition of a linear game.

Grind grind grind.  And then virtually no choices anyway.  I don't see the point.

Also - the main character (who you are following around throughout the game) is pretty much of a jerk.  He self-proclaims his own heroism every time you turn around.

Actually, the more I think about it, I would not recommend playing this game even if you got it for free.  Guess I'm not so neutral after all.

Interactive Folk Art Simulator. 

If you can get past the old timey graphics, this game is actually quite enjoyable. You pretty much point and click on parts of the area you are in to either (harvest resources, fight, build, buy/sell items). It is slow paced so you can progress at your leasure. One thing most people don't know is that you can actually click on things that do not necesarily have icons over them (ie: mushrooms,eggs,lobsters,crates,wood,rocks, and rarely hidden people). the cheapest method I found for sleeping is to spend 1 bread at the second zone you find. Later you can turn grain in to create flour and turn the flower in to get 6 bread (total cost 35 gold for 6 bread). Also, do not sell stuff you cannot find or harvest regularly, you may have to buy it back. 

If you ever see on sale for 50% off or more, i would recommend getting this relaxing interactive art book. 

10/10 would steal that guys wood again, only to sell it back to him.

26228591.review:
I'm a cynical sort when it comes to games. There are so many of them on Steam, and with debacles like NMS, it's easy to become a bit jaded. I typically avoid most hidden object games to boot, so when I fired up Hero of the Kingdom I expected something pretty boring and tedious. I'm happy to say that I was wrong - and what I found recaptured some old memories for me.

Remember when you were a kid, discovering games for the first time, and letting your imagination whisk you away? I'm nearly thirty now, and that feeling is too rare these days. Hero of the Kingdom didn't blow me away, but it did help me remember that sometimes games can be like a cosy blanket that you settle into at the end of the day. A hot mug of tea and a crackling fire in winter - that's what this game is. The simple, rustic fantasy setting and verdant aesthetic, the gentle score and straightforward-yet-rewarding gameplay all combine very well to create a surprisingly immersive experience. The whole is much greater than the sum, I feel.

You start out with a pretty typical fantasy trope via your farm being burned to ashes by bandits, and your father going missing. From there, you embark on an adventure to capture all the krayfish and mercilessly steal eggs from nests. I mean, erm, 'helping fellow villagers'. These tasks range in importance...some are incredibly menial, some revolve around the livelihood of an NPC, and others up the stakes towards the prevention of an apocalypse. It's all quite homely, although the game doesn't shy away from generic soldiers getting killed. Essentially, the gameplay revolves around resource management in a point & click environment - collect materials, trade them, sell them for cash, and so forth. You're fairly well railroaded at first, although at around the halfway point you can elect to ditch the sidequests in favour of just buying everything, if you're happy to buy/sell accordingly and get an endless profit going.

I was sceptical, but Hero of the Kingdom won me over from the outset. I beat the game in six hours, and I was thoroughly impressed. Well worth the cash when it's on sale, if only for being able to indulge your inner child for a few hours. I didn't even find all the collectables, but I don't mind that - it just gives me an excuse to come back and play it all again in a few months time...

25932250.review:
Очень необычная, очень нестандартная, очень интересная, добрая игра! В разработке игры участвовало несколько человек и этот факт нисколько не оправдывает разработчиков! Они сдели маленький и прекрасный проект! Нестандартный геймплей сразу же зацепил!

Порою хочется отдохнуть от экшенов-фигекшенов, гонок, адреналина, вот эта игра именно, то что порою не хватает!

По своей стратегической основе напоминает 12 Labours of Hercules, но с той огромной разницей, что тут полноценный сюжет и игра не разбита на уровни. Тут единый мир, где потихонечку придется открывать локации за локациями, выполнять квесты, искать скрытые предметы и просто помогать жителям этой сказочной страны.

Кстати, все достижения получаются за одно прохождение игры! +1 к идеальным играм в коллекции!

Однозначно рекомендую - хотя бы для того, чтобы хоть немного отойти от стандартных игр и больший проектов!

И по традиции: спасибо разработчику за поддержку разный платформ!

25771991.review:
[h1]Hero of the Kingdom[/h1]

[h1]Общие сведения:[/h1]
[b]Средняя продолжительность игры:[/b] 2-3 часа.
[b]Наличие сюжета:[/b] да. 
[b]Графика:[/b] вид сверху. Удобный обзор территории. Картинка приятна взору.
[b]Игровой процесс:[/b] перемещение по локациям, выполнение заданий для продвижения к основной цели сюжета. 
[b]Управление:[/b] поиск предметов и взаимодействие с окружающим миром с помощью мыши.
[b]Всего локаций:[/b] [spoiler]20[/spoiler]. 
[i](информация скрыта на случай возможного неудовольствия пользователей, т.к. может расцениваться как нежелательный спойлер)[/i]. 
[b]Сложность:[/b] приемлема для быстрого прохождения. Квесты отличаются простотой.
[i]Примечание: в процессе прохождения игрок может оказаться в состоянии мимолётного раздумья. 
Не волнуйтесь, это не опасно[/i].
[b]Доступ к разблокированию игровых достижений после прохождения игры:[/b] да, сохраняется. 
[i]Если по какой-то причине вы что-то забыли/упустили, у вас будет возможность исправить это уже после [u]логичного[/u] завершения игры. Подчёркнутое слово подразумевает, что игра сама намекает о том, когда будет завершена[/i].

[h1]Дополнительные сведения:[/h1] 
[b](вся последующая информация не представляет особой ценности, рекомендуется пропустить)[/b]: 
все предлагаемые задания, как и большинство возможных действий, ориентированы на получение прибыли (в виде золота, полезных предметов, и др.), и не являются обязательными для выполнения.

Но путешествие требует придерживаться определённого алгоритма.
[b]Неуклюжее описание алгоритма:[/b] перед игроком ставится конкретная задача, для выполнения которой требуется владение определённым количеством каких-либо ресурсов, которых изначально у игрока нет. 
Для их получения необходимо выполнить другую задачу, попроще (для которой, в свою очередь, нужно сделать что-то ещё, но совсем простое), таким образом, желаемое игрок получает не сразу.

[h1]Пример:[/h1]
[b]([u]любые представленные примеры могут не совпадать с событиями игры, а так же могут отличаться недостоверностью и носить шуточный характер[/u])[/b]. 
[b]Ситуация:[/b] [i]у вас был украден сладкий рулет[/i].
[b]Цель:[/b] [i]отправиться на поиски с тем, чтобы отыскать пропавший сладкий рулет и/или человека, причастному к исчезновению рулета[/i]. 
[b]Задача:[/b] [i]изучить местность на предмет присутствия вещественных доказательств, которые могли бы помочь расследованию[/i].

[b][Статус задачи — задача выполнена][/b]

[b]Данные по изучению:[/b] [i]найдены сахарные крошки, свидетельствующие о трагической потере рулета[/i]. 
[b]Задача обновлена:[/b] [i]взять след и пуститься в погоню, найти наглеца, посмотреть ему прямо в глаза, рассказать о своих чувствах и заставить его раскаяться в содеянном[/i].  

[b]Условие:[/b] [i]мост сломан, а это единственный путь для перехода в следующую локацию[/i]. 
[u]Требуется ремонт[/u].
Требуемые для починки моста ресурсы: 
дерево — 15 ед, верёвка — 2 шт, удобрение — 4 шт, мармелад — 20 кг, углепластик листовой — 5 шт, кефир — 3 л, тринитротолуол — 5 Мт, компот — 10 мл, 50 разноцветных фантиков от конфет.

[b]Наличие ресурсов[/b] — не наблюдается.
[b]Решение[/b] — найти средства на их приобретение, выполняя различные поручения жителей местной деревни, а так же собирая травы и грибочки,   которые можно продать как в чистом виде, так и в виде зелий. 

Степень бестолковости примера обратно пропорциональна желанию автора выглядеть разумным человеком в глазах возможных читателей обзора.

[h1]Вместо заключения[/h1]
[i]Выражаю благодарность за проявление внимания и желаю приятного отдыха.
Искренне не сожалею, но мысленно не рядом, я[/i].

I have owned this game for awhile but the other day I decided to start playing it out of boredom. I can honestly say this scratched the itch that I was feeling. 

It feels like a cross between a point and click adventure with some RPG-like elements and one of those hidden object games thrown in for fun. It's not overly complicated but has a lot to collect and do in a short amount of time. I managed to complete the game, and all 38 Steam achievements in about 4 hours. 

A good tip: When you start hunting bears you need poison. The first way to get it is to buy it from a shady guy, but don't buy it from him. Instead advance the story a little further till you unlock someone who will craft it for you for free.

25498961.review:
[h1]Hero of the Kingdom[/h1]

A játékot leginkább a Point and Click és az RPG műfaj keverékébe tudnám besorolni, eme rövidke indie játék elkalauzol minket egy fantasy világba, mely a tipikus hős történet elemeire építkezik. Magyar vonatkoztatásban leginkább a János Vitézhez, vagy a Toldihoz tudnám hasonlítani. Annak ellenére, hogy nagyon rövid, rengeteg egyedi ötletet építettek bele, amelytől élvezhetővé válik. Sok szórakoztató percet szerzett nekem a játék, azonban ennek is van egyfajta sötét oldala, amely miatt ha lehetne leginkább a "Semleges" értékelésként jelölném meg. Az alap történet pörgős, és a többi szál sem valami hosszú, azonban rengeteg érdekes mellékküldetésben gazdag. Ezek által ismerjük meg a játék világát, egyes fajok történeteit. Rendkívül magához láncoló az atmoszférája. A "még egy utolsó küldetést" feeling miatt sokszor sikerült elfeledkeznem a valóságtól. Azonban akármennyire is érdekes a játék, rettentően kiegyensúlyozatlan. Szinte pár másodperc alatt meg lehet gazdagodni benne, a küldetések gyakran nem fedezik a belefeccelt nyersanyagokat, néhány teljesítmény miatt pedig be kellett ruháznom egy stresszlabdára. Ha már szóba kerültek a jó öreg teljesítmények, néhány nevetségesen egyszerű, azonban a gombavadászat és a ládakeresés annyira felesleges, idegörlő ötlet, hogy véleményem szerint senki sem élvezte azokat. Összességében körülbelül egy egydélutános indie élményt ad a játék, külön plusszként kiemelem, hogy hivatalosan benne van a magyar nyelv.

Pro:
- Érdekes ötlet, remek kivitelezésben.
- Egyszerű irányítás.
- Remek soundtrack.
- Szép grafika.
- Fantasztikus alaptörténet, temérdek mellék küldetés.
- A játék mechanikája, legyen szó harcról, horgászásról, algaszedésről, vadászatról vagy bármelyik másik foglalkozásról. (Rengeteg van.)
- Könnyű teljesítmények. (Két drabot leszámítva.)

Kontra:
- Rövid.
- Két teljesítmény teljesen idegörlő, szemfájdító és unalmas. Két óra plusszom van benne csak azért, mert gombákat kerestem a térképen.
- Nincs választási lehetőség.
- Csak kültéri helyszínek.
- Hiányos leírások, valahol részletes, valahol összecsapott párbeszéd.
- Nem menthetsz, nem tölthetsz be mentett állást. Ott folytatod, ahol abbahagytad.

Remek játék. 7/10

Интересное увлекательное приключение, в красивом визуальном стиле, с элементами стратегии и планирования. 24947025.review:
A strategic resource management, progressive hidden object game with a much used fast travel map and a viewable achievement list directly off the inventory scene.  Hardest achievement to earn: 5000 gold in inventory, but that is where strategy and some grinding/ farming can come in handy. (There are a couple of ways to farm in this game though it is not really necessary unless one wants to earn lots and lots of gold early in the game but it will be tedious to do.)

Storyline: Father leaves son at home on their farm.  Dad will be back in a week.  Day after he leaves bandits attack, burning all to the ground.  Intrepid son leaves home to catch up with dad, only to discovery dad's wagon has been attacked (by the same bandits the son suspects) and dad is no where to be found, alive or dead.  Hearing rumors dad was taken captive the son decides to find and rescue his father.  Once that decision is made the epic journey begins.  Along the way the son meets people, helps them, earns gold, learns skills and eventually rescues dad.  But wait that is only half way through the game.  The son learns about his father's past, his connection with the Kingdom's King, and how dark forces are once again trying to take over their peaceful Kingdom.  Good thing the son joined the army and made lots of friends because he has to finance this little venture of defeating the rogue wizard who now calls himself, the Dark Lord.  (Is there any dark wizard who does not call himself "Dark Lord" I wonder?) 

Gameplay: Easy to understand icon driven quest adventure, and no actual swashbuckling fighting with controller or keyboard. (No frowning by those who are good at such melee combats.)  This game is more point and click without all the puzzle elements.  Every available thing to do in any area has an icon attached to it.  Need potions, look for the vial and have the asking price ready.  Need to gather flowers, a basket or sack plus a scythe is needed.  Need to fish, bait and fishing pole.  Talk to people with a speech bubble or exclamation mark.  Combat (for the frowners out there) is simple.  Buy the soldiers, weapons, healing potions, or whatever the icon indicates one needs then click the crossed sword icon when ready.  Swords clash, combat sounds, visual advance of the combat group, guaranteed win.  However the player will lose people, equipment, and any potions brought along.  It is very realistic in that way.

Okay seems easy enough, but a lot of resource management strategy is involved.  Gold until the very end is not something one ever has a lot of, even in the end one may not have a lot.  Everything costs something, and there is a barter of goods for other goods or sleeping accommodations to replenish one's health.  People, however, all cost money, and soldiers cost the most and one will need lots of them.  The strategy of the game comes with the resource management of buying just what one needs and possibly a spare for certain things that are used a lot.  The idea is not to accumulate items but to gather and sell the extra.  One needs that gold for something else always, like learning to hunt better, buy the services of workman, equipment, supplies or funding an army.  

Talking to people and doing mini-quest tasks is another money maker though in some cases an investment of supplies is needed.  One may talk to someone and know the task long before one is able to complete it.  Fortunately those people retain an exclamation point over their head until the task is complete.  However there are people without exclamation marks or icons over their heads, so people standing around alone somewhere might actually have a task for one to do or be someone one is looking for.  

This in an odd way leads us to the "hidden object" part of this game.  There are lots of hidden objects, eggs, lost crates and barrels, treasure, even a person or two to name some.  (See the achievement list found on the inventory screen for everything.)  First of all, the hidden objects are progressive.  What I mean by that is when one starts out there are no lost crates or barrels, but as one progresses in the game and learns new skills not only do new icons show up but more hidden objects show up too.  Certain things like golden eggs or treasure do not show up until one talks to the Master Hunter.  Or pearls when one pays to learn new skills from the Master Fisherman.  Basically hidden objects can show up again in a location that one has already scoured for objects.  I would guess after each new icon that appears like ones for flowers, fish or hunting a new set of hidden objects appear or anytime a new skill is learned.  Many of hidden object crates or barrels are submerged in water so look close and click on anything that looks promising.  If one plays on a small screen this might be a problem, the objects are small (or actually relative is size to the world they are in).  Eggs are found in bird's nests. A bird nest's in real life is small so a bird nest in this game having the same proportion to its world is tiny.  It is white which makes it easier to spot.  Mushrooms are small too and 4 different types eventually show up.  So the hidden object elements are progressive and show up as the story progresses so go back to every place and look for any new items.                    

Overall, easy to play, simple to understand, relatively fast paced adventure quest storyline with side tasks to do (people and ghosts), lots of hidden objects to find, with some basic strategy and money/ resource management involved.  Can often be found on sale, in bundles, or on give-away sites.  Well worth the play.

24901951.review: Like one giant fetch quest but with only the rewards. Lots of fun. Half hidden object, half money management, half so-so story. It's well worth it on sale and a few hours of your time. What? That's 3 halves? Don't talk to me like that! I'm the HERO!

24816735.review:
Originelles Casual-Spiel für zwischendurch

Hero of the Kingdom ist weder komplex noch anspruchsvoll. Auch in audiovisueller Hinsicht wird nicht viel geboten und eine mittelmäßigere Mittelalter-Fantasy-Handlung muss wohl erst noch geschrieben werden. Und dennoch kann man sich den Charme dieses Casual-Spielchens nur schwer entziehen. Sobald man einmal angefangen hat, wird man erst wieder aufhören wollen, wenn man das Abenteuer bestanden und alle Achievements eingesackt hat! Das Grundkonzept eine klassische Abenteuerreise im Stil alter isometrischer Rollenspiele auf den Management-Aspekt zu reduzieren, ist wirklich interessant und originell. Die Wimmelbild-Elemente wurden dabei clever integriert und sorgen für zusätzlichen Spaß. Leider bleibt der Management-Aspekt irgendwann auf der Strecke, weil es viel zu einfach ist große Mengen an Gold zu verdienen. Unterm Strich aber dennoch ein gutes Spiel für den kleinen Casual-Hunger zwischendurch.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- überraschend hoher Suchtfaktor
- absolut unkomplizierte Steuerung
- netter Mix aus Wimmelbild-Spiel und Mikromanagement-Simulation
- erzeugt einen ordentlichen Iso-RPG-Flair (obwohl es gar kein RPG ist)
- praktische Weltkarte (zwei Mausklicks genügen um von einem Ende zum anderen Ende der Spielwelt zu springen)
- es macht wirklich verdammt süchtig!

Kontra:
- ist mit maximal 5 Stunden etwas arg kurz
- das Grinden nach Kraft-Punkten kann sehr nervig werden
- Anspruch geht nach einiger Zeit komplett flöten (man hat irgendwann zu viel Gold, wodurch der Management-Aspekt noch nicht mal illusorisch aufrecht erhalten wird)
- nur ein Saveslot. Dieser wird gelöscht, wenn man ein neues Spiel beginnt
- mittelmäßige Story
- mittelmäßige Grafik
- mittelmäßiger Soundtrack

24428160.review:
Jeu de "Point & Click & Discover" dans un univers médiéval. Le principe est d'effectuer toutes les actions en cliquant sur des objets/personnages; que ce soit pour récolter des champignons, couper du bois, réparer une structure, chasser, pêcher, dormir (restauration "PV"), dialoguer, intéragir,... Les actions nécessitent un certain nombre de consommables et de "force" (seule denrée qui n'est pas récoltable mais uniquement restaurée lorsque vous passez une nuit). 
Comptez environ 5h pour terminer la vingtaine de plans. La découverte des éléments récoltables se fait au fur et à mesure de l'aventure, bien que certains éléments puissent être récoltés dès le début sans qu'on sache quoi en faire.
Les graphismes sont assez plaisants (bâtiments détaillés, grande attention portée à la végétation,...) et les musiques sont agréables sans être mémorables. Heureusement ces musiques ne sont pas énervantes, ce qui est un plus indéniable lors de la recherche du dernier oeuf, ou des derniers champignons... dommage que le bruitage des animaux vienne alors titiller vos nerfs lorsque vous passerez plus de 5 minutes sur un même plan. 
L'histoire est assez bien ficelée et tient en haleine le joueur qui aura du mal à décrocher avant d'en connaître la fin. Malheureusement cette fin est un peu bâclée et aurait méritée un peu plus de soins (même pour avoir bêtement une fin clichée qui aurait parfaitement collée au scénario). Quoiqu'il soit, l'univers proposé est assez riche et révèlera quelques surprises.
Un petit point faible en étant pointilleux est l'utilisation des points de force pour effectuer certaines grandes actions qui se déroulent en plusieurs étapes... Cela donne souvent des situations totalement ridicules [spoiler](comme l'attaque du camp des bandits, où il est possible de positionner le groupe de chasseur devant l'entrée pour faire diversion et de ne plus avoir assez de force pour contourner le camp. Ce qui oblige à aller pioncer tout en laissant les chasseurs à leur place)[/spoiler]
En ce qui concerne les succès proposés par les développeurs: la plupart s'obtienne en suivant simplement la trame narrative du jeu et comptez une heure supplémentaire pour débloquer les restants (ce qui vous demandera simplement de récolter toutes les ressources: champignons, oeufs, algues,... et de chasser tous les animaux. Le Royaume sera bien ravagé au niveau faune et flore après votre passage).

Начинаем мы за юношу фермера. По сюжету игры, мы становимя умелым охотником, рыбаком, воином, и даже героем.

Сюжет и дополнительные задания интересные, и интересно почитать, а так же узнать, чем все закончится. 
Красивая графика, красиво изображены предметы, приятное музыкальное сопровождение.

Conclusion: This game isn't worth the 6 bucks they currently demand for it. I'd say it's well worth about 3 since you will enjoy it for 3 hours, if it's your cup of tea that is.

Since the conclusion is what y'all look for I simply put it on the top. If you wanna keep reading then proceed to further thoughts. 

If you want a challenge, look elsewhere. This game is more of an interactive storytelling and it's a good one. 
The story isn't anything new, just a from boy to man kindoff thing going on. It's also just a point and clicker game, if you want to pick up mushrooms, click em and you got em.
So you will not do anything strategybased, the game really walks you through the whole thing without room for failure.

All this might sound like it's just plain crap, that's far from the truth. 
I'm gonna make a comparison to sandbox/survivalgames like minecraft here. One of the main reasons I don't care for such games is the timeconsuming thing about getting simple things done. This game does the opposite, though every quest in the game is a fetchquest of sorts. But I for one don't mind a fetchquest if it takes like 1 minute to complete and you're rewarded straight away with progression in the story.  

The game will not last much longer than 3 hours so keep that in mind when you throw money at the screen.
Protip: Sleep in camps, you will thank me later! :)

24301279.review:
Gra, która udaje rpga (słabo) i strategię ekonomiczną (lepiej), a w rzeczywistości jest przede wszystkim... przygodówką typu hidden objects (jak dla mnie).

Z rpga są niby questy, ale nie ma opcji, żeby je wykonywać na różne sposoby. Plusem jest to, że możemy się nimi zajmować w dowolnej kolejności. Nie ma tu żadnych parametrów, cech do levelowania, więc praktycznie postaci nie kształtujemy, zatem raczej nie można tu  mówic o rpg-u.

Ze strategii ekonomicznej jest zarządzanie surowcami, tyle że nie ma przy tym za bardzo co kalkulować. Surowce trzeba zbierać głównie ze wszystkich oznaczonych punktów. Czasem zachodzi potrzeba kupowania ich od handlarzy, ale nie wiem czy da się w tej grze stracić pieniądze i nie móc jej ukończyć. Chyba nie. I tu jest główny minus tej gry - zbyt niski poziom trudności. A w zasadzie to brak jakiejkolwiek trudności.

Rozgrywka jest przyjemna, ale tak naprawdę nie stanowi żadnego wyzwania. Jedyny problem polega na zaliczeniu wszystkich achievementów, co wymaga klikania na wszystkie interaktywne elementy na mapie, a nie jest to proste, czasem wyłapanie tych kilku pikselków na ekranie bywało dla mnie uciążliwe (ale koniec końców dało trochę satysfakcji). Na szukanie brakujących grzybków i skarbów do zrobienia ostatnich achievementów poświęciłem równie dużo czasu co na dojście do ostatniej walki czyli na praktyczne ukończenie gry. Stąd miałem wrażenie, że w tym wszystkim największym wyzwaniem była zabawa z hidden objects. Jeśli ktoś nie przepada za takimi rozwiązaniami w gameplayu, to nie ma się co przejmować, bo do ukończenia głównego wątku chyba nie potrzeba niczego nieoznaczonego wyszukiwać. Gdyby gra pozwalała na porażkę, czyli niemożliwość jej ukończenia, to satysfakcja z jej przejścia byłaby znacznie większa i może zachęcałoby to do ponownego jej odpalenia (jest raczej na jeden raz). A wystarczyłoby tylko dodać wyższy poziom trudności ze znacznie bardziej ograniczonymi możliwościami pozyskiwania surowców, ich wyższymi cenami u kupców i już byłoby dużo lepiej.

Co do oprawy audio-wizualnej, to jeśli ktoś jest oswojony z ograniczeniami jakie w tej materii wykazują gry indie, to tutaj jest co najmniej dobrze. Trochę się kojarzy z pierwszymi odsłonami Strongholda.

Fabuła? No jakaś jest, ale generalnie niezbyt wyszukana fantasy, choć z drugiej strony nie jest też irytująco infantylna i dla osób nie mających zbyt dużych wymagań, to może ona jest całkiem zjadliwa.

Podsumowując, mimo wspomnianej wady (bardzo niski poziom trudności), jako dość krótką (na parę godzin) relaksującą indie gierkę próbującą łączyć kilka różnych gatunków, polecam (ale raczej w promocji, bo jak na standardową cenę jest za krótka).

24254323.review:
竟然玩了5个小时。。本来没想拿全成就，但是一周目通关以后看着自己已经做的差不多了索性全成就算了。
怎么说呢…你说这款游戏是RPG吧，它的确是RPG。但是这几乎是一个毫无自由度可言的RPG。支线任务其实还是蛮多的，但是不论从地图还是行动上来讲玩家都没有什么选择余地。做任务无非就是看一下说明然后达成任务条件就过了，不存在自由探索这么一说；再加上它point and clic的特点，感觉更像解谜游戏，只是它又不包含任何的解谜元素。（重点是在这个RPG中我们扮演的是某个特定的人，基于这点来说自由度不够也可以理解。）
所以最一开始玩的时候我自己不自觉的拿它和socerer系列做了比较。虽然两者之间并没有很大的可比性，但是我还是不自觉的倾向于socerer…[spoiler] 更何况在亚马逊underground app里面socerer的前两部都是免费的	[/spoiler]
但是总体来讲Hero of the Kingdom还是蛮有可取之处的。支线不少不至于太无聊，主线任务其实也比较紧凑，如果不花时间赚钱的话其实游戏进度还是蛮快的。一些像是植物学家啦或者猎人的辅助技能也提高了游戏的可玩性。而且地图也比较多样，不至于让人觉得单调。游戏音乐也做的不错，不同风格的地图会有不同风格的配乐。而且其实游戏通关之后也可以继续刷成就，省了不少的麻烦。（像Daedalic家的游戏我是实在没勇气刷第二遍…）
所以综上所述如果满分十分的话大概给7.5/10吧。扣下去的两分半给有些过短的游戏流程，以及过低的自由度。强烈建议打折的时候入手。
[spoiler] 我发现在面包商人的老公那里买小麦然后拿到磨坊那里去磨成面粉再在面包商那里换成面包然后去卖给隘口的农场或者渔村上面地图里面的猎人是一个赚钱的不错的办法~就是麻烦…	[/spoiler]

24187952.review:
This was an adorable point and click adventure that filled up a lazy morning for me. It's a very short game, but a fun one. The art is simple, the plot is simple, and the gameplay is very simple, but it's still great. You follow a classic archetypal story about a young farm boy who ends up saving his small kingdom, fishing, hunting, and gathering along the way. You complete tasks for villagers to gain fame and items for the future, and you battle a few mythical creatures here and there, too. There's not much to it, but it's really fun to go back to a simplistic RPG. 

I got this game on sale for 59 cents, and I would wholeheartedly recommend it on sale or not.

24186927.review: Quando comprei este, tive a sensação que estaria jogando algo tipo estratégia, ao estilo de Age of Empires ou Warcraft, ou talvez um RPG onde teria um mundo a explorar. Talvez seja minha culpa não ter analisado melhor, mas este é um jogo linear onde o seu personagem não é visualisado. Com 20 minutos de jogo jáme decepcionei,com a mecânica, mas talvez mais a frente encontre uma boa hostória endo contada. Analisando mecânica, gráfico e audio, não desrecomendaria, mas também não recomendaria com tanta certeza, pois todos os quesitos são medíocres. Não há opção para língua portuguesa, mas se você consegue entender portunhol, vai conseguir jogar em espanhol. Daria um 6/10 e não quero negativar. Numa promoção, levando em conta as cartas colecináveis, talvez valha a pena. Se a dúvida lhe pesar muito, tem versão demo. Deixo por sua conta e risco. Como diria Glória Pires, gostei muito de Red Alert, mas não sou capaz de opinar.

Kurz aber gut! Mir hats eine Menge Spaß gemacht, war stets fair und nicht zu schwer.

Fenster für Fenster schaltet ihr durch Questen neue Gebiete in detailierter Grafik frei, leider wurde an Animationen ordentlich gespart, was dem Spielspaß aber keinen Abbruch tut.

Die Story ist jetzt auch nicht so unverbraucht für das Fantasy Genre: Farmerssohn kloppt Goblins, Räuberbanden und Skelette weich und steigt so schrittweise zum strahlenden Helden am Königshof empor.

Schlussendlich will noch der böse Zauberer ein wenig Aufmerksamkeit von euch und schon ist wieder Friede im Fantasyland. 

Nebenher könnt ihr fleissig Angeln, Beeren und Pilze pflücken, ein paar Wildtiere pellen und die Ressourcen fleissig tauschen und verkaufen im nicht allzu kompliziert ausgefallenen Wirtschaftssystem.
All das erledigt ihr mit wenigen Mausklicks und ohne viel actionreiches Gezappel.

Zu tun gibt es immer etwas und wenn ihr mal nicht wisst wos weitergeht gibt das Spiel euch auf Mausklick Tipps ohne zuviel zu verraten.

Falls ihr das Spiel im Discount seht greift ruhig zu!

This is a fun and relaxing game where you follow a young boy on his quest to find his dad after some bandits burned down your farm. On the way you will help others and get rewarded with gold and knowledge, that help you gather and use the resources of the land. On the way you will become the Hero the Kingdom needs.

Its a basic click and point game, but it has a nice charm to it. It reminds me a lot of how I saw on adventure and heroes growing up. I played Hero of the Kingdom II before I got my hands on Hero of the Kingdom and its about the same game. Since I liked the Hero of the Kingdom II I was happy. Only negativ is that the last few eggs and mushrooms are hard to find, so I spent about half an hour on that.

23671169.review:
★★☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆
I would say it's not a game, it's some kind of interactive animation. But, well, it's not animated. And it's also not interactive... 
This game has nothing in common with RPG genre (perhaps except the storyline, from zero to hero, which is often associated with RPGs). There is no character created by player and player has de facto no infuance of its further development. Story is 100% linear and you have literally zero options to choose, except skipping the whole game if you want to skip any particular task. Dialogues means just clicking and confirming predefined statements. 
In fact (from game's mechanics point of view) it's just casual economical game, based on simple rules of collecting and exchanging resources. It has even graphics similar to Settlers. But you cannot lost here. Even the battles cannot be lost! To join the fight you need to provide a specific number of resources (soldiers, tools, weapons, healing potions etc.). Encountered enemies will wait for you until you have all you need to start a fight and automatically win.
HotK is about 3,5h of gameplay (don't be mistaken by my 7h hours caused by idling scripts). Replayability factor equals zero due to linear story mentioned above.

23671153.review: This game can be a bit confusing and even boring at the beggining but after you play for a while and start to figure out how the mechanics goes it can surely become very interesting. The story itself is pretty classic, there's not exceptional to be added. Either way, it's enough to keep you motivated to carry on. As for the gameplay, I guess I'd call it a "resource manager RPG", especially because most of the time you need to go after this or after that in order to complete the given quests that are required to advance further on the story. The graphics are ok and the soundtrack can get old after a while so it's not a bad idea to have your own playlist available. There're also the trading cards and the achievements, so it's needless to say that it brings some added value. Overall, if you enjoy the casual genre, this title is for you.

It's worth your time and money

23413881.review:
Adı pek duyulmamış, ilk bakışta tırt gelse de gayet eğlenceli olan bir oyun bu oyun.

Oyunun en başında karakterin çiftliğini yakıp, babasını kaçırıyorlar. Bu andan sonra yavaş yavaş, çiftçilikten kahramana giden bir yolda yürümeye başlıyoruz. Ama öyle direkt savaşa koşarak değil; önce açlıktan ölmemek için yemek ve iş bulmaya çalışarak. Sonra babamızı bulmak için sorular sormamız ve bazı şehirlerden geçmemiz gerekiyor. Bu noktada da halkın güvenini toplamak için onlara yardımcı olmamız gerekiyor.

Oyun tamamen bundan ibaret. O yüzden kompleks bir şey beklemeyin; sade, eğlendirici ve güzel vakit geçirici bir oyun arıyorsanız bu oyun mükemmel bir tercih olacaktır.

+ Çok derin olmasa da oyuna yedirilmiş güzel bir hikaye var
+ Yukarıda bahsettiğim gibi, oldukça sade bir oynanışı var. Arayüz sade, yapmanız gereken şeyler net. (bazen fazla yüzeysel kalsa da bence genel olarak güzel bir şey bu)
+ Hiç beklemediğiniz bir şekilde sürükleyici bir oyun. Başlayınca bırakmak istememiştim.
+ Müzik, ortam sesleri ve grafikler; atmosfere uygun ve başarılı
+ Achievementlar gerçekten lüzumlu şeyler bekliyor sizden. Saçma achievementler yok.
- 5-6 saat gibi bir sürede bitiyor. Biraz daha uzun olabilirdi.
- Oyunun ikincisini çıkarttılar; hala diyaloglar sadece yazıdan ibaret. 2 seslendirmen tutun, hiç olmadı kendiniz seslendirin şunları.

23409908.review:
Ein nettes kleines Spiel mit einer Mischung aus Point&Click und Wimmelbild.

Man steuert hier keine Spielfigur, sondern klickt sich durch verschiedene Screens, wo man dann durch Auswählen von entsprechenden gelben Icons in der Szenerie agieren kann. Der Protagonist der Geschichte bleibt quasi im Hintergrund und taucht nur als Erzähler in Textform auf.

Aber nicht nur die gelben Icons lassen sich anklicken, sondern auch in der Landschaft versteckte kleine Objekte, wie zum Beispiel Krabben und Vogeleier. Während man diese Dinge ohne Energie und zusätzliches Material einsammeln kann, benötigt man für die Sachen mit den Icons in jedem Fall Energie, dazu teilweise diverse Behälter,  Werkzeuge und/oder Waffen. Diese Dinge muss man kaufen, dafür kann man seine gefundenen und gesammelten Sachen im Laufe der Geschichte an entsprechende Personen verkaufen. Auch lassen sich einige Dinge weiterverarbeiten, zum Beispiel  Kräuter zu einem Heiltrank.

Um in der Story weiter zu kommen, muss man verschiedene Quests erledigen, die meistens klischeehaft aus  ,Tue dies, tue das, bring mir dieses, hol mir jenes‘ bestehen. Das ist aber nicht weiter tragisch, sondern verleiht dem Ganzen einen eigenen Charakter, da der Protagonist bei Annahme und Abschluss einer Aufgabe seine Gedanken dazu mitteilt.

Die Geschichte selbst ist nicht besonders tiefgründig und in ähnlicher Form wohl schon unzählige Male zu finden. Es passiert etwas Böses und ein mutiger junger Mann zieht aus, wendet alles zum Guten und wird zum Helden. Happy End :)

Alles in allem fand ich das Spiel aber sehr unterhaltsam, es ist simpel aufgebaut und ich konnte mich fröhlich durch die Landschaft klicken. Die oft einfach gestrickten Quests konnten ohne weitere Schwierigkeiten gelöst werden und die spätere Suche nach den restlichen versteckten Objekten brachte nochmal etwas Abwechslung.

Wer es also mal etwas entspannter angehen lassen will, dem sei Hero oft he Kingdom empfohlen :)

Some simple stuff in this game: Gather this and that, trade this for that, keep a lookout for hidden objects in the scenery, rest when necessary; yet it never really grows old on you.

I don't know what else to say really, it's a surprisingly addictive game. And even though the main gameplay consists of gathering, trading and doing quests, the inclusion of some objects hidden cleverly in plain view makes for a game that keeps you engaged.

The story is pretty standard, but it's not bad by any means. And whether or not you're into the tropes of RPGs, the simple beauty of the graphics will certainly sway you.

I don't know why it's so charming, but I don't care really. This is a good game. And it's certainly worth five dollars. But if you're unsure, get it on a sale. If you like these kinds of games, you'll not regret it.


Edit::
I still recommend this game for its simple charm, but I should warn you that it's a very casual game. I managed to beat it in about three and a half hours, and earn the remaining achievements in 15 minutes. Granted, I'm the kind of guy who used to pick up Dark Souls and play it casually, so take from that what you want. Still, my point stands: This is a fairly easy game. But that doesn't make it bad. So again: Still recommended.

23089811.review:
"Hero of the Kingdom" ist... schwer einzuordnen. Vielleicht kann man es als storygetriebenes, recht lineares Ressourcenmanagement-RPG bezeichnen. Und das Ganze in Age of Empires-Ästhetik.

Wir leben mit unserem Vater auf einem landwirtschaftlich betriebenen Hof. Eigentlich unspektakulär. Eines Tages finden wir unser Haus von Banditen niedergebrannt vor und unser Vater ist unauffindbar. Ist er tot, wurde er entführt? Wir beginnen eine Reise in eine mittelalterlich geprägte, später auch mit Fantasy-Elementen angereicherte, uns noch unbekannte Welt, auf der steten Suche nach unserem Vater.

Die Mechaniken sind recht simpel gehalten. Auf verschiedenen Screens können wir auf Icons klicken, die Aktionen oder Gespräche auslösen. Aktionen kosten in der Regel Energie, manchmal auch Ressourcen. Für erledigte Aktionen erhalten wir meist wieder Ressourcen. Für erledigte kleine Quests, die meist mit Gesprächen beginnen, erhalten wir meist Gold und Sterne, mit denen wir unseren Ruf aufleveln können, was uns dann wieder neue Aktionen ermöglicht.
An bestimmten Orten gibt es Händler. Hinzu kommt, daß die Screens auch als Suchbilder fungieren. Es sind zum Beispiel kleinpixelige Pilze oder Vogeleier versteckt, die wir als Ressourcen einsammeln, indem wir draufklicken. Dabei kann man auch auf das meiste nur einmal klicken, dann ist es "abgebaut" und erledigt. 

Ein einfaches Beispiel: Mit einer Säge können wir vier Holz an einem bestimmten Ort gewinnen, das wir für die Reparatur einer  Brücke benötigen. Der Abbau kostet zwei Energie. Um die Brücke zu reparieren brauchen wir aber noch drei Arbeiter, die wir in einem Steinbruch gegen Gold anheuern können. Aber wir haben gerade zu wenig Energie zur Reparatur. Also können wir in einem Zelt schlafen und damit zehn Energie bekommen, was uns allerdings zwei Brot kostet. Nach der Reparatur erhalten wir Gold und Erfahrungssterne. Und so weiter und so fort.

Die Ressourcen sind zahlreich, die Mechaniken allerdings einfach und nicht schwer zu meistern. Streckenweise wird das Game etwas grindig, ohne aber daß die Wiederholungen zu anstrengend werden. Es bleibt stets machbar und simpel, denn nicht die Mechaniken, sondern die Geschichte steht im Vordergrund.

Und diese Geschichte funktioniert grandios. Sie ist sehr einfach, fast naiv erzählt und hat dadurch etwas märchengleiches, erinnert an die Gebrüder Grimm, an einfacher Bauersohn zieht in die Welt, erlebt Abenteuer und wird König. Die (nicht vertonten) Texte schaffen es erstaunlich leicht, einen hineinzuziehen in diese eigene und doch irgendwie vertraute Welt. 

Zudem stimmt einfach das Balancing zwischen Geschichte und Mechanik, das Pacing. Kein Part nimmt zuviel Raum ein und dadurch wird nichts wirklich langweilig. 

Die Grafik erinnert stark an Titel wie Age of Empires und das paßt herausragend gut. Zum einen ob des märchenhaften Settings, zum anderen ob der vielleicht vorhandenen eigenen Erinnerung an diese Titel, die aus der Kindheit stammen und dadurch automatisch etwas mit Naivität zu tun haben.

Die Musik ist schön, hält sich angenehm im Hintergrund und wird dadurch nie nervend, die Sounds, wie etwa Krähengrächze oder Pferdewiehern passen sich nahtlos in die schon in der Grafik realisierte Ästhetik ein.  

Ein erstaunlich starkes und süchtig machendes Paket, das einen vier bis fünf Stunden sehr gut zu unterhalten vermag.
 
[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
8/10 Atmosphäre
8/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
8/10 Spielmechanik
8/10 Balancing
8/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Es war einmal ein Bauerssohn, der auszog, Abenteuer zu erleben. Und diese Geschichte war verdammt unterhaltsam.

[h1][b]8/10 Gesamtwertung
