23006454.review:
Excellent little game! At first I was worried because of the way it took me by the hand during the first 5 minutes or so. But my worries dissipated after the game and quests opened up wide to allow some interesting decision-making. It was just the right level of challenge to complete all of the achievements. The story, although not very original or believable, is imersive and entertaining. 

I see people complaining about 2 things and I'd like to adress them. 
1 - "It's like a facebook game". People say that because of the energy system and kind of exploration + completing quests gameplay. Yes, the gameplay is really an interactive story with exploration, hidden objects, collection and trading, so be aware. On the other hand, it does not have those annoying time limits, inviting friends and premium currency. You don't even have to wait for your energy to be low to recharge it - there's no limit to how much energy you can carry so although it's not realistic, you can rest repeatedly and build up lots of energy to then do your actions. Also, this game has an END. It does not have seasonal events and added content. So I see a monstruous gap between this game and a facebook one, I love this game and hate the ones on facebook. Huge difference.

2 - "The game is too short". For the people who say that, I recommend a youtube video called "in defense of short games", from the channel Extra Credits. They explain it a lot better than I could write here. But basically if people keep on judging games only by the lenght of the gameplay, we will get longer games that provides us a poorer experience. Everybody knows at least one TV series of movie franchise that got streched to the point it became so bad it was not worth watching. We need to end this way of thinking. The lenght was perfectly fine for me. I finished the game in 2 sittings of about 3 hous each, reading every dialogue line and getting all achievements before ending the game. Isn't that enough gameplay? There are too many other games out there I'd like to experience before getting stuck with a single game that provides "endless gameplay" or something.

If I had to complain about one thing in the game, would be the pace of the action resolution sequences. Everytime an item drops, I need to collect it before moving on. Everytime I choose to perform an action, I need to wait until it is done to do something else. I'd like to be able to do several actions at once, clicking the next one before the previous one is completed, then collect their rewards. Or at least click several actions and "queue" them. It would make the game more dynamic. Also, the nighttime sequence is too long for something that will be repeated several times during the game.

9/10

22922600.review:
[b]Мне нужен свет, что привёл бы меня домой,
Мне нужен некто вроде героя. Это ты?[/b]

[i]Враги сожгли родную хату и надругались над амбаром! Поля истоптали, изуверы и поплевали, блин, в колодец. Вы юный фермер, что местью праведной воспылав, идет по следу душегубцев, попутно грибочки собирая, преимущественно – поганки. Иногда же и цветочки вы срываете с полей, под беззаботную мелодию и красноречивый взгляд крестьян – ну не псих ли? Но не важно что подумал тот конкретный НПС ведь важна лишь ваша цель – покарать бандитов подлых, вполне возможно что анально. Разве что путь-дорожка усеяна всяким разным людом, что стоит и помощи просит, ведь сами они ничего и не умеют. Вот, к примеру, мост над обрывом висит… ну как висит? Держится на честном слове. Рядом же рабочая шахта и бригадир, детина статный, просит вас, человека-соломинку, мост починить, дескать рабочих дома ждут дети-жены. Вот такой он, славный мир, где нам довелось оказаться. Все сидят на попе ровно и дожидаются героя, что спасет и не обидит. Ну так это нам и надо, разве нет? Ну так вперед и с песней, а еще и с мухоморами… Оу, кажись грибочки отпускают. Кто я? Где я? Где мой дом? Помогите!	[/i]
	
«Hero of the Kingdom» симпатичная игрушка казуального толка, которая привлекает внимание сразу же. Возможно все дело в графической составляющей, которая лично у меня вызывает ассоциации с «Heroes of Might and Magic III» ну или первым «Age of Wonders» тут уж кому что ближе. Возможно тут дело в том, что разработчики сделали ставку на разного рода собирательство и как только мы обчистим с дюжину локаций на предмет яиц и грибов, то нам говорят – а знаете есть еще травы, жемчужины и рыба, а то и вовсе дают в руки лук и отправляют охотится на оленей. Возможно кому-то это не понравиться, но я, как человек что облазил трилогию «Готики» вдоль и поперек в поисках всяких разных травинок, с увлечением искал на карте золото, крабов и всякий мусор. О да, можете не говорить, у меня на полочке уже стоит почетная премия Дарвина… хотя от второй не откажусь, да. Что же касается мира и квестов, то тут все достаточно стандартно, порой до зубного скрежета, но с другой стороны игра стилизована под сказку, где простой фермер оказывается спасителем человечества, а такие истории, при всей своей простоте, никогда не устареют. 

Итог? Хотел бы сказать больше, да не выйдет. Данная игруля простая, легкая и медитативная. Самое то, чтобы отдохнуть и расслабится после тяжелого рабочего дня, ну или взять перерыв от «игр гигантов». Так что если игра будет на хорошей скидки, то можете смело брать, а там кто знает, быть может вы даже в нее сыграете? В любом случае желаю удачи!

6 из 10 лютых гоблинов

22909403.review:
While this game is no RPG at all, it is worth the buy on sale. Full price is not really a fair buy, as the game is really short (I got all the achievements) and has no replay value at all. 

It is essentially a casual clicker game with some hidden object dimension in it (more below). You go on from map to map, gathering food, objects, speaking to uninteresting NPCs, and accomplishing some dull quests for them. Yet, the game is catchy, and you can finish it in a row as it keeps being entertaining. You cannot die nor make mistakes, it is pretty easy, but it's fun. 

To make some more money (necessary for quests) you can grab some objects hidden on the maps, such as mushrooms, fishes, crevices, eggs, and you can hunt animals. Strangely enough, becoming the Hero of the Kingdom also means plundering it from all its natural resources. This hidden dimension is nice as the objects have not been put randomly: eggs can be found in the forest or on cliffs, mushrooms are found near the woods. Everything makes sense. 

The story has no interest at all. They could hardly have done a less interesting one. Too bad as it would have make the game better.

Finally, the late game is tedious. You have to fish everything and hunt every animals, so you need energy and you spend most of your time sleeping. Repetitive fights (where a fight means gathering enough potions trhgouh trade and then automatically resolve it for a guaranteed win) are just utterly boring. Without the pleasure of discovering new areas as all the bad guys are found in already visited places, it looses all interest. 


Conclusion: A good game to buy on sale and spent a relaxing and entertaining yet too short time.

22903755.review:
Just finished it in 5 hours, so for total game time, I'd say that's pretty much the time it takes to finish the game, and all the achievements. 

That being said, shows a bit of replayability value. there isn't much to do once you're done. completely. Finish the last achievements, find some more mushrooms, sleep with meat a few more times, and trade until you have 5000 gold in total. 
But, it's like finishing a pokemon game completely. Finding all the pokemon, and levelling them to the max. Restarting the game from scratch seems like a waste to the time it took, and the story/adventure won't change much.

Graphic wise, it's quite good. Not too new of a graphics, but how all areas have small hidden things, like hidden pearls, and mushrooms in them (that you sometimes unlock by becoming a better herbalist) makes each area new, and abundant!

The story itself isn't too impressive. but it's fun, and not only can you quite often start doing side quests, and unlock special areas, you can also continue the story, and 2 screens further, another small bit of story is available, so almost all screens have a special story part. This means it's easily focussable on the next challenge, and you won't get lost in the quests and finding the solutions.

Gameplay: Gameplay in this game is what really drives the game itself forward. A lot of items that are clickable do not have an actually specific picture, like the trader, or a quest giver does. Sometimes, it's just a simple mushroom in the middle of a forest, that you can click. This means sometimes, boredly looking around actually rewards you. The actual movements aren't great, but it's kind of fun to see soldiers changing position, a few arrows all pointing towards a single enemy, and then moving on. Also, even though you're probably the same size as a normal npc in the game, the fact that you don't see yourself on screen kind of helps the immersion. YOU are the one that checks out the little clearing in the forest, to see if you can help save the lumberjack, and you are the one that decides to attack the boar. Strangely enough, if you would be a few pixels on the screen, you'd be too small to matter, but now, you really do.

Basically, I recommend it. I think since it's not too high in replayability, it's probably better to wait for a sale, but there's no definitive need for it. It's just a fun little game, that you can enjoy, until you're completely done.

22598739.review:
Hero of Kingdom ist ein Point and Klick Adventure, welches an einem Sonntagnachmittag durchgespielt werden kann.
Mit knappen 6 Stunden Spielzeit hatte ich es mit allen gefunden Quests durch und die meisten Errungenschaften erhalten.

Die Mechanik ist ziemlich simpel und kommt ohne Tutorial aus. Da man nie auf die Spielfigur warten muss, bis diesen an einem bestimmten Punkt auf der Karte angekommen ist, spielt es sich angenehm flüssig.
Durch die wirklich sehr einfach geschriebenen Dialoge und da keine Gewalt dargestellt wird, ist es meiner Meinung nach auch für sehr junge Spieler geeignet.
Das Kampfsystem kann man kaum als solches bezeichnen, sobald man alle Items zusammen hat, gilt der Kampf auch schon als gewonnen. Bis auf den Endkampf hat mich das aber nicht gestört. Im Dialog danach wurde erwähnt, wie gefährlich, anstrengen und aufwendig der Boss-Kampf war, ich als Spieler davon aber nichts mitbekommen habe, fand ich etwas schade.
Das Leveling-System gleicht dem von Gothic, Man kann keine Talentpunkte vergeben, sondern man erlernt bei einem Meister eine Fähigkeit und erhöht diese Level weise.

Fazit: Ich hätte mir etwas mehr Tiefgang gewünscht, anderseits hätte es wahrscheinlich an Einfachheit eingebüsst. Alles in Allem war ich einen Nachmittag prima unterhalten.

22004708.review:
Hero of the Kingdom es un juego casual que se disfraza de juego de estrategia y rol para presentarnos en realidad una aventura grafica de objetos ocultos y recolección de recursos.

Y le sale bien.

El juego es mas simple que el mecanismo de una pasa y casual a rabiar.. pero coño, es divertido, se te pasan las breves horas que dura el juego volando, sin parar de cliquear en la pantalla y cazando sprites como un loco. 

La formula narrativa y jugable imita a los juegos de rol y estrategia de la vieja escuela pero no es mas que un pretexto estetico para presentarnos una aventura grafica con una historia y un desarollo totalmente lineal y preconcebido de antemano. Tan solo se trata de dejarse llevar mientras se desarolla la historia, buscando objetos ocultos y recursos por el camino. 

Y ya esta. 

Asi de simple... y asi de entrenido. 

Porque entretener si que entretiene y por eso se convierte en un juego ameno y bastante recomendable. Sobre todo para esas ocasiones en las que no queremos pensar mucho o queremos descansar de otros juegos mas profundos. 

A veces lo simple funciona divinamente y este jueguecillo es un claro ejemplo de ello. 

[b] Oiga, soy una pasa. ¿ Como se atreve a decir que somos simples ?. [/b] 

 "Oh, callate pasa".

[b] ¿ Pasa ? ¿ A quien le esta usted llamando pasa ? ¿ Ein ? [/b] 

 "........".


6/10.

21968206.review:
This was one of the better casual games in my collection. It's mostly a point & click adventure with some RPG-like quests and trading built in. I appreciated what depth it did have without having something convoluted or difficult built in just to try to extend the playtime. The story is not complex, and it's fairly typical of this type of game, but it provided enough to give a feel of progression. I completed the game in one sitting as I was completely immersed in it.

I'm a big fan of this style of graphics. It has an older Ages of Empires or Stronghold feel to it. I enjoyed going between each area and completing quests just to see what all I'd see. The audio/music complemented the game well. It was just enough to make it enjoyable without being overbearing or out of place.

There is some backtracking to be done depending on what the quests require. Not everything is available the first time you visit a zone. The only annoying thing was the "Gather XX of Something" achievements. It just made it a grind and somewhat annoying, especially the eggs. It was like an Easter egg hunt without the color. Even so, I managed to complete the main quest and all of the other achievements within 7 hours.

The $5.99 price tag may be questionable for some. Casual is one of my primary game types, and for what this game has to offer, I could see paying it. However, I got this during one of the sales in 2014, and I don't regret buying it. If you're not sure if you should get it now or wishlist it for a sale later, there is a Demo available for you to try.

I have purchased [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/346560/]Hero of the Kingdom II[/url], so I will be playing that one next!

21684517.review:
http://intronerdedliving.blogspot.ca/2016/03/hero-of-kingdom-game-review-1010.html

Hero of the Kingdom - Game Review - 10/10

     Hero of the Kingdom is a casual point and click indie game for $7 on Steam. For a dollar value hour value, it lasted a little over seven hours which is right where I think a game should be priced. I don't play a lot of point and click games, so I took a chance on this one and was pleasantly surprised.

     This is one of my favourite types of art-styles to look at, so I thought this game was absolutely beautiful the whole way through. The music was enjoyable to listen to all throughout. The gameplay was simple and crisp. You get energy by resting, then use that energy as a resource to complete other tasks.

     One of my favourite parts of this game was as it introduced new things to you through tasks, you would be able to go back through previous areas and find things such as mushrooms or boxes hidden in the scenes. It was really quite fun to look through everything and complete the achievements, read the story, and play through this sweet little game.

     To anybody who enjoys a nice casual game, or a rest from their competitive games for a while, I definitely recommend this game. As usual, if you can get this on sale, it's even more worth the price.

     For me, this point and click game is a 10/10.

21491664.review:
Hero of the Kingdom - одна из немногих казуальных игр, которая захватывает внимание игрока не столько, может быть, сюжетом, сколько гемплеем, музыкой и графикой. Но, разумеется, история о пропавшем отце, о приключениях юноши, об опасностях, поджидающих его на каждом шагу, также не может оставить равнодушным человека, хоть раз сыгравшего в нее.  

Она влюбляет в себя. И, вроде бы, ничего особенного в ней нет - простенькая игрушка, незамысловатая, но стоит в нее поиграть, так не можешь и остановиться.

Есть еще один плюс - в этой игре нельзя проиграть.  Наверное, это тоже немаловажный аспект, о котором стоит упомянуть. 

Она неспешная; подобно реке спокойно несет игрока по течению, позволяя насладиться атмосферой.

Hero of the Kingdom заслуживает внимание всех любителей неторопливых и расслабляющих игр.

Aslında oynarken bir miktar eğlendiğimi itiraf etmeliyim ama neden olumsuz görüş bildirdim onu açıklayayım.

Bir defa oyun çok kısa 3-4 saatte biten bir oyun. Yalnız iyi ki de kısa çünkü oyun tam kararında bitmiş. Biraz daha uzun olsa sıkıcı olacaktı. 

Sonra efendim şu an 11 TL olan fiyatı yüksek. İndirim zamanlarında pek çok üst düzey oyun bu fiyatlara iniyor. Bu oyunun ederi en fazla 3-4 TL'dir. İyi bir indirime girerse düşünün derim. Alın demem.

Yine kısa süren ama her kuruşuna değen oyunlar var. Bu ise çok basit ve sonu belli bir hikayesi olan, oyuncuyu hiç bir açıdan zorlamayan ve hatta ne yapacağımızı açık seçik söyleyen bir oyun. Zorluk seviyesi bile yok. Belki oyun dünyasına yeni giren çocuklar için eğlenceli olabilir. İçerisinde savaş olsa da kan, vahşet gibi öğeler yok. 

Sonuç olarak biraz eğlenceli ama fiyatının ederi değil.

An interesting little game. While its a point-and-click, it also has some basic strategy elements and freedom of choice on particular aspects. The game follows the story of a farmer boy going after his father. I won't say anymore as to not spoil it, but even though it is kind of in your "standard medieval genre," I felt the story was in depth enough to make it stand apart.

Pros:
-Art/style/music was great
-Achievements were appropriate and interesting
-Has somewhat of a hidden object feel (you'll understand once you play)
-Contains RPG elements
-Fantastic story

Cons:
-A lot of back tracking and running around
-No list of current quests (that I could find/access)

Mehs:
-I'm pretty sure I popped a blood vessel trying to find the last blue shroom.

Overall: 9/10

21375826.review:
Wat een bijzonder (stom?) spel. "point and click"?  Maar dan even anders.., niveau "sesamstraat: zoek de de letter A en klik er op". Maar laten we eerlijk zijn; in de aanbieding voor 1euro en 20 centjes gekocht, toch een avondje geen TV hoeven kijken, en in plaats daarvoor eens hersendood op de muisknop kunnen rammen om mijn RSI-arm verder te ontwikkelen!

Het verhaal is nieteens heel verkeerd; Je bent een boerenknul die gedwongen op zoek moet naar zijn vader; je boerderij is in de fik gestoken door een stelletje crimineeltjes en nu sta je feitelijk helemaal alleen in de wildernis.

Om verder te komen moet je in bezit zijn van een zooi items of goud. Zo moet je bijvoorbeeld om te overnachten wat fruit of vlees hebben; of heb je stuk touw nodig om een brug te repareren die je bij een verkoper ergens kan kopen voor je zuurverdiende goudstukken. Dat laatste is absoluut noodzakelijik; je spullen die je hebt gevonden kan/moet je verkopen voor goudstukken; en hiervoor moet je van de ene naar de andere kant van de "wereld"; gelukkig kan je via een kaart snel van de een naar de andere lokatie.

Maarom heel eerlijk te zijn ben je de irritante dialoog-schermen en al dat zinloos heen-en-weer gereis na 20 minuutjes wel zat!

Kortom; niet heel super, maar misschien voor jou vermakelijk genoeg. (Ga absoluut nier op mijn mening af!)
In een cijfer uitgedrukt zou ik deze game een vette 4 geven.

21322561.review:
[h1]インタラクティブ絵本[/h1]
標題の通りの内容で、RTSやRPGではありません。それらを期待して買うとがっかりします。
やることは基本的に、人々の語る物語を読んでは画面の必要な場所をクリックする、それだけです。
そういう作品だと理解したうえで、セールで100円前後の値段なら、文句はないと思います。

この作品の良さは、牧歌的なアートワークと音楽、古典的な英雄譚、のんびりした仕様などが、ある種の美しさを醸し出していて、なんともいえない癒しをあたえてくれる点にあります。内容は、中世欧州ファンタジー的な世界を舞台にした若者の冒険と出世の物語。
寝る前にちょっと絵本読もうかなー的な、そんな気持ちに応える作品です。英文もフォントが大きめで、比較的平易な文章なので、読みやすいです。
実績も難しいものはないので、実績マニアさんにもおすすめ。

あえて言うなら、UIがやや利便性に欠ける点と、実績狙いだとちょっとだけ作業めいた繰り返しが必要になってしまう点がマイナス。

21296784.review:
80% 세일 하는중에 사서

별기대 없이 플레이를 해보았다.    내용이고뭐고 대충 하다보면 감이오게된다.

내용도 사실 별거없지만 영어를 알든 모르든 플레이하는데는 지장이 없다고 봐도 될정도이다.

필자는 천원 주고 샀기때문에 매우만족을 한다. 허나, 본래 가격을 주고사는것은 비추천한다.

9시간 가량을 훅 쏟아 부었지만. 실제 플레이한 시간은 길게잡아 5~6시간 정도 .

플레이 타임이 매우짧으나.   그렇다고 해서  강렬하지도 않기때문에 

주말에 여자친구도 없고 돈도 없어서 외식도 못하는 

불쌍한  인간의 주말을 빠르게 지나가게 해주는 정도.

일회용 게임이고. 절대. 네버. 레알. 혼또니. 제가격 주고 사는것은 비추한다.

포인트 & 클릭 이고 저사양 정말 할거 없을때 해보길 권장한다.

21273167.review:
盗賊に襲われて姿を消した父親の跡を追ううちに、王国を巡る陰謀に巻き込まれていくというストーリーのアドベンチャー。

大事なことなので2度言うが、見た目の通りのRPGやストラテジーではなく、ポイント＆クリックのアドベンチャーゲームである。

画面上の特定の場所をクリックすると「薬草」、「木材」などさまざまな素材を入手することができ、これを藁しべ長者方式の物々交換で先へ進むのに必要なアイテムに変えていくというのが基本的な流れ。
このアイテムを入手するためにはこの素材が必要で、さらにその素材を収集するためのスキル習得には、これこれの素材が必要で･･･という具合にややこしく連鎖しているのがミソか。


さほど難しいゲームではなく、根気よくポチポチしていれば5時間程度で終了するボリュームだが、意外な中毒性があって面白い。
フルプライスではちょっと辛いが、たまにかかっている80パーセントオフのセールを見かけたら、問答無用でカートに放り込もう。

- Ненавязчивая музыка.
- Игра проходится в среднем за 3 часа, что есть хорошо, так как игра не успевает надоесть.
- Интересная система экономики.

[h1] Минусы: [/h1]
- Я не нашёл.

Я прошёл игру за 4 часа, около 3 часов на сюжетную линию и примерно 1 час на поиск оставшихся предметов.


P.S. - Наверное, лучший начальный способ заработка золотых монет это - купить зерно у фермера (30 монет за мешок), на мельнице перемолоть зерно в муку (5 монет за мешок), обменять муку на хлеб у жены фермера продающего муку (6 буханок за мешок муки) и продавать хлеб жене фермера недалеко от каменоломни (буханка за 9 монет). 
В сумме выходит 19 монет прибыли с каждого мешка, таким образом можно себя обеспечить бесконечным кол-вом монет практически в самом начале игры.

Рекомендую данную игру.
5 золотых яиц из 5

20758254.review:
I can't say I've ever played a game like Hero of the Kingdom. It's something of an adventure game that gives you a birds-eye view of your surroundings and progresses through some simple mouse clicks. I have a hard time reviewing Hero of the Kingdom, because it's so forgetable. On the other hand, it is quite an enjoyable time-killer. 

Let me explain. Hero of the Kingdom is about a young man whose farm is burned to the ground--forcing him to journey out into the world to survive. From there the story becomes generic in almost every sense of the word. You'll fight skeletons, beasts and goblins before eventually taking on a dark wizard. While I can see that a lot of love went into this game, the writing could definitely be more original. 

The gameplay involves a lot of trading. You'll essentially be roaming around the various areas searching for items to sell or animals to hunt so you can get gold with which you can purchase supplies you need to further the story. While I played quite a bit of the game several months ago (I don't remember how long I played, but I remember accidently leaving the game running for a while, so my time played is off) and I didn't manage to get myself to finish it until a couple days ago. For me, the concept of constantly trading like in Hero of the Kingdom becomes tedious. Especially when you unlock every area of the game and it gets tough remembering where certain merchants and points of interest are. 

I'm afraid I can't give any input on the sound. It wasn't long into the game until I just played my own music over it. Despite all of this, I'm still recommending it. This game is a great time sink. While it did repetitive after a while, the first hours were pretty entertaining. It was actually rather fulfilling to trade my way up to the items I needed. While it's just not a game for me, I can definitely see Hero of the Kingdom appealing to fans of the genre. It was certainly a good time sink for me if nothing else.

20660948.review:
Hero of the Kingdom - это Point-and-click приключение, с текстовым повествованием и собирательством различных ресурсов. Хочется сразу отметить, что сие чудо не похоже ни на одну из современных игр и рассчитано на казуальную аудиторию. Здесь нет ни уровней сложности, ни прокачки, ни морального выбора - все довольно прямолинейно и просто.

Сюжет повествует о простом парне, который жил на ферме в глуши королевства со своим отцом, мать которого скончалась вскоре после родов. Отец паренька отправился в город по делам, а сынок остался один. Проснувшись, вы занимаетесь обычной работой на ферме, собирайте травы в поле, урожай с грядок и строите вышку, разрушенную грозой. Ничего не предвещает беды, как тут вы замечаете дым со стороны дома и улепетывающих бандитов. Дом сгорел, но ничего не украдено, вы беспокоитесь за отца и отправляетесь на его поиски, а также отомстить бандитам за содеянное. Так начинается приключение юного героя.

Чтобы добраться до отца и отомстить бандитам, мы будем заниматься различной работой, которую дают нам местные поселенцы. Работа поначалу будет не пыльной, например, собрать трав для старой женщины или отнести обед рыбаку, переданный, его женой. Далее будут квесты поинтереснее, поиски пропавшего человека или разгадка тайны призрака. Все зависит от вашей внимательности. Система экономики выполнена в игре на ура, вы можете купить мешок зерна и перемолоть в мельнице, получив мешок муки, вы бесплатно получите у местной кухарки 6 буханок хрустящего хлеба, которые можно обменять у представителей различных профессий на интересующий вас товар. Есть в игре и постройка, нужно всего лишь нанять пару рабочих рук, купить или добыть самостоятельно необходимые материалы, и вуаля, мост готов, а за ним новая локация или получение награды. В игре есть система сбора предметов. На локациях, самые внимательные соберут все птичьи яйца и грибы. По мере получения знаний у рыбаков, знахарей и охотников, будут появляться новые предметы для сбора, что повлечет за собой, проверку зачищенных локаций на наличие редких грибов и отлову ящиков, канувших в лету. Бои здесь тактические и не представляют сложности, мы так же, как и в строительстве, собираем нужное нам снаряжение, нанимаем охотника, восстанавливаем силы за счет сна в палатке и идем охотиться на медведя. 

Визуально игра напоминает холст с нарисованной картиной, художники отлично справились с работой. Динамических объектов нет, все неподвижное, с наложенным на картинку интерфейсом, который и являет собой большую часть игрового процесса. Пейзажи, начиная с зеленых полей и озера, заканчивая городом и гнетущими болотами с кладбищем, заставляют окунуться в этот живописный мир и не отпускают до конца истории.

Музыкальное сопровождение приятное и максимально точно подходит миру. Здесь бьют барабаны племен ящеробразных людей на болотах, на полях лютня местного калеки бренчит под пенье птиц, а на кладбище подвывает упырь. Для каждой локации музыка подобрана с идеальной точностью, что дополняет атмосферу.

Итог таков: Hero of the Kingdom классное приключение на один вечер, в котором все сделано с душой. Отдельно хочу отметить отличное визуальное оформление. Советую всем ценителям квестов и просто расслабляющих игр.

20353548.review:
Hero of the Kingdom was a game I had seen around and mentioned occasionally. I saw it for almost nothing during a sale so I grabbed it and went into it basically blind. I have no regrets. 

I found myself unable and unwilling to hop off the game once I got started and finished it in the same sitting. It took me around 6 hours from start to finish inclusive of all achievements. For an older game with a very basic art / game play style I found Hero of the Kingdom to be a fantastic little adventure even when the story became very cheesy towards the end. Everything requires minimal thought and I breezed through the game satisfied at all times with the progression and events. 

If I had to point out any flaws I'd say the difficulty and the lack of replay ability. Honestly though, for what I paid I feel as if I've ripped the developers off. It was a great game and worth every penny. If you find yourself in the mood for a simple adventure / RPG / point and click game. Look no further, this game scratches all those itches. 8/10

20100378.review: Having played the demo and not expected much of this game, I picked it up in a sale, and would recommend that people should do the same: you don't inhabit the lead character, and the main story is not gripping, but I found it very difficult to stop playing as new things to do and new loot to grab make you want to go further. After you learn a new skill, you can revisit earlier areas and apply skills and new knowledge there (in fact this is encouraged, if not too overtly), meaning that the at first seemingly linear story-telling fleshes itself out with gameplay that can broaden the depth of what you want to do in game, in a rather appealing way - it is not challenging, by any stretch, but it does require a modicum of thought, and, in my opinion, rewards people who like to get everything out of this kind of game.

20034731.review:
Poco o nada le falta a Hero of the Kingdom para ser el fiel reflejo en el videojuego de la película Big Fish (Tim Burton).
Y es que en el título de Lonely Troops, en tono de point'n'click rolero, lo que no sobran precisamente son aventuras tan inverosímiles y extraordinarias como en la cinta del genial y excéntrico cineasta norteamericano.
"No tenía palabras para los elogios de mi padre y del rey, tan solo me sentía feliz, agotado, pero feliz de haber vivido grandes aventuras y salvado a tanta gente" ...esta frase del joven protagonista huérfano de madre, bien resume lo que el jugador se va a encontrar en el desarrollo de la partida.
En cuanto al apartado técnico no tiene sploits jugables que acorten la partida o arruínen la experiencia, si bien el juego dota al jugador de un sistema de mercadeo con el que solucionar los posibles problemas de monedas, comidas, utensilios o pociones.
Respecto a la duración, en 5-6 hrs. tendrás finiquitada la odisea del hijo en busca de su padre con todos los logros sacados.

Coste: 0,07 eur

19712670.review:
El juego me ha sorprendido gratamente, lo recomiendo.

Es un juego que basicamente consiste en point & click. (vas clicando con el raton a diferentes elementos del escenario)
¿Cual es el gameplay del juego? El juego no es un juego de estrategia clasico (no hay construcciones, ni mejoras de efidicios, ni guerras, ni gestionar un ejercito), ni de recolectar recursos indefinidamente, es cierto que hay que recolectar objetos e ir a cazar (mas clicks), pero todo sirven para seguir avanzando, el juego basicamente te cuenta una trama, algo cortita, lo cual es perfecto si deseas un juego nuevo para  jugar un fin de semana.
Tiene unos graficos muy bonitos, continuamente perspectiva isometrica, y el sonido (musica y efectos) son muy muy agradables y rapidamente nos sumergen en la edad media, y en el campo. 
Empezamos por una esquina en el mapa, y mediante la realizacion de misiones, vamos desbloqueando el camino para encontrar a nuestro padre, que esa es la meta final. 
La jugabilidad esta muy balanceada, no nos sentimos perdidos en ningun momento, la sensacion de reto es constante, nos sentimos picados y curiosos por saber que es lo que pasara. Y sabe mantener enganchado. Se nota que es un juego hecho con mimo.
El español del juego es de calidad, la traducción es bastante buena, y mantiene ese "feeling" (sentimiento) de novela.
El juego me salio por 1,49 €, 100% recomendado si lo encuentras por menos de 2 €. Si ya es mas caro, que suele costar unos 6 €, pues ya depende si te gusta mucho el genero.
Me he pasado el modo historia, y despues puedes seguir trabajando para conseguir todos los logros.

19676398.review:
Jeu que j'ai obtenu dans un bundle et dont je ne me serais pas souciée en tant normal, n'étant pas une férrue de jeux casual style objets cachés. Mais bon je n'aime pas gacher la marchandise et comme il était dans ma bibliothèque autant se le faire. On notera au passage 2 plus : les cartes à échanger et les succès steam (facile pour obtenir un 100%).

J'avoue que une fois commencé la partie, je n'ai pu m'en détacher donc même en étant des plus simplets, l'histoire n'ayant rien de très folichon et les paroles du style "youpiii j'ai vaincu le grand méchant boss" il a quand même un petit côté attachant et un je ne sais quoi d'addictif malgré tout.

J'aurais pu le terminer en 4h si le steam cloud aurait fonctionné comme il faut ! Je l'avais à moitié terminé hier sur mon pc portable mais quand je l'ai lancé ce midi sur mon autre pc, j'ai du redémarrer une nouvelle partie à zéro car rien n'avait été synchronisé ni sauvegardé.

Le but du jeu : rien de très compliqué retrouver votre père enlevé par "des méchants bandits" et par la même occasion sauver le village. Pour ce faire vous voyagerez de tableaux en tableaux (fixes vous ne rencontrerez aucune animation à part des étoiles scintillantes quand vous irez dormir ou quelques flèches lancées lors de combats) afin de remplir certaines quêtes pour lesquelles il faudra acheter des objets spécifiques.

En parallèle vous devrez trouver dans le décor des champignons, des oeufs, des caisses ou tonneaux et chasser ou pêcher mais ne vous y méprenez pas... ici vous ne dirigerez aucun personnage, ni pointerez votre viseur sur un cerf prêts à faire feu, ou poserez un hammeçon sur votre ligne. Tout est fixe comme dans une majorité de jeux d'objets cachés vous devrez cliquer et cliquer encore sur des éléments du tableau.

Que dire de plus ? Je crois que j'en ai fais le tour, un jeu sympa pour passer le temps zen et détendu un dimanche de grisaille. Plutôt à conseiller à des enfants ou des mamies facebookiennes accrocs à leur candycrush ou leur farmville.

19582432.review:
I like some hidden object games, so thought I'd give this one a try. It has a rather interesting storyline, plus it's fairly easy to figure out. It's click based, so you select the items to complete tasks and collect other items to complete other tasks.

I actually found it interesting and fun to try and find all the hidden items that were in the map areas. Eggs in a nest, different types of mushrooms, fishing, finding lost crates or barrels and even hunting some animals. 

Making sure to have the required things to do a task, like the right amount of health, the tool or weapon and such is a good idea, as it would be easy to try and go after something with low health if you don't check it.

Overall I found it rather enjoyable, a fair game to play here and there without having to commit hours to it and it has an end. Far too many of the games I play, don't have an end in sight. They are MMORPGs, so this game was a fun casual romp that offered a break from the far more intense gaming sessions.

Hope you found this helpful in some way and if you like hidden objects, give it a look.

Un jeu qui manque d'envergure. Tout y semble minuscule, chétif, gringalet, obsolète et dépassé.
On va à droite pour cueillir de l'herbe, on revient à gauche pour assister à l'atterrissage de trois flèches dans le décor (c'est l'animation qui figure un combat acharné) et on repart se coucher parce que « Bouh, je suis éreinté par cette folle journée, moi ». La quête principale est toute tracée et les annexes sont signalées par de grands idéogrammes jaunes !
Il faut faire attention à bien aider tout le monde pour accumuler des richesses et de la réputation et suivre une quête qui n'a d'ascension héroïque que le nom ; on se croirait plutôt dans le résumé scolaire d'une aventurette de fantasy étriquée.
Comprenez-moi bien, je ne suis toujours pas cet amateur de jeu d'action et d'effets qui réclament des cartes vidéo de dernière génération mais, avec HotK, je n'ai même pas eu le sentiment de m'amuser, juste aligner les clics de souris... Dommage.

Ist nach irgendnem Sale plötzlich in der Bibliothek aufgetaucht - kann es eigentlich unmöglich bewusst gekauft haben, ein Point&Click Adventure und eher was für Zwischendurch.

Am liebsten würde ich sagen, kein Spiel welches man wirklich spielt, eher eine Art Buch, aber wenn man dann doch mal loslegt führt eine Quest zur nächsten und nach jedem neuen Weltabschnitt kommt ein genauso hübsch gezeichneter und ehe man es sich versieht ist man durch und trotzdem noch motiviert jede Karte nach Pilzen, Eiern und änlichem abzusuchen...

Die Geschichte ist nett erzählt, vom Anspruch eine Kindergeschichte, aber sehr stimmig und irgendwie möchte man dann doch wissen wie es zuende geht. 

Der Handel ist nicht komplex und die Quests sind es auch nicht, perfekt für einen ruhigen Abend und auf alle Fälle besser geeignet zum Abschalten und Entspannen als so manche Filme im Abendprogramm.

Für den Preis von 5,99€ nicht empfehlenswert, da gibt es dann doch richtige Bücher mit schönen Bildern und besseren Geschichten, aber im Sale für nen kleinen Obolus kein Fehlkauf.

19218613.review:
Very small and simple, but charming game with relaxing gameplay and beautiful art style. You move from one screen to another, interacting with characters, accomplishing quests and gathering various resources all over the map.
Story is simple and naive, but there lies its charm. Young man, whose farm was burned by bandits, is trying to take revenge on this thugs and find missing father. This story offers no surprises, but develops logically and well designed.

There is open world, you can more or less freely move around the map. On the other hand, the world is very small and it is impossible to get lost here. Quests do not shine with diversity, they just fit into formula "find something somewhere and bring it for someone". There is no variations in dialogues and you can not choose answers of your character, events are completely linear. But, as i said, story is well designed, it is interesting enough to follow the storyline and completing the quests gives you a nice feeling of progress.

There is a lot of quests and sometimes i really missed something like journal where it would be possible to see the list of active quests and their description. On the other hand, as i said, the map is small and you can walk through locations in seconds so, if you forget what people asked you to bring, it is not difficult to find active characters again and re-check what you need to do.

Sometimes, game lacks logic. For example, to kill a boar you need a dagger. You do not have a dagger but have a sword and bow with arrows? Well, then you can not kill the boar, go and find yourself a dagger. Why i can not hunt this poor pig with arrows? Game offers no answer.

Eventually, your character will learn skills to collect pearls, hunt wild animals, gather algae and so on. There is plenty of hidden items that can be collected and sold to merchants - eggs, mushrooms, treasures, crawfish... all this objects are very small and usually are well hidden, so gathering turns into annoying and merciless pixel-hunting. This is bad for eyes for sure! Fortunately, if you do not want to complete all achievements then it is not necessary to seek for hidden objects.

There is no way to lose the game, i just can not invent a situation in which you can get stuck. Abundance of resources means that you will always find something that you can sell and earn some coins. Storyline can be completed in four or five hours but, of course, if you want to collect all the mushrooms, then pixel-hunting can detain you for long. After you had finished storyline, you can continue to play and solve incompleted quests and achievements. But there is no random events, enemies and resources do not respawn, so game offers no replayability.

Anyway, game is very well designed and i can safely recommend it to anyone who seeks for relaxing and casual gameplay. Hidden gem. Very small and inexpensive gem, in fact. But still a gem.

19051731.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is an odd game, but an entertaining game. Is it worth $6? No. It's far too short to be worth $6. But if it is on sale, definitely consider it.

HotK is a very casual point and click experience that is reminiscent of old multiplayer browser games like, "Wild West" i believe it was called. [b]If you don't appreciate casual storytelling experiences, then do yourself a favor and leave this game's store page immediately.[/b] There's not much to explain about how the game works other than that you click on some icons that represent activities, spend or acquire resources by doing so, and progress in the story or progress in acquiring the resources you need to progress. That's all the game is. Do story missions, run out of resources, do side activities for money and resources, rest to replenish HP, and repeat. To be very honest, this formula grows stale around the ending, even if it is a short game. 

So is HoTK worth playing? Yes. There are no major points to review as pros or cons really and it is literally absent of bugs from what I experienced. If the features appeal to you then pick it up today. [b]The FINAL VERDICT[/b] will be based on its status as a GAME, not in comparison to Triple A titles that obviously out-do it. And for that verdict I'd give it an 7/10. It wasn't perfect, but it was fun. If it could have been a bit longer and had some extra gameplay mechanics it would have been better. Note you'll get about 3 hours out of it if you stick to grinding story alone, maybe 4 if you go for acheivements. Keep that in mind if you ever plan on picking this title up.

Steam上全成就的第二个游戏，写个测评纪念下吧。

总的来说比我的期待要高出不少。

本来只是因为中世纪的画风所以才+1的，但实际玩下来还算比较畅快的，属于那种点点点就停不下来的类型，故事流程也不长，一半天就能通。画面和音乐都挺不错的，算不上优秀，但还是挺舒适的，尤其对喜欢中世纪风格的玩家来说。

说点小提示：
[spoiler]1. 前期可能会比较缺钱，可以等到了第一个城镇后买点水果，然后返回家门那张图，找到左边房子的NPC（就是你第一个伙伴的妻子），把水果卖给她，一个能赚1块钱的差价，但别刷太多够用就可以了，等中期后有100种方法让你钱花不完。
2. 前期通过水果回体力比较划算，这个阶段不要打猎（除了任务需要的），后期到了猎人营地后可以开始通过肉来回体力（后期最划算的手段），这时候开始再去打猎。
3. 包里始终保持5个左右的面包，不少任务会用到。
4. 打猎一些副产品像各类毛皮、鹿角这些，还有后期的各种珠宝首饰，螃蟹河蚌，都能全部卖钱，没其他用处。[/spoiler]

要说不满意的地方的话，这个成就完全是考眼力，要满世界满地图找特定的一些物品，比如蘑菇鸡蛋之类的，我为了找最后一个成就item花了一个多小时的时间。

This is a very casual rpg game using point and click interactions. There are some side quests in the game, and a simple plotline that's easy to follow. I honestly didn't expect much when I started playing, but the game was surprisingly easy to immerse yourself into. The game itself calls for some degree of knowing how to utilize your current resources, and planning out how to gain future resources. And the constant to and fro barter system, along with seeking out resources along the map, might seem a tad tedious to some people. 

But, all in all, I would say that this is the game for someone looking for some relaxing and fun gaming.

18901010.review:
This isn't by any means a bad game, but it doesn't really have much going for it, either. This feels like a point-and-click adventure, where the only thing you can click is progression (or a collectible). For me, at least, the point of point-and-click games is puzzling your way through it, rather than mindlessly clicking whatever bright gold sparkly icon shows up next on the screen. The little hidden object collectibles are interesting, and I think probably the thing that kept me playing the longest, since they respawn after enough time has passed.
I would like to acknowledge that the music in this is actually pretty fantastic, though. There are definitely a few things about this game that are amazingly well implemented (fast travel through that map? THANK YOU), and while this feels like a completed game, it just doesn't feel very compelling. The stilted dialogue doesn't help, either. Especially when the boy is all "I have to revenge my father!" That may have been the deciding factor for my not recommending this, actually.

18592732.review:
[h1]Appetit kommt eben doch manchmal erst beim essen....[/h1]

Ich hab mir das Spiel damals mal irgendwann im Angebot geholt, als es noch recht frisch für SteamOS, respektive Linux, erschienen ist. Davor wartete es bereits länger auf der Wunschliste, weil ich ein RPG für zwischendurch suchte. 
Vor ein paar Stunden dann also endlich mal - Installation.
Starten.
Das Spielprinzip erscheint in den ersten Minuten offen gestanden ziemlich langweilig und eintönig. (Prinzipiell ist es das auch. ;-) ) 
Dennoch glaube ich, dass gerade in dieser Einfachheit eine gewisse Stärke dieses Titels liegt. 
"Sammle hier und da dieses und jenes ein."

Hero of the Kingdom ist kein grafisches Wunderwerk, das sieht man an den Screenshots. Im Grunde genommen ist es eigentlich "nur" ein Wimmelbild/Point & Click-Adventure mit einem Hauch von RPG-Elementen. 
So vage bzw. unsicher ich hier formuliere, so unsicher bin ich mir tatsächlich, warum der Titel definitiv seinen Reiz hat. Nach aktuell 3.8 Stunden ist das Spiel durchgespielt. Bis auf zwei der 28 Errungenschaften plätscherten alle anderen mehr oder weniger beiläufig beim Spielen herein, ohne dass man sich groß hätte anstrengen müssen. 

Ich denke, was das Spiel wirklich ausmacht, ist seine Story. Zugegeben, diese ist nun nicht wirklich innovativ oder mit vielen "Aha" oder "Hört, hört" - Momenten gespickt, aber so wie sie präsentiert wird, ist sie glaubhaft (für RPG Verhältnisse) und der Erzählstil wird konsequent durchgezogen. Amüsant wie irritierend ist dabei die Art und Weise, wie die Story vermittelt wird. Ich war mir nicht sicher, ob ich gerade ein Spiel für Menschen von 6 - 10 Jahren spiele, oder ob sich die Erzählung selbst nicht so ganz ernst nimmt. 

Sinngemäße Aufgabenstellung eines Obst[u]händlers[/u]:
[i]"Kannst Du bitte diese Lieferung Obst an den Besitzer des Gasthauses an der Kreuzung bringen? Ich traue mich nicht, weil ich es längst liefern sollte. Ich habe Angst, dass er mich anschreit."[/i]

Situationsbeschreibungen, Monologe oder Aufgabenstellungen wie diese lassen einen mehr als einmal schräg schauen und mit gequältem Grinsen das obligatorische WTF murmeln.

Das schöne an der ganzen Kiste ist aber, dass dieser Stil dermaßen konsequent und überzeugt durchgezogen und durchgehalten wird, so dass ich das Spiel

a) für jeden RPG interessierten Nachwuchs zwischen 6 und 10 Jahren bedenkenlos empfehlen kann und
b) als einhundert Prozent stimmig bewerte. 


Wieder einmal sehe ich mich in meiner These bestätigt, dass es nicht die Grafik ist, die ein Spiel interessant macht, sondern die Spieltiefe. Wenn der Singleplayer-Modus eines Spiels in der Lage ist, mich zu fesseln, indem er mir eine stimmige Symbiose aus Story, logischem Spielablauf, Sound und Atmosphäre bietet - wer braucht da zwingend eine bombastische Grafik?


Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: Wer was nettes für Zwischendurch sucht, dem kann ich Hero of the Kingdom auf jeden Fall empfehlen. 

Lohnt sich der Kauf? Ich denke ja. Es gibt nicht zuletzt durch die erreichbaren ( noch ausstehenden) Errungenschaften einen gewissen Drang zum Wiederspielen... ;-)

18591897.review: Real cool RPG/Hidden Object/Narrative game. Its very easy to get into, I'm a pretty big gamer but the average person who likes fantasy stories will like it. Love the backgrounds, music/sfx is good, story is great. Enjoy!

18587592.review:
This game is awesome, and not just because it was made by my counrtymen :)

It's not exactly an RPG, it's more like a point-and-click adventure with RPG elements and HOG elements. There's a "farmboy has to leave home, ends up saving the world" story, you go out and explore the locations, discovering resources and actions. Each golden icon on the map is an action (like fishing), which needs some resources: tools (fishing rod), consumables (bait) and stamina. You talk to people, help them, learn new skills, all the while searching for your father, who's been taken by bandits.

Three hours of casual fun to reset your brain after an honest day's work. Go for it, you'll come back for a replay.

Hero of the Kingdom es un juego al mas clasico estilo Point & Click and Hidden Object.

Nos presenta la historia de un tipico chico de granja que se ve envuelto en medio de una cruzada por las fuerzas oscuras que quieren gobernar el reino, convirtiendose en poco a poco un problema para cada habitante. 

Desde asesinatos, asaltos, incendios hasta el rapto del padre del protagonista.

Es una buena historia muy bien planteada que te hara terminarlo de principio a fin y claro, consiguiendo todos los logros.

Es de corta duracion 3-5 horas, pero la musica ambiental que trae consigo te hara sentir muy comodo y relajado, sin lugar a dudas es el tipo de musica que todos quieren escuchar al despertar.

Tomando en cuenta la calidad de la historia, los graficos, el grado de dificultad que tienen los objetos escondidos y una que otra quest escondida asi como la musica se lleva un 9/10

This is one of those casual games that has just enough complexity to keep a child of eight years entertained. It's pretty much a clickfest with a "I'm a farmboy and I must save my dad!" story. No real 'combat' or 'crafting', just 'Make sure you have enough things to do the thing before you try the thing'. There's a little bit of "hidden object" gameplay thrown in as well, and as small as these objects are, they still pop out well enough if you know what you're looking for.

It's short, it's sweet, it's not-perfectly translated from Slovak. Buy it if you have kids, or even for yourself if you're suffering from just the teensiest bit of MMORPG ennui.

18373733.review:
One of the negative reviews calls this an RPG for people who hate RPGs, which isn't unfair, but also isn't necessarily a bad thing. The story is an archetypal (read: generic) WRPG, but with casual gameplay based on gathering resources to earn money and solve quests. For combat, you're required to gather certain weapons, health potions, allies, etc., but you don't actually play through the combat itself, and there's no risk of losing or death.

Recommended for fans of hidden object games and the exploration parts of isometric RPGs. Not recommended if you're looking for an actual RPG.

18288602.review:
This game is a Point&Click adventure where you wear the shoes of a young farmer, who eventually leaves the nest in search of something more, fighting dangers and paving he's way to the success.
The basics of the game are: every action you do consumes energy, you gain energy resting, you can rest if and only if you have food. Plain simple. You can acquire food by harvesting it or buying it, same way you can acquire many usable objects.

I had fun playing it, even though I will never play it again.
The full price is 5,99€, and I find it quite expensive, considering what digital delivering can sell us nowdays, for the same amount. 
This is a very casual game, with a decent plot and a good variety of tasks to go through. However, there isn't much to do other than completing the main quest: while there will be many possibilities to gain extra rewards, each of these isn't very satisfying, nor will take us occupied more than few minutes.
Acceptable sound and graphic department, nothing remarkable or despicable regarding the gameplay.

Buy it if you're a casual gamer, and aged gamer who wishes something calm and relaxed, or if you just prefer games where reflexes don't matter.
At the end of the day, I recommend Hero of the Kingdom because I could see the developer(s) have made an actual effort to polish the game: there is a decent amount of graphic options and a good autosave feature, which will come in handy whenever the game will crash because of some incompatibility with the Steam Overlay (Writing the review in April 2015, I played it a month ago).

If you need ratings:
Graphic: 6/10
Sound: 7/10
Longevity: 4/10
Gameplay: 7/10

Overall: 6/10

[quote]
A "clicker" type of game as it should be made.

[h1]It's about:[/h1]
[list]
[*]boy saving his father from bandits;
[*]exploring, looking for adventures, reading and clicking (a lot).
[/list]

[h1]Why you should play this:[/h1]
[olist]
[*]unlike many other "clicker"-games it's not linear and draggy:
[list]
[*][i]you not going from level to level cleaning them up one by one[/i];
[*][i]you not clicking empty-headed all active objects around the area[/i].
[/list]
[*]instead, game offers the world divided on zones, which you need to explore, and light RPG elements:
[list]
[*][i]peasants ask for help, some of them later teach you some skills or become traders[/i];
[*][i]you need to earn money and obtain different equipment for fighting, hunting, fishing, gathering etc[/i].
[*][i]non-active, but collectable objects (eggs, mushrooms, lost crates) provide some sort of pixel-hunting making the game more various and gambling[/i].
[/list]
[*]simple, but interesting story;
[*]short-budget, but pleasant graphic style with authentic soundtrack (melodies change depending on location).
[/olist]

[h1]Why you may not like it:[/h1]
[olist]
[*]it might seem to be too easy: you obtain fortune too soon and it's harder to find non-active collectable items than complete the main quest;
[*]it would be a nice idea to point out traders on global map, because on later stages it's not comfortable to remember who sells what.
[/olist]

[i]An evolution of "clicker"-games, talented mix of point-and-click, light elements of RPG, strategy and management, covered with pixel-hunting - making all other games of this genre look obsolete and degenerative.[/i]
[/quote]

18251000.review:
Très bon PETIT jeu, mélangeant des élements de Point-And-Click avec des élements RPG.

-- PERSONNAGE
Le personnage a 3 grandes compétences qu'il fait évoluer en parallèle pour pouvoir avec accès à des ressources nouvelles sur la map.
Pas de fiche perso, pas de statistique.
La seule VRAIE RESSOURCE est la vigueur (ou force) = C'est un ressource cumulable indiqué par un coeur. Vous en avez assez ? Vous pouvez faire votre action ! Il vous en manque ? Allez dodo quelque part et revenez ensuite !

-- HISTOIRE
L'histoire est sommaire, mais on n'en attend pas plus.

-- FACON DE JOUER
On se déplace sur des maps prédeterminée, et chacune est remplie de PNJ ou de ressources INDIQUEES, et NON INDIQUEES. N'hésitez donc pas à cliquer sur certains élements décoratifs car ils peuvent grandement vous aider pour la suite ! Et pensez au voyage rapide via la carte !
Le concept de gestion de sa "fortune" (plutot, de ses quelques pièces d'or) modifie totalement la durée de vie du jeu, et une mauvaise gestion peut vous amener à tourner en rond pendant longtemps.
Pas de combat "temps réel", ce sont des animations si les préréquis sont remplis.

-- HEURE DE VIE
Pour finir la trame principale, j'ai mis 3 heures en train des pieds...
Puis il reste les quêtes accessoires.



Un bon petit jeu, à prendre surtout s'il est bradé.
ATTENTION TOUTEFOIS A AVOIR UNE BONNE VISION sinon le jeu va vous paraitre hyper relou (Presbyte s'abstenir)

18180870.review:
Hero of the Kingdom quickly became one of my favorite chillout games ever. Part adventure game, part trading game, part hidden object game, it has a simplistic charm and a complete lack of urgency that makes it a joy to fool around with.

You play as some hapless farm kid whose father goes off to market. Bandits burn your farm down and kidnap Dad so its up to you to journey all the hell over the kingdom to save him. This involves a bit of fighting and a lot of trading goods, building things, and helping the mostly useless peasants out with their problems. The game plays out on static screens that look rendered right out of the Stronghold HD engine. New things to do appear as golden icons and can be anything from talking to people, hunting wildlife, gathering herbs, camping, scouting, battling, and so on. Every activity has a requirement in terms of energy (replenished by sleeping), gold (earned from jobs and such), and items found or bought. There are no time limits, no RNG, and every trade seems to at least break even for you, so there's no way to fail anything.

There's a huge amount of stuff to do as you progress, because you can earn yourself new skills that give you access to new activities. There's also a hint of hidden object game to it, because each screen has little collectibles like eggs and crates to click on for bonus resources. You can hunt for lots of "secrets" in the game that take the shape of items, quests, and even hidden parts of the map. It's not a terribly long game, maybe 3 hours or so to beat, but if you want to go completionist on its many achievements you'll get another few hours out of it. Hero of the Kingdom was a perfect way to wind down between more involved games and I'm definitely going to pick up the sequel sometime.

Oh, and there's a demo if you're still on the fence after reading this. But come on.

17923489.review:
This game is pretty freaking awesome considering what it is. Hero of the Kingdom feels like a game that you might find on facebook. But it is actually an interesting little gem, with quite a lot to offer, a fairly interesting storyline, beautiful, but simple, graphics, and on top of all that a pretty neat collectathon going on. Many of the achievements are linked to collecting certain items within the game, so it becomes a bit of a search and find game, which was fine by me since I love that kind of thing.

Hero of the Kingdom isn't just an adventure game, you can trade between different people in different locations to make a decent amount of money, and you have to balance the amount of money you have as well as the items you have in order to complete certain quests.

I have 100% all of the achievements in the game, as well as completed all of the collections and all of the side and main quests, and have done so in just about 4 hours. That's the only complaint I have with this game, it's far too short. But the amount that it cost is, at least in my opinion, worth the amount of time you're going to get out of it. I know it says I've spent 30 hours in game, but that's only because it let's you click out of the screen, which I did and completely forgot about for an entire night. 

If you're into midievil adventure games, you might want to give this game a shot. I would give it a 7/10.

17719695.review:
Noticias de última hora: los videojuegos son una pérdida de tiempo. Lo siento. No, ese estudio del Instituto Nacional de Potatenburgo que confirma que "los videojuegos aumentan el desarrollo del córtex prefrontal eréctil" no es más que un vano intento de camuflar la realidad: que la raza humana sería colectivamente superior si a nadie se le hubiera ocurrido la idea de comercializar dos palitos jugando ping pong.

Llegados a este punto sólo tienes dos opciones: admitir que podrías mejorar como individuo y hacer de éste un mundo mejor si dejases las maquinitas... o seguir revolcándote en tu propia autocomplacencia. Personalmente elegiré la segunda.

Toda esta paja mental viene a colación, porque Hero of the Kingdom es una pérdida de tiempo. Pero una pérdida de tiempo entretenida. Es un juego difícil de explicar, y cuesta encajarlo en un género concreto. Digamos que mezcla los elementos más básicos de las aventuras gráficas y los juegos de hidden objects, y añade un toque de estrategia con mucho trading.

HotK cuenta la historia de un chaval que, aburrido de esperar a su padre en la granja, decide seguir un tutorial que termina con la granja en llamas por manos de unos bandidos. Ha llegado su turno de pasar a la acción, encontrar a su padre, salvar el mundo y hacer click miles y miles de veces.

El juego se divide en zonas, y en cada una de ellas habrá una serie de elementos con los que interactuar: NPCs que te darán misiones y te venderán/comprarán objetos, plantas que podrás recolectar, animales esperando ser cazados, y cientos de pequeñísimas setas, huevos y cajas con los que tendrás que ejercitar la vista como si estuvieras buscando a Wally.

El intercambio es la parte fundamental del juego. Casi toda acción en este juego te recompensará con objetos o progreso en la historia, pero siempre perderás algo a cambio: Si quieres recolectar plantas necesitas gastar una cesta y algunos puntos de energía, pero luego puedes usar dichas plantas para venderlas por más dinero del perdido inicialmente, o puedes usarlas para crear pociones específicas, o para resolver misiones, etc. 

Antes de que te des cuenta, tu cerebro ya estará pensando en las maneras más eficientes de explotar el sistema, saltando entre vendedores mientras te frotas las manos con furia judaica. 

Es un juego carente de dificultad alguna y dura unas 3-5 horas dependiendo de si decides ir a por el 100%. Al final del día, la sensación con la que te quedas es similar a cuando ves tu partida del Cookie Clicker, cuyas cifras alcanzan ya notaciones científicas  que no sabías que existían, y en un momento de lucidez dices "¿Pero qué estoy haciendo con mi vida?"

Pero recordad, el tiempo que disfrutasteis perdiendo no fue tiempo perdido.

Ich habe das Spiel im Sale für 1,49 gekauft und bin nach 4,8 Stunden komplett durch, inklusive aller Errungenschaften. 
Auch wenn es so schnell durch war, hat es von der ersten bis zur letzten Minute Spaß gemacht. 

Lohnt sich also der Kauf? 
Hier eine kleine Rechnung (für den Fall, dass ihr das Spiel auch im Sale kauft):
4,8 Stunden Spaß / 1,49 Euro = 3,22 Stunden Spielspaß pro ausgegebenem Euro.

Rechnen wir das nun mal hoch auf ein neu erscheinendes, lange erwartetes Spiel für 50 Euro:
Würde dieses Spiel das gleiche Spaß-Preis-Verhältnis haben, müsste ich damit 
50 * 3,22 Stunden = 161 Stunden Spielspaß haben.

Auf wieviele Spiele (außer vielleicht Skyrim) trifft das schon zu?
Ihr entscheidet ;-)

17646653.review: Hero of the Kingdom is a simple point and click game that mixes, adventure, with hidden object with RPG.  The storyline is memorable, but not necessary to follow and the puzzles are simple enough that you will most likely never have to start over or figure out what you are missing.  The RPG elements are the loot that you pick through the hidden object genre where items are scatter across all of the screens that you will visit.  You also have to watch your health to ensure you have enough strength to accomplish the chores, fights, and quests that you need to accomplish.  This is casual at the very heart, but it mixes up the genres very well.  I highly doubt anyone will ever die or get stuck in this game as it can definitely hold your hand throughout if you let it.  I found the art to be beautiful, the music to be satisfying and on nights when you feel like kicking back and relaxing while playing a video game, this fit the need perfectly.

17641133.review: Not quite sure how to categorize Hero of the Kingdom. It's part point-and-click adventure, part interactive story (but effectively linear), part resource management, part "hidden items," part collection quest, _none_ of those genres i particularly care for. Nonetheless, i thoroughly enjoyed the casual, at-your-own-pace nature of this game, as well as the music, the interface (trivial to use), and theme. It's short - i played through it in a single sitting of (Steam says) just under 6  hours (didn't bother to go for 100% of achievements). Combat is unique in that in order to fight, you have to collect certain resources (one of which is fatigue (which is collected by resting)), at which point success is guaranteed. Will i play it again? i might. In terms of cost-per-hour it's already paid for itself, though, and there's nothing left to do in the game except go for the 100% achievements (but i'm not quite that OCD). The next day i went searching for more and promptly found Hero of the Kingdom 2, so it seems that my Saturday is now booked.

Sort of an adventure, but not really ---- it's different and unique.
You have to leave the peace of your farm to find your father who seems to be in the hands of bandits.
As you go, there are a ton of simple tasks to perform (find this, build that, etc.) for the various people you meet along the way. You have to keep up with your supplies, your energy, and your list of all the tasks.
While the approach is very relaxed, there is some strategy involved so you have to stay alert and not waste the resources you have on a task that won't push the game forward.
Somewhat like a TM game, but involves resources.

The mechanics are flawless, and the artwork is great.

It is a simple and clever game that moves a bit slowly for me, but I think it's worth a look. Might be just what you're looking for. 

So I recommend giving the demo a go, at least.

17407497.review:
This is a terrific game!  It captures the feel of playing a typical computer RPG, but without any combat difficulties.  My daughter and I play this together, and it's a perfect casual RPG for people who don't enjoy the combat aspects of typical computer RPGs.  

The basic mechanism is point and click, with some hidden objects that are reminiscent of Totem Tribe.  The objects are not hidden in artificial scenes, but scattered throughout the landscape.  Actions that you can take will have prerequisites (objects you must have, for example) and you cannot take the action without meeting the prerequisites.  

The game is relatively short, but if combat is your least favorite part of typical RPGs, and you hate grinding to gain levels, Hero of the Kingdom is probably for you.

17406539.review:
Let's be honest. If you're looking for excitement or action, this is not the game for you. However, if you like casual point-and-click style games with a hidden object element and some minor resource management, this is a very satisfying little time waster. It's a bit akin to playing a facebook RPG except without having to wait for actions to refill.

For me, personally, I really enjoyed it. It satisfied my gamer OCD to see all the little actionable items slowly getting action'ed and fading from the screens, getting through the little checkpoints and "battles" without feeling rushed and thus being able to micromanage resources to their efficiency.

Considering this is considerably cheaper and lasted many times longer than, say, a comparable game from Big Fish, I highly recommend. Especially if you can pick it up on sale.

Also, about an hour of my total playtime was looking for the last f****** couple of mushrooms to get the related achievement. Thankfully, while the game does boot you back to the title screen on completion of the plot, you can still use that save file to continue getting all the achievements, if that's you wish.

17378440.review:
In Hero of the Kingdom you click on exclamation marks to see a checklist of materials, and then you click on the various icons scattered throughout the map to collect those materials, then you click on the exclamation mark to turn-in those materials.  You will repeat this process for the next 3-4 hours until all the exclamation marks are gone.  Then you win the game.

There is no strategy - you simply click what needs to be clicked.  This game is "item management" at its most tedious.
There are no role-playing elements - labelling this game as an RPG is inaccurate, even by the loosest of definitions.
There is no tension - you cannot fail any of the tasks given to you (which, again, is just gathering materials).
There is no story - well, there is, but it's about as generic and shallow as a story can get.
There is no gameplay - unless you're the kind of person who thinks moving rocks from one pile to another counts as a "game".

I did not hate my time with Hero of the Kingdom, but I did not enjoy it either - it simply felt like I turned my brain off for a few hours and gained nothing from it (besides some trading cards).  If that experience appeals to you, by all means buy this game (on sale).  But if you like games with even a modicum of depth to them, you should look elsewhere.

17376879.review:
This is an RPG for people that [b]hate[/b] RPGs (unless your favorite part of RPGs is clicking icons, then stop reading right now and go play this). In fact I'd go so far as to say that it absolutely isn't an RPG as it doesn't have any hallmarks of the genre, yet, the Steam store tags it as one. Let's run down what it lacks:

It doesn't have a levelling system and at no point do you ever need to grind against monsters to level up, you don't customize your character in any meaningful way and you certainly don't make any worthwhile choices. The story - which is usually the saving grace of WRPGs with the most of mediocre of gameplay - is incredibly generic. It has your blank slate character on an adventure to save your kidnapped father. (With the sequel being about you rescuing your kidnapped sister. At least familial disappearances is a running theme in this series.)

Oh you want more? Well there isn't any. The game lacks any kind of lore and what little you can get come from side quests that don't exactly help fill out this generic fantasy world in your head. For being a farmer that lives out in the middle of nowhere, you for some reason live really close to a whole kingdom. 

Even at a base level of writing, this game sucks, with such quality lines as "Now I know the weapon for the undead so I can kill them." or "Be glorious our hero!". With, ahem, *quality* like that and the main villain being known as the [i]Dark Lord[/i] of all things, this must have killer gameplay at least, right?

Well... have you ever played I,Spy or any of those other hidden object games floating around on Steam? Then you'll be quite familiar with what you'll be doing. At the outset, you sort of feel like you are going on adventure - at first - but that feeling comes crashing down once you realise you're on quite the linear track with very little in the way of divergence as you try to find the little pixels on the map to click and then add to your unlimited inventory - you realise then you're playing Busywork: The Game, cause you get the run around from Point A to Point B, clicking the golden exclamation points to add another list of quests you have to do, collecting enough of Object 1 or 2, then either sell them to buy Object 3 or bring 20 of them to another quest giver with the biggest penalty you'll ever have is your stamina/hearts, which you lose everytime you do something strenuous and you gain back by resting - but not even resting works the right way, because as long as you have enough food items at the designated camps, you can regain as many hearts as you want, never truly having to rest again.

While on this ever important quest to rescue your father, at certain points you're just fishing, collecting mushrooms and hunting animals just to make ends meet - but it never feels like you're actually accomplishing these tasks as everything feels predetermined - and that's because it is, as the only thing you have to do is bring the listed required items to wherever to progress further, and outside of selling items, you never feel like you're in control of your own destiny.

I don't know what else to say - you click, read some banal writing, click again, then read more bad writing. That's it. It's not even a management game like you would hope despite playing a farmer - you never really farm or even try to fix your farm house to then farm some vegetables or something. Just having a seed and crop system where you need to water them everyday would add so much. Hell, I'd take a mini game or a QTE at this point, anything that could cause me to fail, because this game is truly lacking consequences for your actions. 

To all you people that complain about time limits, NPC babysitting, or any myriad of other things you whine about, well here's your alternative.

The Pro's
[quote]
+The graphics and music are relaxing

+Clicking icons never feels broken
[/quote]

The Con's
[quote]
-Gameplay? What's that?

-Atrocious writing that borders on hilarity

-Not an RPG/False advertising

-Very short even if you did enjoy it
[/quote]

(Why does this crap have so many positive reviews again?)

Steam really needs a "neutral" rec setting, dang.

Je to prostě tradiční fantasy příběh v silně tabletovém zpracování kterém najdeme mágy, kostlivce, krále a jeho armádu, zlotřilé záporáky a jejich armády, které je třeba zničit a blízké zachránit ... jen místo 3D zpracování je tu 2D malovaná krajinka ve stylu původních Settlers. narozdíl od velkých 3D RPG her tady není levelování postav a zbraní je tu jen pár základních, všechno je extrémně zjednodušené až si skoro připadáte, jako byste hráli farmwill - pokud se v případě farmwillu dá vůbec ještě mluvit o hraní v původním smyslu slova. 17348303.review:
[h1]Герой королевства[/h1]

История о том, как паренек с фермы стал героем. Сама игра - жанра "Point & Click", то есть: на каждой локации ищем необходимые предметы, тыкаем на них, собираем, а также имеет элементы стратегии: собираем ресурсы, фармим золото, нанимаем рабочих, строим шахты, мастерские, фермы и т.д. Но это вкратце. Рассмотрим игру более подробно:

[h1]Что понравилось:[/h1]

♥ [u]Смесь жанров.[/u] Как я уже упоминул выше Hero of the Kingdom - стратегия + пойнт-кликер. Получилось очень здорово.
♥ [u]Геймплей.[/u] Казалось бы, что там может быть. Сбор ресурсов и поиск предметов на карте. Но это очень и очень затягивает, я прошел игру за один присест (5,6 часов), при этом редкая игра сможет затянуть меня на столько времени без перерыва.
♥ [u]Графика.[/u] Простая, не режет глаз, а наоборот, радует.
♥ [u]Музыка.[/u] Звуки природы, шум воды, озвучка на уровне.
♥ [u]Достижения.[/u] Легкие, за 5 часов получаются спокойно, если быть достаточно внимательным при сборе ресурсов.
♥ [u]Карточки.[/u]
♥ [u]Сюжет.[/u] Пока наш гг (паренек с фермы) собирал ресы, его ферму сожгли, а отца взяли в плен. Теперь пареньку предстоит отыскать отца, а также по пути помочь другим, нуждающимся в помощи.
♥ [u]Цена.[/u] 150 р. Пфф. Это еще без скидки, взять по скидке будет идеальным вариантом. 

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Добрая игра, с хорошим сюжетом, хорошей концовкой, хорошим геймплеем, графикой и озвучкой. Ну что ж. Рекомендую всем, отличная игра!

С уважением, Aikiro, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators] Ораторы Ste@m [/url]

17286137.review:
I've really enjoyed this game. I beat it from start to finish in about 6 hours of actual playtime. The game flows very well and the story is nice. It has a very strange way of pulling you in. For the first 30 minutes of the game I felt like I was going to be bored and was wondering if I'd continue playing it, and also felt that it was a bit simple and small... And then I quickly realized how mistaken I was when the world opened up. My mind went from thinking that everything was small scale and simple to, "Oh my god this is going to take me forever to explore all of this."

There's quite a lot of easy achievements in the game if you're an achievement hunter. Overall this game is well worth the price. It doesn't really have any replay value, but it's worth the money especially if you get it in a bundle or when it's on sale. I'm very eager to play the 2nd as I enjoyed this one very much and will be looking for future work from this developer.

This game does a good job of giving you instant gratification and making you want to play from start to finish in one go. It might take some a bit longer, especially if they're trying to go for all of the achievements or if they're trying to reveal the story to all of the side quests instead of just trying to complete the main story. I wouldn't imagine it has any more than 10 hours of total solid gameplay though, but still well worth full price in my opinion. I have nothing negative to say about this game, it's just so well constructed in a very surprisingly simple weird way. I loved it.

I highly recommend this game! I will be buying the sequal and will be looking for future games from this developer.

- Crankage Games (Developer of Metal As P H U K)

Hero of the Kingdom - не стандартная поинт-энд-клик игра с замашками на стратегию: тут тебе и сбор ресурсов, и подготовка войск, и выполнение заданий, получаемых от местных жителей, у которых конечно же хватает своих проблем.

А начинается всё с банального - разбойники сжигают дом/ферму нашего героя и похищают его отца. С этого момента храбрый парнишка решает, что пора завязывать с мирной жизнью, хватает вилы и собирается покарать похитителей.
Однако, преследуя воров, парень соображает, что одними вилами с бандой не справиться, нужно что-то более внушительное...
Постепенно, по мере прохождения, как в классическом стиле, мы узнаем много-чего интересного и нового, нам встретятся дружелюбные и не очень NPC, некоторые из которых обучат нас разным талантам: охоте, рыбалке и даже ... грибособирательству ))

Чувствуется, что игра сделана с душой (я бы даже сказал, с пиксельной душой), рекомендую к ознакомлению всем, кто ещё не слышал о ней, 5-7 часов на это должно хватить - не так уж и много по нынешним меркам.

16977977.review:
Hero of the Kingdom - казуальная игра достойная внимания.

Сюжет игры банален. "Враги сожгли родную хату" и герой отправляется на поиски отца, который заблаговременно свалил из этой "хаты".  Собирательство, сражения и героические поступки будут сопровождать героя на протяжении 4-5 часов.

Механика проста, но увлекательна. Герою необходимо собирать ресурсы, чтобы использовать их для квестов или продавать за золото, которое нужно, чтобы купить другие ресурсы для третих ресурсов. (Замкнутая и взаимосвязанная система получается).
К середине игры уже выполняешь действия до автоматизма, постоянно переключаясь между небольшими локациями. "Собирательство" выражено поиском грибочков, яиц и прочей мелочи (О, мои глаза!), которую можно продать за золото. Также предстоит сражатся с различными животными и нечистью с помощью собранных ресурсов. 

Легкие ачивки, приятная графика, неторопливый и увлекательный геймплей не дают оторваться от игры. Благо она короткая и много времени не займет.

Рекомендую всем, если увидете на игру скидку.

Итог: 9 из 10

P.S. На ноуте почему-то игра не пошла. Возможна она не поддерживает мобильные версии видеокарт.

16949774.review:
[b]Hero of the Kingdom is an awesome game in so many ways[/b]. First of all, it can save you hundreds of dollars spent on a psychologist. Really, this game it's so simple and makes you so chilled that you forget about everything while playing it. [b]However, I wouldn't recommend it for everyone.[/b] Let's see it in more detail:

[h1] This is a game unlike others [/h1]
This is the kind of game that you think about playing for a couple of minutes to give it a chance and before you know it, you have been 4 hours in front of the screen. Also, [b]the soundtrack is pretty awesome too.[/b] I don't know why people haven't commented on it, but I liked it a lot since it goes really well with the game. Basically, [b]the game is a point&click[/b] where you must help your father that has been captured by a bunch of thiefs and save the kingdom in the process. [b]It's simple, it's linear, it's athmosperic and it's awesome.[/b]

[h1] It's not for everyone, though [/h1]
The problem with this game is that it may be too simple for some people. There's no much variety on it, [b]you can't die[/b] and there's nothing particularly astounding on the dialogue. [b]It's a simple game[/b]. You need to know it, because if you expect an awesome RPG full with dialogues and choices you will get disappointed, but if you don't hype it and play it for what it is, you will end up liking it. You should also know that [b]this is a short game[/b], I'm sure you can complete the whole story in about 4 hours and I personally collected all the achievements in about 9. And trust me, after you played it and collected all the achievements, you dont't want to play it again. It's basically the same thing over again, [b]so the replay value on this one is about zero.[/b]

[h1]So, should I buy Hero of the Kingdom?[/h1]
[b]Only if you are not looking for a challenge.[/b] This game offers just a nice, calmed, short story that can be awesome in it's own way. Want to chill out a bit from action games? This game offers that. [b]Give it a chance and it might surpise you.[/b] The demo is free so you won't lose anything.
