16948488.review:
I'm really not sure about reviews that call this a 'clicker' game of the Clicker Heroes/Adventure Capitalist ilk. This is nothing like those. Yes, fundamentally, you just click. But that's true of Monkey Island and Minesweeper, and no one would call those clickers.

Now that I've got that off of my chest, time for the real review. This game borrows heavily from 90's D&D-based CRPGs. It's got the same visual style, and the same sort of subquests, gathering, improving skills and back-and-forth. But it doesn't have any of the D&D elements of those games. You're not roleplaying, managing your inventory or obsessing over stats. It's a simple, quick, fun waste of time. And sometimes, those are just what you want.

I wouldn't pay full price for it, but see it on sale or in a bundle? Snap it up.

16936895.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is a point-and-click adventure/resource management game in which you play as a farm boy attempting to discover what happened to your father. You travel around the countryside collecting items and solving various quests in a series of drawn maps. There isn't much in the way of difficulty as there are a few different methods by which you can get as much money as you want, it's just a matter of figuring out your preferred method.

There are a number of hidden object quests throughout the game where you search for items in the background. This can be time consuming and is the primary difficult part if you feel like completing it.

The game isn't terribly long, taking about 5 hours to complete. But it scratches a zen-like itch for collector/RPG/progress fanatics, and I think you'll get your money's worth if you're into those sorts of games.

16729529.review:
Na wypadek gdyby siatkarze grali dziś wyjątkowo nudny mecz z Iranem w Lidze Światowej ściągnąłem sobie Hero of the Kingdom. Mecz okazał się jednak dość interesujący, choć niestety przegrany 3:2, ale przy okazji oglądania udało się przejść kawałek i dokończyć całość gry już po spotkaniu ;)

HotK to połączenie prostego RPGa i gry przygodowej. Przemierzając kolejne lokacje pobawimy się w poszukiwanie przedmiotów, handel wymienny, trochę polowania i zbieractwa, wreszcie - także w trochę walki, a wszystko po to, by odnaleźć ojca i uratować królestwo przed złym Czarnym Magiem i jego sługami.

Historia jest oczywiście banalna, gra została zresztą stworzona raczej z myślą o niedzielnych graczach, ew. takich, którzy szukają chwili odpoczynku między innymi tytułami. Przejście całości nie zajmuje więcej niż kilka godzin, nawet jeżeli zdecydujemy się odnaleźć wszystkie ukryte przez twórców skrzynki, jajeczka i grzybki. Prosta i przyjazna graczowi ekonomia została pomyślana w taki sposób, że nawet bez grindu będziemy w stanie zebrać dostatecznie dużo gotówki i surowców, żeby nie było potrzeby przeszukiwania każdego zakątka krainy, jaką przyjdzie nam odwiedzić. 

Reansumując - przyjemna i krótka zabawa. 6/10.

16352242.review:
[b]Hero of the Kingdom (2012) Lonely Troops [/b]
Немного необычная игра, подкупающая своей простотой и затягивающим геймплеем в духе сделаю последнее задание и все. Возьму это достижение и пойду отсюда. Открою новый кусок карты, быстро гляну, что там и выхожу из игры. Но спустя 7 часов главный злодей побежден, а игра пройдена. Оторваться очень сложно.
Своим магнетическим геймплеем игра обязана, прежде всего создателям, которые все продумали до мелочей. Если я не ошибаюсь, ее сделали 3 разработчика, которые однако точно знали, что и как делать. Учитывая мизерный бюджет, у них все получилось замечательно. Тут добавлено немного казуальности (найди предметы на карте), немного стратегии (спланируй последовательность действий), немного простого и понятного фентези (Темный Лорд, гоблины, скелеты и прочее), все это обернуто в несложную историю про спасение отца и приятная игра на 2 вечера готова. Она стоит как своих денег, так и потраченного на нее времени, если хотите немного отдохнуть от Больших Игр.
[b]Рейтинг - 75/100[/b]

16278901.review:
Was gibt es zu "Hero of the Kingdom" zu sagen?
Nun, vor allem einmal, dass das Spiel kurzweilig und unterhaltsam war und ich die Investition von 1,24€ im letzten Sale nicht bereue. 
Die Grafik ist schön und "niedlich", die Geräusche und die Musik ok und den Szenen angepasst. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist angenehm leicht, so dass man das Spielchen eben mal zur Entspannung spielen kann und trotzdem ohne große Probleme stets voran kommt. Die Story ist ein wenig zu linear, man kann fast nicht vom rechten Wege abkommen. Die kleinen Neben-Quests sind recht unterhaltsam gemacht und gut integriert. Zudem ist die deutsche Übersetzung tadellos - heutzutage ist das ja leider eher die Ausnahme.
Für einige Errungenschaften muss man schon mehrmals sehr gründlich jeden einzelnen Screen absuchen, damit einem nicht doch noch irgendwo ein Pilz oder ähnliches durch die Lappen geht.
Die Haupthandlung hätte man sicherlich in 3 Stunden durch haben können. Ich brauchte ca. 5 Stunden, da ich wirklich alle Errungenschaften einsammeln wollte - und da sich die letzten 4 Pilze hartnäckig versteckt hielten. :-D

Alles in allem ein kurzweiliges, einfaches Spielchen ohne großen Tiefgang oder schwierige Herausforderungen für das man 1 - 2 Euro investieren kann, wenn man denn so einfache Point+Click-Suchspielchen mag.

16266244.review:
So glad to finally play a casual game on PC that isn't a mobile port. I would characterize Hero of the Kingdom as a casual adventure game with some trading elements. There are no reflexes required, you simply need to click around the different maps to collect various items and turn them in to complete tasks. When you complete most tasks you beat the game. Overall you shouldn't expect to play this for more than a couple hours but it is a good use of time where you don't need to stress out. I found the story to be serviceable given the scale of the game.

All actions in the game are ultimately governed by its currency, which is gold. So if you want to do lots of things, such as stock up on supplies, get more hit points or hire more helpers, you need gold. This is where the trading part of the game comes in. There is only a finite number of resources you can gather before you run out, but you can manufacture more money by astutely trading the resources between various NPCs. I found this to be kind of interesting, but ultimately maybe not that constructive as the game actually gives you a good amount of money. I blame it on my RPG hoarding tendencies, but if you sell everything you gather (and you should! there are no missables!) you should only have to do a minimum of trade farming.

Lastly, many people play this game because it is easy to get 100% achievements. Not really my thing, but that could be a reason to play this game as well.

16199494.review:
Hero of the Kingdom - смесь adventure и strategy на статичной карте. Мы не увидим тут хорошую анимацию, красивые динамические бои. В игре ничего этого нет. Зато есть неторопливый casual геймплей, который затянет на долгие часы. Вся игра заключается в сборе ресурсов, их планировании и траты на решения каких либо задач. Например убить бандитов на мосту, для этого вам нужно собрать оружие, луки, щиты, юнитов и пр. Постоянно дают какие либо квесты, которые заключаются не только в убиении кого либо, но и выполнении нейтральных задач - починить забор, достроить дом. Каждое задание требует определенное количество ресурсов и денег.
Деньги в игре зарабатываются относительно просто, охотимся на зверей (собираем трофеи и продаем их специальному торговцу), ловим бронерыбу и так далее.
Многие пишут, что это RPG. Это в корне неверно.  Ролевых элементов тут нет вообще. Это адвенчура с ресурсами, т.е. смесь адвенчуры и стратегии.
Игра очень успокаивающая, это casual игра чистой воды. Игра проходится очеьн быстро и собрать 100% достижений не составит труда. 
Рекомендую игру как средство от депрессии и расслабления.

Ez a játék egy János vitéz szimulátor. Totál gagyinak néz ki, de ne tévesszenek meg senkit a képek, ez egy nagyon franya kis holmi. Sorolnám miért:

- addiktív, "namég egy feladat" játékmenet
- könnyen kezelhető, nem kell ráfeszülni, nem igényel beletanulást
- elképesztően jó, nem csak pénzen, hanem rengeteg nyersanyagon alapuló gazdasági rendszer
- előzővel összefüggésben, az npc-k 90%-a árul,felvásárol, vagy készít valamit
- alszol, eszel a játékban, már csak a klotyóra járás hiányzik kraftolható vécépapírral
- elhasználódó, elvesző szerszámok és fegyverek, még a virágszedés is full izgalom, vajon eltöröm-e azt a kib*szott sarlót már megint
- egyszerű, de igényes grafika, amely még az ekevason is elfut
- hangok tökéletesen passzolnak, kellemes zene, szépen megnyugszol tőle
- két sör mellett is játszható, nem fogod elb*szni ha közben berugsz
- point& click feladatok mellékszálként
- könnyed, egyszerű, óvodai népmeséket idéző történet, előre tudod mi lesz a vége, de nincs ezzel semmi baj
- olcsó
- egy végigjátszással minden teljesítmény feloldható
- magyar nyelvű
- 1 percen belül feltelepül


A legnagyobb pacsit a megközelítés érdemli. A legtöbb rpg-vel ellentétben nem harcolással kezdessz, kétkezi egyszerű kültéri munkákat kell elvégezni, hogy végül katona és ünnepelt híró lehess. A használat közben károsodó cuccaid pedig rákényszerítenek, hogy a játék egész időtartama alatt dolgozz, gyűjtögess. 
Én erre simán 10/10-et adnék. Mindenképp megér egy próbát, ha épp nincs időd/kedved a mai nyócbefejezéses 40 gigás csodajátékokhoz.

16043440.review:
Hero of the Kingdom est un jeu très « casual », c’est à dire qu’il nécessite très peu de réflexion. Il est impossible de perdre. On clique sur des icônes pour effectuer diverses actions : acheter ou vendre des objets, dormir, ramasser des objets ou accepter et valider des quêtes, le tout permettant de faire avancer l’histoire.

Au début c’est extrêmement simple au point que j’ai cru être face à un « visual novel » sans aucun choix à faire, mais ça s’améliore par la suite. Ce qui rend le jeu intéressant pour moi est la partie recherche d’objets : de nombreux objets tels que des champignons, écrevisses, caisses et autres trésors sont cachés dans le décor. Ils ne sont pas indispensables mais permettent de gagner des pièces d’or en les revendant.

Il y a aussi un aspect économique : il faut trouver comment gagner des pièces d’or pour acheter les choses nécessaires pour résoudres les diverses quêtes. Ce n’est pas compliqué.

L’histoire n’est pas des plus passionnantes, mais au moins la traduction française est impécable. Comptez environ 5 heures pour terminer le jeu. En solde à -50% ou plus, ce jeu est un bon moyen de passer quelques heures sans se casser la tête.

16008847.review:
Фактически, стандартный поинт'н'клик адвенчур, с небольшими элементами отыгрыша в виде некоторого количества профессий и побочных занятий, которыми придётся заниматься для фарма ресурсов на основной квест. Игра хорошая и качественная, но порекомендовать я её могу только очень терпеливым людям, и вот почему.
 На первых порах игра кажется отличной. Незамысловатая история подаётся интересно, за ручку нас вести перестают вовремя. Рандомные эвенты если и есть, то я про них забыл, ну да и не в них соль, и так хорошо.
 Но есть и проблема. Очень быстро надоедает. После половины (если не раньше) игра превращается в "сбегай сюда, потом обратно, потом вон туда, принеси 13 шкур вепрей и две рыбины, и тогда я научу тебя собирать траву". Серьёзно, даже если откинуть фарм (а фармить придётся - на основной квест ресурсы всё же нужны. Фарм здесь реализован не очень хорошо, на мой взгляд), то просто бегать туда-сюда-обратно не очень приятно. Особенно когда выясняется, что бегать было бессмысленно. Проблему несколько сглаживает возможность быстрого перемещения, но поди ещё вспомни, в какой из локаций обитает нужный тебе персонаж.
 В общем, я застопорился и мне надоело. Накрутил денег, купил всё нужное и зарашил главный квест. Игра-то хорошая, но для людей вроде меня - слишком нудная. Покупайте на своё усмотрение.
 Да, кстати, денег своих она стоит, в общем-то.

15996866.review: One of the calmest, most relaxing games I've ever played. After playing for what felt like 10 minutes, an hour and a half had passed. It's not your typical point-and-click, it's more like a FarmVille-style resource management game. However it removes all the stress and uncertainty associated with in-app purchases, as there aren't any! The story and graphics follow like an Age of Empires 2 spin-off, and that's no bad thing. There are also elements of 'Where's Wally' where you try and find things amongst the beautifully rendered landscape, and the game never tries to trip you up or be unfair. The constant rewards give you a real sense of accomplishment as you play. I'm two hours in and I don't expect there to be much more on offer, but I'm more than satisfied with what the game is trying to do. Loved it :)

15709863.review:
Ein Bilderbuch zum Spielen.
Das dachte ich schon nach dem Schauen eines Let's Plays und habe es mir nun einige Zeit danach selbst gegönnt. Hero of the Kingdom hat Charme, eine angenehm ruhige Atmosphäre und ist toll für ein Spiel nebenher. Durch neue Fähigkeiten wird man motiviert sich alle Bilder mehrmals anzuschauen und in Wimmelbild-Manier vorher unsichtbare Gegenstände zu suchen. Das ist wohl nicht jedermanns Geschmack, mir gefällt so etwas sehr. Hierdurch und die gut erreichbaren Errungenschaften fällt es schwer, eine Pause einzulegen und ich habe es -neben anderen Aktivitäten- in zwei Tagen durchgespielt. Fehlende Erungenschaften könnten auch nach der Geschichte erfüllt werden, womit das Spiel jeglichen Wiederspielwert einbüßt. Das ist schade, aber für ein 6 Euro-Spiel von drei Leuten absolut in Ordnung. Ich lasse es meine Freundin und später meine Kinder spielen.

Daher absolute Kaufempfehlung für entspannende Abwechslung...jetzt weiter mit dem zweiten Teil.

15696425.review:
This game is horribly, poisonously addictive.

The idea of the game is to click on certain map hotspots that either advance the plot or give you resources. You can then click on different map hotspots to exchange resources for other resources. This is sometimes puzzle-solving but much more often simply deciding which trade would be more valuable in the long run. I did say "map," and I meant it; you're looking at the Kingdom you are the Hero of from an altitude of a few hundred feet.

There's some combat, there are some choices of which path to pursue first, but overall the game is fairly linear and very simple. There's a kind of thin plot involving finding out what happened to your family, but it plays out very slowly. It feels like this was originally a mobile game, and seems especially suited to a touch screen ... though I wouldn't want to read this much text on a screen that size. (Also, there are irritating hidden objects, like mushrooms, scattered around, which are barely visible even on a full-size monitor.)

Although it never actually happened to me, it certainly seems like it's possible to get stuck without the resources you need to continue and without any ability to accomplish anything. So there's an element of resource management. Otherwise, though, this is a decidedly mechanical point-and-click game, distinguished only by the UI's bird's-eye view.

15579532.review:
[h1]Short version: 85%[/h1]
Hero of the Kingdom mixes turn-based fantasy strategy gameplay with tycoon-like resource management on a strictly casual level. What is remarkable about it is the good balance between the gameplay aspects.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Hero of the Kingdom is a resource management strategy game– something that fits well to the portfolio of the Slovakian development team– with a fantasy adventure theme. 

The goal is always to gather enough resources to pass the current objective. This requires a careful management of gold (for tools to gather the resources with) and strength (which serves the role of time units). There is no combat or levelling: if you have the resources to pass an obstacle, you automatically do so.
The mechanics are decent, but not perfect: there are exploits to get infinite gold and strength (although slowly), and it is easy to get confused by the variety of required resources by the end.

The story is fairly basic: find abducted relative, find bad sorcerer, kill bad sorcerer. This simplicity works to its advantage though as it lets the game put more focus on the dozens of side quests, giving it a classic RPG feel. Still, most players will likely reach 100% completion status within 4-5 hours, making Hero of the Kingdom a short, but fun game.

15405629.review: Казуальное приключение с сюжетом на пару вечеров. Сын фермера спасает королевство ищет своего отца бывшего генерала и героя, но теперь героем будет он. Ходим туда-сюда выполняем поручения, совершаем бартер, покупаем оружие, конвертируем предметы в деньги и так далее. Очищаем местность от бандитов, гоблинов попутно ведя охоту и собирательство, осваиваем новые умения. Играется легко, повествование сделано достаточно примитивно на уровне школы, но игру это не портит. Понравились звуки окружения, музыка нейтральная картинка хорошая, но на мой взгляд цвета несколько блекловаты, я люблю поярче. Из минусов наш протагонист уж очень быстро устаёт на каждое действие у него тратятся сердечки и отдыхать для восстановления сил приходиться очень часто. Трудность может возникнуть только при сборе всех предметов: грибов - россыпь миллиметровых точек разных цветов на тоненькой ножке; яиц - овальные точки размером в миллиметр и ящиков с бочками, из-за палитры они иногда сливаются с местностью тут нужно соколиное зрение, а так очень приятная игрушка. Эти три последних достижения сложны, но выполнимы. Игра лично мне понравилась.

15332160.review:
[h1]We are the champignons, my friend![/h1]

Вот уж не думал, что подобного рода игра зацепит настолько, чтобы ее рекомендовать. А вот зацепила.

[b]Сюжет[/b]
Наш герой живет на ферме с отцом. Отец собрался в город, а пока он ходил, ферму сожгли разбойники. Герой отправляется на его поиски, параллельно собирая грибы и спасая королевство. Как всегда, оказывается, что наш отец - не просто фермер, а... Пресвятые угодники, какой поворот... Оскара за такое вряд ли дадут, но видали и хуже.

[b]Геймплей[/b]
Даже не знаю, к какому жанру отнести эту игру. Эдакое приключение с зачатками стратегии и RPG.

Все время игры мы сверху смотрим на локацию. На ней подсвечены интерактивные места, где можно взять задание, поторговать, собрать ресурсы или чем там еще герои занимаются. Между открытыми локациями можно в любой момент свободно перемещаться.
Герою постоянно нужны деньги. На корзинки для сбора ягод, бочки для водорослей, стрелы для охоты, оплаты ночлега и так далее. Чтобы пополнять запасы наличных, придется выполнять задания, собирать и продавать всякое барахло, снова охотиться.
Периодически встречаются персонажи, позволяющие изучить некую новую способность или улучшить старую. Нет, мы не научимся вызывать огненный дождь, атаковать в прыжке или выполнять скрытные убийства во тьме. Все проще. Прокачиваем навык травника - на локации то тут, то там появляются грибочки, которые желательно собирать. Изучаем охоту - помимо непосредственно охоты получаем бонус в виде способности видеть на карте дополнительные припасы и сокровища. Ну и рыбалка, соответственно, дает бонусы на воде.
Забавно сделаны бои. Чтобы начать бой, нужно собрать определенное количество определенных ресурсов. После этого можно начинать, гарантированно побеждая.

Все это очень просто, незатейливо, но весьма затягивает.

[b]Плюсы[/b]
+ Огромное для такой мелочи разнообразие занятий. Собрали раков, пошли за грибами, по дороге убили оленя, починили мельницу, продали хлеб и помогли полоумной девице отыскать шарф, честь и совесть.
+ Малая продолжительность. Да, это плюс. Игра не успевает надоесть. Ну... почти не успевает. Часа за 4-6 неотрывного исследования можно выполнить все задания, получить все достижения.
+ Ачивки-ачивочки! Их есть там!

[b]Минусы[/b]
- Очень большое внимание уделяется деньгам. Приток их мал, приходится изворачиваться, искать пути заработка. Продавать ресурсы поначалу как-то не хочется. Не знаешь, пригодятся они еще или уже можно избавляться. В итоге, я черт знает сколько времени потратил на повторение циклов изготовления хлеба, лишь бы только как-то заработать. Лучше б шкуры продавал...
- Смазанные последние локации. Там абсолютно ничего интересного нет. Пришел, атаковал монстров, вернулся с докладом, набрал больше рекрутов, снова атаковал монстров, вернулся с докладом, взял еще рекрутов...

[b]Итого[/b]
Если есть желание потратить пару вечеров на маленькую простенькую игрушку, не заморачиваясь при этом, то можно смело брать Hero of the Kingdom. Много времени она не отнимет, но при этом она по-своему забавна.

15328610.review:
This game is one of the best games i have played in a while. There are very few faults i can pick and overall i really enjoyed it and i cannot wait for the next one to go on sale so i can buy it. (As i am way to tight to buy anything full price.) Though the sequel is so tempting to buy immediately.

It's actually a rather pretty game, at least to me it is. Yeah sure, it's not amazing or anything, but it does the job and gives you nice stuff to look at while you play. I find the point and click controls excellent, but then i am a huge fan of point and click games, but if you are not, don't buy this.The storyline is good, but it's actually a pretty generic storyline really, though that's not necessarily a bad thing. It can be a tad frustrating, especially trying to get all the achievements, but it's mostly fun and casual and the achievements aren't actually all that hard to get. I got half of them while doing the main storyline and then went back a while later and got the rest of them in a couple of hours.

However once you have played it and got all the achievements i am not sure how much (if any) replay value there is, as i have only just got to this stage. I might one day go back and start a new game, but i am not sure.

But i would totally recommend this game!

I start it yesterday evening with thought that its some economic strategy game so I will play couple mission before I go sleep but to my big suprise when game started it looks more like some of those freemium browser click games. So in that moment I thought it will be early night for me but I give it couple minutes and it become quite enjoable. And I went to the bed after 4 hours when I finished it with 100% archivments.

Its definetly not classic strategy game. On each screen you have presetup action for you (talk/work/fight/gather) but you decide order where and what you will be doing. And good resource managment system make it really fun. For each action you need energy, for replenish energy you need food, for acquire food you need money. Or you can hunt some deer for meat but you will need other resources to do..
If you would exploit economy system (and you can) to stock up coins and you wouldnt have to care about resource managment anymore, game would be quite boring but if you dont try to outsmart it and just play it its really well made. 

Story isnt that interesting but dialogs on the way made it much better and I can easily recommend this game.

15223709.review:
[b][i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i][/b] is a medieval fantasy adventure game. After your farm got burned down by bandits, you set out to find your father, helping people across the kingdom and becoming the adventurer you always dreamed of being.

[b]Pros[/b]: This game is a light straightforward adventure. Each quest or encounter requires you to assemble a certain amount of money or equipment to accomplish. As you successfully accomplish goals, additional parts of the maps are revealed, allowing you to go to new location and get additional quests. You also advanced through three level of hunting, fishing and gathering skills, each stage revealing new quests or resources on the map, giving you a reason to go back to locations you didn't need to access anymore.

[b]Cons[/b]: The entire game is a linear adventure, save side quests. If you have the required quantity if weapons, items or troops for a combat, you will win that combat, no action or strategy involved. The game is void of randomization: people are there where they're supposed to be, resources can be gathered once or twice and do not regenerate, enemies or hunting game don't respawn. There is no replay value to this game.

[b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - It's up to you

[i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i] is simple, straightforward, and short. Surprisingly, I almost played through the entire game in one sitting (it wasn't intense enough to keep me up at night, but I finished it the following morning). It's a fun little idle game with just enough production value to mandate it's rather low price. It barely gets my recommendation, but it does get it.

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

15206781.review:
I wasn't expecting too much from this game when I started out. There is something very minimalist about the user interface and moving about the world that I quickly found rather appealing, though. The game is very well balanced in how you gain new skills, the things you can find, the quests you can solve, and though not strictly speaking linear, there is a rough order in which things need to be done. 

There was something refreshing in how you move through the world not as a fully-fleshed 3D or even 2D character, but by clicking on the buildings, people and items you wish to interact with, clicking on direction arrows on the edges of an area to move instantly to the next one. For adventure games requiring a bit of walking back and forth, and strange as it was to start with, this makes it less boring as many other games as there is no transit time to speak of to get around.

It makes for a nice game in between other more time-consuming games. With a playthrough time of 3-4 hours if you wish to do everything you can, find all you can, craft all you can, hunt all you can - not strictly speaking necessary, but there is something satisfying about making as much money as possible too.

The story is fine, the hidden-object aspect of the game for finding treasure, mushrooms, eggs, etc is nicely done, and even the unconventional combat system, if you can call it that, where you gather the resources you need to win a given battle and return to the location of it with the weapons, manpower and potions needed to overcome the enemy is an interesting and refreshing twist on what you'd expect to see in a game like this.

I think I bought this very cheaply in a bundle, but even at its regular price, I'd still feel I got a few hours of entertaining gameplay's worth for my money, and cheaper than spending a similar time in the cinema, which is how I often calculate entertainment value when it comes to computer games.

15147516.review:
From the looks of it, I expected some sort of uninspired Sacred-clone in this game. Instead, I found a little gem of low level fantasy, I happily advise to anyone who likes the genre. Your young hero's task is not to save the world, but to wander the homesteads around his (okay, some clichées are hard to avoid) burned home to rescue his father.
In a game, that would be best described as ressource management, you'll find yourself in a mundane atmosphere of people and a world, that don't necessarily turn around you. The gameplay can be broken down to "use thing A to complete task B", plus a bit of hidden object finding. Nothing too challenging, but on the other side nothing that's too distracting from the nice atmosphere, the game creates.
Hero of the Kingdom is a refreshing casual experience, I hereby want to recommend.

15138687.review:
Completed the game with 100% achievements.

[h1]About the game[/h1]
Before I say anything else, I'd like to point out that this [b]IS[/b] a clicking game. Although it wasn't mentioned in the tags it kinda fits that genre very well. So if you don't like clicking don't get the game and save yourself from posting a rant.

The story starts with the life of a boy living a peaceful life in their farm. But, things starts to get chaotic when your father went missing and your house being burned down to nothing leaving you homeless. Now the boy must embark on a journey to find his missing father and find out the cause of the attack. You will be meeting different people from small villages along the way and experience the life of a traveler as you earn fame and make a name for yourself.

[h1]My thoughts[/h1]
The game is overall fun. It is mainly about resources management and will make yourself analyzing and thinking but not to the point of frustration. There will be plenty of items in-game:this includes item such as food, weapons, crafting materials, and more. Acquiring items are earned by either completing tasks given by the NPCs or bartering with merchants. This works by giving a certain item from your inventory in-exchange of another of the same value. Ofcourse, the game also has a currency which will be a necessity later on. 

There's nothing much to say about the game except for the fact that if you're not into too much action and just want to sit down and play relaxing game yet entertaining then, you should give this a try. 

--- [b]This paragraph[/b] might contains [b]minor[/b] spoilers. But, I'll put it here anyway for people who wants to know [b]what to expect from the game[/b]. ---
The game starts with a realistic story of a young boy as stated above. But, things get weird when you suddenly need help of mages from the guild who *obviously* can use magic. You'll start getting items that is related to alchemy too and you will have to fight fantasy-ish creature not much like at the beginning where you only fend off wolves.

Now this may come a surprise to some people but it can be either looked at as positive and negative. I was expecting the game to be realistic until the end when the boy matures enough. Instead, it turned out that the entire plot of the story revolves around a certain wizard and it gets cliche from then on.
--- [b]End of potential spoiler paragraph[/b] ---

[h1]Rating[/h1]
[b]Gameplay:[/b] ★★★★☆
[b]Graphics:[/b] ★★★☆☆
[b]Story:[/b] ★★☆☆☆
[b]Sounds:[/b] ★★★★☆
[b][i]Average:[/i][/b] ★★★☆☆

15123285.review:
Quaint like an elderly lady's bungalow filled with many past adventures and expeditions, the attractively detailed land in [i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i] possesses the old-fashioned quest-orientated method of play that I have yearned for through many wishful Steam purchases but had yet to truly discover until now.

[i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i] ranks highly in my gaming library as one of the most satisfyingly rewarding games I have played on Steam to date. It is most certainly one of the top 3 which I eagerly gave myself an auspicious pat on the back for buying. At $1.49 (75% off) it is money well spent. Completion only took me two days totalling 8 hours or so (didn't bother to quit game when taking dog for a walk). The game play is therapeutic and healing as even with a generic storyline, the long but seldom arduous line of quests are gratifyingly addictive. [b]If you enjoy RPGs as I do and rarely skip side quests as it is half the fun[/b], then I highly recommend this title. 

The controls are as easy as can be and I can't honestly admit this is a strategy game as it does not give the player a chance at failure as you will see if you play it. It isn't a game to test your gaming skills but a chance to relax from more demanding games. Out of games you can use to relax and enjoy like you used to enjoy games as a child, it never feels like a waste of time or is uncomfortable to play in terms of time or effort of lack thereof.  

[h1]Hero of the Kingdom is my idea of a perfect holiday.[/h1]
When I first booted this game (being my silly little self) I truly believed, despite the title being "Hero of the Kingdom", that I would be taking care of Father's farm for the duration of the game play as the atmosphere was immediately soothing. Luckily, this tranquillity is carried onwards as there is no concept of time and you can go as expeditiously or leisurely as you fancy. 

[h1]ACHIEVEMENTS, GUIDES & TIPS[/h1]
Despised styles of achievements that I have become quite feverish about are those consisting of sending a player on wild goose chases where the goals lack relation to, or impact on the story. Luckily, this game is short, straight forward and sweet with every single achievement. You don't feel like you've wasted time [b]getting achievements for the sake of achievements[/b] as it tend to be with some games which take away from the enjoyment. You will have to finish close to all of the activities provided in-game to finish all the achievements. I dislike looking at guides so am usually much slower than other players at finishing any set of tasks in-game but this game didn't need any guides at all. There are easier methods of finishing the game which you will eventually find out on your own but every feature and quest is well thought out by developers that you will not have to look at any playthrough or spend an exceedingly long time pondering variations of. 

Spoiler Hints (It’s likely you’ll realise on your own like I did so won’t need the info, hence the  format): [spoiler]You can buy grain, convert grain to flour, get bread from flour and sell that bread to a farmer's wife for minimum profit which will accumulate. Check this well written [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=310152016]guide by The Fox[/url] in the community hub if you’d like to know more. When you progress farther and get to town you'll find a smuggler (in town to the right of screen with no indicating icon) which you can click on to buy poison from them, afterwards selling said poison to a master hunter in the woods also reachable at a later stage. This is a faster way of earning a profit through the market. The prices of items vary depending on who you're buying from/selling to, so keeping note of price ranges will add to the fun. When you start finding more treasure and jewellery which you can end up selling to one of the shops in town, you will no longer need to trade as much. Once you get to the "let's hoard money" part of the game which urges you to trade, it will ultimately feel less fun for obvious reasons (repetitive trading to add gold) so don't use it too much until you absolutely feel you need to.[/spoiler]

You will need to find a very small number of hidden characters that are in plain view, just without icons near them which you will have to manually activate (click on people and sometimes they'll talk back with no warning ;D ). There will be new items available to find across the map in the form of "hidden objects" so if you enjoy hidden object games, this will be a blast and quite easy. I have enjoyed my fair share of hidden object puzzles so it was extremely easy to keep an eye out for various types of items that I needed to find to finish achievements. It's different for each player but you may end up lacking 1 or 2 items of a kind etc and spend some time looking for them. This is only natural as it is with all hidden object games. The last or last couple you're looking for are hardest for you to spot which is why they'll end up the last ones. Don't fret and go through the map slowly a few times. Click on various areas that you'll become accustomed to as "loot points" on the map such as forests, cliff sides and lakes away from camps and village areas where people are stationed or reside in. It is definitely a game where you'd want to finish the achievements for the added content at least as the game itself is short. The challenges are not always a walk in the park especially if you do not use [spoiler]the easier trading methods for extra gold[/spoiler] but you will undoubtedly complete them like the way a fantastic game like this should be played. Btw, the blacked out parts are spoilers, not cheats as they do not exist and are thankfully unnecessary in this game (not that any should ever be used for any game). I do not finish any of my games quickly so the fact I finished it in two days adds to the realisation now that it was neither tirelessly demanding nor boring enough to put aside for a while like the majority of my library. It was such a simple yet entertaining 8 hours that I started writing this review after I finished it which also says a lot about how much I enjoyed the title considering my crowded backlog of games awaiting review (the majority of which I evidently did have fun playing). [b]When the words "The End" reached my screen, it crossed my mind that this game felt like a demo for it's sequel, [i]Hero of the Kingdom II[/i]. That's how much I enjoyed it and how much I am ready for more.[/b]


[i]- Edited grammar[/i]

15107363.review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Casual Point and click game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There are 10 sound effect circles, Each circle will increase/decrease the volume by 10%.
There are 10 Music  circles, Each circle will increase/decrease the volume by 10%.
There are 10 environment circles, Each circle will increase/decrease the volume by 10%.
There are some different languages available.
There are different profile slots available.
You are only able to play on fullscreen or windowed mode.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

First of all, From the moment that you have started up this game. You will be guided and instructed on what you have to do and where you have to go. Even on the main menu there will be an arrow pointing at the "Play" button. But you are on the farm of your father and you have to "take care" of everything. Your father will be going to the market to gather some money. You will have to chop down some food, rebuild a watchtower and then suddenly your house is on fire because of some bandit guy. From there the story begins.


This is a story related game.
You get guidelines,waypoints throughout the entire game. It's impossible to get stuck.
Okay Graphics.
Relaxing game.
Short game.
The game is pricey on what it has to offer.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

You can't lose or die in this game. You can only win.
It's almost a "mono-rail" kind of game, but then with text.

-------------------

I Give this game a 6/10

15084546.review:
Small and nice game if point and click games is your thing.
The mood is nice, and the gameplay is kind of catchy because you want to optimize your gathering of resources. And that's basically what you do: Gather resources. You go picking some mushrooms, hunting some animals, getting stuff for people, trading and so on. There's really not much you can do wrong so the gameplay is much about how to optimize your resources. Even combat is a question about having the right resources (e.g. 2 bowmen and 4 healing potions). So if you have the resources you can fight (and win) and if you haven't got the resources you can't attack until you've got them. It's pretty simple and that's actually some of the appeal of this game.

I'm not a power player but I like to hunt for achievements.
It took me 3,5 hours to complete the game with all the achievements. So it's not a big game. But it was definitely enjoyable.

15068033.review:
6/10

I came across this while trying to curb my game expenditure by trawling the depths of the cheapest games on steam and the fact this review (and many of the steem reviews) is positive reflects how cheap/bundled this game often is. It's a simple, short but quite well done little time-killer that might appeal when you are in the mood for something slower.

You progress through a series of reasonably pretty full-screen maps. Each one you visit might hold a handfull of missions plus perhaps a merchant, tradesman, somewhere to rest, etc and will definately hide a number of hidden objects to find. Once you unlocked each screen you can return at any time to use the merchants, finish side quests or pick up any hidden objects you missed.

The story is standard fantasy fare but is fine. The graphics are ok for a game so much about staring at the screen and set the mood well. The game play is good initially though starts to grate and grind a bit in the later stages even in a comparatively short game. For example consuming food at a camp is essential to gain heart points (used to perform most quests/activities) which is accompanied by a pretty but time consuming little 'nighty night' graphic sequence. Very atmospheric the first couple of times but you need loads of heart points to get through the game and end up spamming the camp sites. 

It is a game that you cannot really lose - instead you just kind of amble through it... That said, I did finish it... And I did hunt about a bit for the hidden items before finishing the well-flagged final quest... And I paid £0.69 for 5 hours gameplay... Overall that makes it hard not to recommend.

14997134.review:
I got this game as part of a bundle, and looking at the asking price...it isn't really worth it.

-There is very little game play, it is essentially managing resources and clicking all over the screen to find little hidden things.  To call it an RPG makes the original final fantasy look like morrowind.  It is basically one long trading quest, with a couple of little side trading quests. 
-It is not challenging at all.  I'm not sure if it is even possible to lose.  Maybe, if you were really incompetant you could squander all your resources.  Otherwise there is no tension, you will go into the final battle knowing you will win.
-Randomly clicking all over the screen is a legitimate strategy. 
-The story is absolutely forgettable and generic fantasy,  House burns down, chase after bandits, help villagers, rescue family, defeat big evil.   
-Graphics are ok for a cow clicker, but there is no way you are going to be engrossed in the "battles"
-It is very short.

Beat it in one sitting.  Did I hate it? No.  Will I ever play it again? No.  I get the feeling this game is supposed to be padded out with "freemium" pay to play mechanics. 
There simply isn't a lot of game here, and I can't reccomend it outside of it being heavily discounted.

This game is a fun to play point and click game, but you're done real quickly. I've played for 3 hours and then reached the end, but I decided to go for all achievements, so I got some more time in it. You can have more time in it than I had, because I skipped all dialogues and other text things. I think it's a game you play when you're either real bored, or you don't have a proper internet connection.

In the beginning they point out what you've got to do just to help you get on your main quest, later on you've got to decide what to do and where to go. Because of that, I got in like 10 different "sidequests" by just randomly clicking stuff. I lost track of all the quests and began to furiously click everyone with a green checkmark (fishes included).

Actually, the whole game you're just randomly clicking stuff, killing animals and collecting all the stuff you need and level up all your skills, then it ends in defeating some sort of dark wizard. After that, some people celebrate that you defeated that wizard and you can play the "quests" you haven't finished during the main quest. If you're going for all achievements, I guarantee that it will be frustrating to find those last little shrooms, eggs and crates, but it's worth it. Nothing's better than completing all achievements.

I would rate it 7/10, because it got me furiously clicking everywhere, which is kinda fun if you think about it, but it could have been a bit longer, since not the whole map is filled in while I thought this would happen later on and then the game ended...

14973979.review:
Saving the kingdom has never been so... relaxing.

Hero of the Kingdom is a very straightforward point-and-click/hidden object game that is cheerfully content with what it is. Each task is simply given a set of resources necessary to complete it, and if you have those resources, you can clear the task. After all, of course the hero of the story makes it through, why pretend otherwise? The hidden objects on each map can usually be converted directly into money, or used to clear various unlock tasks, which are used to gain access to various resources you need.

You do end up feeling less than of a hero, and more of a military quartermaster, sourcing local materials and labor to win the campaign against the Dark Lord. But this is what makes the game so relaxing. No timing, no complicated clicking, just knowing where to get the parts you need to assemble your victory. It rewards remembering who sells what, and being able to find eggs in a forest map, rather than actions per second. Even the achievements are hardly difficult (though I really had to search for that last bird's nest).

Everything about the game is very polished, as well. The soundtrack fits, the maps progress cleanly from one to the other, and you can always get the resources you need if you're willing to go kill and skin a few wild animals. Even if you sell something you need later in the game to get the money for an immediate goal, there's always someone who will sell it right back to you, usually for the same price you got in the first place.

This is a good game to spend a few hours relaxing with.

14962776.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is an interesting mix of genres with elements of Point-and-click adventure games, RPGs, as well as small elements of economic strategies.
This production shows that with a small budget you can still create interesting productions, the game was created by an independent Slovak developer - Lonely Troops.
The story is not very thrilling, it tells the fate of a son who, when attacking bandits on his house, loses contact with his father and sets out to look for him.

Hero of the Kingdom is a very relaxing game, you will not find a long-time grind or annoying missions on time.
Gameplay in the game is based on overcoming subsequent maps and performing specific tasks such as helping a fisherman to fish, finding the right amount of raw material, etc.
To make progress (complete the tasks) we have to pass controls that determine if you have enough specific items.
In this way, the game boils down to expanding resources in two ways. The first way is to find quite well hidden objects on the screen. The second option is to trade with NPCs, there are many profitable transaction loops from NPC that can be used to earn money and buy the necessary items of the magazine. And here the game begins to draw a little from the economic strategy.

The narrative is extremely light and affordable, however, we will not find here abundant content like the games from the series The Elder Scrolls or The Witcher, where we can learn the history of the world and creatures that inhabit it. Unfortunately, although the narrative is not bad, it's easy to forget it
Gameplay is very well balanced, evokes a sense of continuous progress, when we perform tasks or move to the next zone, we do not fall into any monotony.

The game also offers some interesting achievements, which sometimes require us to notice a lot of perceptiveness.

For those who are looking for more intense game experiences, this game can be a bit boring. However, if you like short but relaxing games that are satisfying, there is a good chance you will enjoy Hero of the Kingdom.

PROS:
- simple but pleasing design
- satisfying gameplay
- nice music
- a successful mix of several game genres

MINUSES:
- gameplay for ~ 4 hours
- no interesting plot
- small variety of tasks

14941072.review:
Do you like clicking? No, do you derive intense pleasure from pressing a mouse button and watching numbers go up, for the sake of then being able to click a few more things and have those same numbers go up even faster?

Hero of the Kingdom in almost every respect is a cleverly disguised iteration on the bizarrely addictive idle games that have been devouring souls since it was discovered people on the internet will do absolutely anything to pass time. The main change is that unlike Cookie Clicker or Candy Box, Hero of the Kingdom doesn’t run by itself and has a (mostly) definitive end, tapped together with what could almost be considered a story and some minor exploration.

Beginning on a secluded farm, you take up the mantle of the world’s premier errand boy, poking your nose into everybody’s business in the hopes they’ll set you off on another menial task they couldn’t be bothered to do themselves.Hero of the Kingdom, in everything it does, is a personification of every tedious fetch quest you’ve ever done in an RPG, stripped of everything but finding and delivering the item and then being patted on the head and told you’ve done a great service to the kingdom.

I don’t think developer Lonely Troops had any doubts about what they were making though, and have deviously engineered the perfect loop of turning mundane tasks into accomplishments. Thanks are given for every small deed you perform, unimportant numbers are always going up, and the achievements pour out like candy letting you know no matter how simple the job, you did a damn fine job clicking your way through it!

And then before you know you’ve constructed a profitable trading cycle, picked the country clean of mushrooms, and risen up in the ranks to where no one would dare refuse your prying questions. Hero of the Kingdom would almost feel nefarious if it didn’t have a clear ending, so adept is it at roping you in and making it feel as if the entire game isn’t just cleverly disguised busywork requiring no skill and barely any effort.

But for something that is fine letting you go after a few hours, I was fine indulging Hero of the Kingdom and its exploitation of a basic human need for self gratification. I don’t think it’s a good game, but it’s an easy way to waste some time that won’t hold you hostage past the point of some mindless fun (for lack of a better word).

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2015/03/18/hero-of-the-kingdom-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

Коли вдруге повернувся до ресурсу Steam (вирішив переходити на ліцензію), я вирішив першим ділом перевірити ігри з українським перекладом. В очі впала ця гра. Гарна назва. На новорічні знижки я знайшов гроші і придбав цю гру. Найшов час і зіграв її. Вирішив поділитись враженнями від гри з вами.

Графіка.
Всі деталі в грі промальовані до найменшого предмету. Локації різні та мальовничі. Графіка не ріже очі. В цій грі графіка мене задовольнила повністю !

Звук.
Звук в грі чудовий. Постійно відчуття ніби ти в лісі. Щебетання птахів, горлові звуки тварин, звуки роботи - все це занурює в гру. 

Ігролад (ігровий процес).
Гра однокористувацька. В ній не має зміни важкості. Інтерфейс простий. Освоєння гри елементарне, нічого важкого в грі не має. Досягнення прості, більше залежать від вашої уважності. В грі реалізовано і збирання предметів, і будування, і бої (хоча напряму в боях участі ви не приймаєте). Завантажень локацій в грі не має, тому сама гра проходить легко. Керування мишкою (інколи ще бере участь кнопка "Enter", коли про неї не забуваєш). Весь ігролад не навантажує, дає розслабитись та насолодитись грою.

Переклад. 
Переклад чудовий. Автор перекладу вловив всі нюанси гри. Слова підібрані ідеально. Велика подяка Віталію Ніколенко за чудовий переклад !

Висновок.
+Українська мова
+Дизайн
+Звук
+Казуальність
+Легка в освоюванні 
+Дозволяє відпочити після довгого робочого дня

-коротка (хоча нещодавно вийшло продовження гри)

Коментар : Гра залишає приємні спогади
9,5/10

14835085.review:
Recommended... If you like this kind of game. So what exactly is it? I'd describe it as a short, linear story driven resource collection game with a bit of hidden object along the way. Pretty much a top down point and click adventure.

Despite the looks, it is definitely not:
A city building game
A strategy game
An RPG (in the skyrim/mass effecty sense of the word)

The story is cliched as can be, the artwork fairly pleasant, the difficulty not to challenging. It's a very laid back game, that is enjoyable because you feel like you're constantly progressing, and everything fits together tightly. The worst part of it was a mid-game lack of money, but I had missed that hunting trophies and fish are mainly for selling (and only occasionally for quests). 

I completed everything (absolutely) in 4 hours, so this is only a short diversion. If you want a short point and click adventure from a different perspective, this is a fair option.

Wow, tolles Game :3

Es ist zwar auf eine Art wie ein "Wimmelbild", aber dennoch anderst und viel belebter!
Was mir am meisten Spaß gemacht hat, war das Suchen / Farmen nach Ressourcen und natürlich das Questen!
Die Story ist sehr schnell erzählt!
"Sohn sucht Vater ---> Hexer finden und töten" 
Naja, doof erklärt, aber so ist es :D

Hero of the Kingdom ist sehr linear und man kann es sogut wie immer schaffen, außer man gibt sein Gold für Blödsinn aus, da man sehr oft (vor allem am Ende) Soldaten / Jäger etc. kaufen muss!

Was ich LEIDER schade finde ist, dass ich für ALLES gerade mal 3 1/2 std gebraucht habe :/
JEDES Tier erlegt, jeden Fisch gefangen, alle Errungenschaften bekommen usw.

Zwar spawnen z.B. Eier, Pilze und Fässer nach, aber das dauert und ich habe keine Ahnung in welchen Abstand.
Ein paar Tiere sind auch nachgespawnt, aber dann irgendwie nie mehr :D
Wahrscheinlich passiert dies nur, wenn man wenig Gold hat. Sonst säße man ja buchstäblich in der Falle :D
Ich hatte zum Schluss mehr als 6000 Gold (Bei 5000 Gib es die Errungenschaft), vllt ist deswegen nichts mehr gespawnt^^

Es gibt bei Kräuter sammeln, Fischen und Tiere erlegen 3 Stufen, die man durch eine besondere Quest erlernen kann.
Sollte man immer machen, da man so die "stärkeren" und "seltenen" Tiere erlegen / Fangen kann, die widerum beim Verkaufen mehr Gold bringen :)

Ich bewerte das Game trz 100% positiv, weil es mir sehr viel Spaß gemacht hat... trotz, dass ich es erst gestern gekauft habe :P

Der Preis 5,99€ ist bisschen zuviel, wobei ich das Game auf eine Keyseite billiger bekommen habe.
Man bedenke! Alles erreicht (Auch die Errungenschaften) und das in 3 1/2 std :P
Und leider hat das Spiel KEIN wiederspielwert! Einmal durch = Ende!

Solch ein Game wünsche ich mir mit mehr als 30 Std Spielspaß :D

14777111.review:
A casual roleplaying game, where you travel around the kingdom doing little tasks and becoming a hero. It’s more of a point-n-click adventure than an actual roleplaying game.
 
Positives:
+ Graphical style is nice (similar to Age of Empires).
+ Accessible. It takes about three seconds to learn.
+ Short (you can 100% the game in less than 6 hours). This is a positive because the game isn't artificially padded out.
+ The mostly-optional collectible things are surprisingly addictive, logically placed and it makes sense to collect them.
+ Never confusing and there's no difficulty spikes.
 
Negatives:
- Story has been done a million times before.
- Very minimal decision-making and customisation. You only really get to decide the order than you do everything. This is by design, but it would have been nice to have a few meaningful decisions.
- No incentive to replay.

14719301.review:
Options include separate sliders for sounds, 10 languages to choose from, Full-screen or Windowed, and whether or not to use profiles (that's a new one to me!)

Right away you'll see that you can access the [b]main menu[/b] via the top right corner of the screen.  As you progress you'll end up with something in each corner, as follows:

[b]Hints[/b] - Bottom right corner
[b]Insta-travel Map[/b] - top left
[b]Inventory and health[/b] - bottom left

What I really can't figure out is what kind of game this is.   I can't pigeonhole it in a single genre.  It has RPG elements, in that your character learns new skills and abilities as you progress; there are useful items scattered about on every screen, which is reminiscent of a hidden object game; and it's an adventure with strategy elements... What it's NOT is a click-fest.  There's no chaining, and no rush.

As I mentioned above, some items just need to be clicked on, hidden object-style, something I didn't realized until about eight screens into the game.  "I need (x-item), why can't I find someone to buy them from??"  The answer is that you need to gather them yourself.  New abilities will allow you to find new items in your environment, so you'll want to revisit scenes often, and be sure to click on anything that looks unusual!

We lose energy (health) when we do tasks, and this energy can be restored by staying at one of the available camps.  At each camp you'll eat a different type of food before you go to sleep, and this means a varying amount of health restored.  At one point I had over 30 health, so I don't there's a cap on how much health you can have.

Don't be thrown off by how easy everything is early on.  The game is pretty isometric when it first begins, but once you've explored a few screens, you start to have some freedom to choose your own tasks. Will you just chase the main storyline, or will you explore every nook and cranny and do all of the side-quests?  Will you try to get all 38 achievements, or only do what's necessary?  The choice is yours!  Once you finish the game, you CAN go back in to try and get those awards, which is really nice.

[i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i] which took me about 8 hours to finish with all of the achievements, and I absolutely enjoyed my time in the game.  Recommended!

I have just finished Hero of the Kingdom with 100% achievements :-) It took me longer than most!

This is a very simple game in terms of the mechanics - it's a lot of clicking around and pixel hunting on the screen but despite its simplicity, its surprisingly enjoyable and addictive. I wouldn't classify it as an RPG because there is no roleplay aspect - you play the part of a farmer's son who goes off on a somewhat cliche'd adventure and partake in various quests along the way but there are no stats or skills to choose.

It's a charming little game that I really enjoyed and I'm looking forward to the sequel.

14678484.review:
This casual point-and-click game is difficult for me to recommend mostly in part due to the extensive annoyance of every task you perform being a fetch quest. The fact it is extremely linear with very few options in terms of how you complete a quest only exacerbates matters. Either you harvest certain supplies you need, or outright buy them. I expect a certain simplicity with casual games like this, but this seemed to be a bit much in that regard. The story is very minimalistic with writing on par with a young children's story--just enough to make a point. It has very pleasing visuals and sound and the game length felt just about right from a completionist viewpoint.

That said, this is a game that would be delightful to play with children. The simple story, hidden-object elements, and resource management just feel like it targets more of a family video-game night and I am reminded of old adventure classics like Mixed Up Mother Goose I would play with my parents and friends when I was young.

Other players looking for a light, relaxing gaming experience can just sit down and enjoy the story without any pressures or puzzling to do however, players wanting a game that provides a more thoughtful experience may end up disappointed.

14574028.review:
[u]Hero Of The Kingdom[/u] - простенькая приключенческая Point-And-Click игра,но продуманная до мелочей. Меня игра очень заинтересовала с первых же минут,и интерес к ней не пропадал до финальных титров,что редкость в настоящее время.

Плюсы:

+ [u]Сюжет[/u] - по началу он прост и предсказуем (мы играем за молодого фермера,отец которого уехал и просил присмотреть за фермой,но вскоре на ферму нападают бандиты и сжигают ее,а мы в свою очередь уходим странствовать по миру в поисках отца и искать приключений), но потом в сюжете появляются неожиданные повороты,которые только подогревают интерес к игре.

+ [u]Геймплей[/u] - играем и наблюдаем мир с высоты птичьего полета,находим спрятанные грибы,ящики,яйца,сокровища,охотимся на животных,сражаемся с бандитами,вообщем игра не даст заскучать. Квесты не сложные,но иногда заставляют подумать куда пойти и что сделать,и даже в побочных квестах есть разннобразие.

+ [u]Графика[/u] -  выполнена в своем стиле,все красочно и красиво,радует глаз.

+ [u]Озвучка[/u] - на высоте: звуки окружающего мира, диалоги и фоновая музыка,все радует слух.

+ [u]Легкие 100% достижений[/u] - если внимательно смотреть по сторонам и выполнять все квесты,то легко получить все достижения за одно прохождение.

Минусы:

- [u]Небольшая продолжительность[/u] - игру можно пройти вдоль и поперек,выполнив при этом все достижения за 5-6 часов.


Итог: Довольно качественно сделанная игра,которая затянет вас на пару вечеров,однозначно стоит своих денег,всем рекомендую.

Fun, relaxing game. Definitely no brain-drain here. Maybe a slight bit of tedium if you want to stockpile the money and tools. For instance, I buy grain, go down 2 maps to have it ground then back up to turn it into bread then down four maps to sell them to the farmer's wife. 

But that's just the OCD'er in me. Probably unnecessary since there's plenty of things to gather that you can sell. I was just always afraid I'd sell off things that might be needed in one of the fetch quests later.

That's pretty much the game; Story-driven RPG element fetch quests and hidden objects. If you don't like those two gameplay elements then pass on this. If you're okay with them then this is a definite buy at this price, because you will be kept busy and entertained.

Good music, nice scenery, nice story, laid-back gameplay. The perfect relaxing game to sit down with either with your morning coffee, or to unwind after a long day at work or school.

14320860.review:
Just finished this game with 100% achievments at around 5 hours. I know that doesn't seem like a lot of time but i do think its a fair amount for how the game actually plays. I mean how much time is taken up in RPGs just buy running for example.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game and found it quite cute, and the bartering system was real cool as well. Finding ways to make money to buy the things needed to progress, giving you multiple options of how to acquire the gold, and some items, was cool as well.

The story is a nice twist on the classic save the world hero theme and captured me from the start.

Like a lot of other people, upon first look it looked like a cheesey facebook game, but i listened to the positive reviews that it is an actual game and it was definitely worth it.

Im not a fan of Hidden Item games but the way it is implimented into this one makes the game more enjoyable.

The soundtrack also matches the game and sets the scenes nicely.

All of this adds up to be a nice non linear-ish chill adventure game that is a great addition to anyones library whether or not you want to slam it out in 4-6 hours flat, or do multiple 30min sessions after long days before bed time like I did.

I do think $7 is an alright price to pay, though I do think $5 is more appropriate, i guess it depends how much you get out of playing it and how long it takes. If it took 7 hours, thats $1 for an hour, and not bad, if it took 3.5 hours, thats $2, still not bad.
I got this on sale for probably $4-5 and i think it was worth.

14223750.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is a hybrid between an RPG and a casual resource-management game. From the outlook, you may think it's like an old-school RTS, like I did. Reminds me of Stronghold.
Once you go into it, you'll realize that it's nothing of the sort.

Basically, you travel around the land, buying, gathering and selling supplies, so that you can progress, by doing quests. It's... surprisingly compelling. On paper, I'd say this game wouldn't work! After trying it, though, it managed to keep me playing to completion. 

There's an overarching story, but it's very cliché. It did nothing whatsoever to invest me, as there weren't any great characters or situations. It was [i]just[/i] there.

[b][u]Presentation[/u][/b]
As I said, it looks a bit old. However, I really like this graphic style. I love the way the how old RTS games looked, and this is basically an higher resolution version of that. The [b]iconography[/b] in the game felt a bit out of place, at times, but it identifies everything well enough, so I won't complain.
Other than that, the interface has a medieval feeling (especially the frames and the map) that fits the feeling of the game.

The [b]sound-effects[/b] were a bit too sparkly for me. They didn't fit the rest of the game, being more suited for a children's game, with a cartoony look. Regardless, they're otherwise functional.
The [b]music[/b] is open, I believe, but it was well chosen. There isn't much to say about it. It's pretty simple, fantasy-like background music, but it did its job of getting you into the game's atmosphere.


There were a few [b]interface[/b] issues I've had, but I've later found out that most of them could have been avoided, with a bit more explanation. Basically, everything requires 2 clicks -- [b]always[/b]. First, you click the objective or object you want to collect, and then there's some feedback, and a box appears with a "V" for you to click, to continue. This last step, in my opinion, was completely unnecessary. Also, the box appears in the object's place, so you'll often have to "backtrack" with the mouse, if you were ready to leave the screen, or something. 
This is avoided by pressing SpaceBar when the box appears. That way, you can just press it and the box will go away, so it partially solves the problem -- this, however, was [i]never hinted at[/i], in the game.

Overall, there are just lots of unnecessary clicks, in a game that's all about clicking. I believe that the visual and audio feedback was sufficient, but I may be wrong.

[b][u]Story and Writing[/u][/b]
As I've mentioned, the story is completely cliché. Your farm burns, and you go on a quest to save your father and be an hero. Then, you find that there's a bigger evil on the world, and you want to eliminate it. That's about it. 
There's isn't any real idea to be trasmitted by it, no interesting characters, nothing whatsoever. Bottom-line: [i]don't play it for a story[/i].

The [b]writing[/b] also felt very amateur, in general. The game just feels like it could be written by a middle-schooler. It's not awful, but there's nothing, at any point, that will surprise you or even amuse you. The phrasing is very simple, with not character having any personality... Meh. You can easily skip it and you won't miss anything.

[b][u]Structure & Mechanics[/u][/b]
It's hard to separate this from the mechanics. This game is a [b]glorified spreadsheet[/b], and it's almost all structure, and no mechanics.

Basically, you have a character whose main attribute is stamina. You lose stamina with every meaningful action, and you'll have to sleep on a camp to recover it. There are many camps spread around the map, requiring different resources for you to use them. Some are town inns, which require money, others will simply require different types of food.

Then, you'll also visit several towns that specialize in different things. There's alchemy, fishing, hunting, etc. Each requires different tools, which the townsfolk sell you. In those towns, there are also side-quests, that give you money, honor, and resources.
Honor is basically used for you to unlock certain quests, that require you to be more trust-worthy.

Despite the existence of several different occupations, they're all the same. Once you have a tool and skill (that you get from a quest), the maps will now have a new icon over the resource that you can gather. Then, you click it and there you go. 
There's no crafting per se. There are some vendors that give you a potions for herbs though, for example.

Each action will require tools/resources, and stamina. Some of them also require Hunters, Repair-men, Soldiers, etc. You can buy these (as if mercenary) to help you. 

As you can tell, the [b]whole game[/b] is about getting resource X and either selling or trading it for resource Y, so that you can do the next quest.

[i]Hidden-objects Component[/i]
In every map, there are items spread around, but that are very small and often blend with the background. These are mostly optional, but they can also be useful. These include Mushrooms, Eggs, Lost Crates, etc. These won't be unlocked from the start, you'll unlock them progressively, when following the main quest.

[b][i]Map[/i][/b] 
The maps tells you nothing useful, but let's you fast travel to every location. So, instead of having to waste 2 minutes and 15 clicks, you'll waste 10 seconds and 2 clicks.
This is fine, and I think it helps the game substancially. However, it could have been much better. Has different areas have different vendors and quests, it would have been useful to have those marked on the map. Perhaps a little quest description and the person who gave it to you, the main vendors, etc. You can very easily get lost, since you take to memorize everything. 


[b][i]Cumbersome systems[/i][/b]
Everytime you gather a resource, hunt, etc. you'll lose stamina, and also have a chance to break your tools. If that happens, you'll have to go buy another. Eventually, I just bought every tool twice to avoid backtracking. However, it's very cumbersome, in general. Especially with the later tasks, everything may cost up to half of your stamina. So, you'll travel, do 2 minor things, and have to go back and get more stamina. 
I think it's mostly unnecessary, how you constantly have to go back and forward... 

[b][i]It never lets go of your hand -- Too Linear[/i][/b]
The tutorial is very typical of mobile games. You have to click this very specific icon, or else you can't advance. This goes on for a while. While the game opens up [b]a bit[/b], it's also holding you hand. 
If I had focused only on the story line, it would have bored me to death, probably. It's like the game tells you its story through instructions. "Do this. Now, do that. Good, now get that to achieve this! No, no that-- this! Here! This shiny button!" ... It's very, very restrictive. The sidequests help a bit.
Regardless, it's never an adventure of your own.

[b][i]Progress and Achievements[/i][/b]
This is the trick about this game. There's an achievement for every meaningless task. It's annoying and patronizing. However, it's one of those psychological tricks that keeps you invested. Everything feels like progress. Also, every field will disappear after being gathered "x" times, so there will come a point when you've literally completed the game. And I think that's the strangely compelling thing about this game!
It keeps you going for far longer than I'd have guessed. The game has nothing interesting about it, but it still grabs your attention, for those 3 hours!

I would [b]not[/b] recommend this game, in most circumstances. It's very bland, and has nothing interesting about it. However, it's still compelling. Besides, it provides a good formula. If you can integrate a [b]good[/b] story, and some mechanics into it, perhaps a great game can be made!

[b]Please, be very aware of what you're getting into[/b]. For what it is, it's good!

-	Eliminar todas las plantas beneficiosas
-	Extinguir varias especies animales con el duro golpe al ecosistema que ello conlleva.

13973489.review:
Hero of the Kingdom isn't a very involved or "deep" title, but the entire time I played it I had no desire to stop. Even though it isn't a turn based game it has that "one more turn" feel to it as you progress through the game's lovely story. It isn't a long title, and there isn't a tremendous amount of replay value, but it is definitely worth a play through at least once.

The game is a point-and-click adventure that follows the story of a farm boy on what starts as a rescue mission and ends as a world saving quest. Through the entire thing you'll gather resources, hunt, fight and trade, all with simple mouse clicks. There are no mini-games to complete for any of the activities, and the game play is simplistic overall. That said, it is still enjoyable.

If you're looking for a quick, narrative-based game. Hero of the Kingdom gets the job done.

25% de busqueda de objetos (lo mas entretenido)

First off, I love the Age of Kings style aesthetics, which are what lured me in to begin with.  The gameplay wasn't at all what I was expecting, but I was very pleasantly surprised.  This turned out to be one of my favorite casual games in years.  The gameplay consists mostly of resource trading in the guise of quests, along with a very enjoyable hidden object aspect.  Both are really well executed, too.

-Very relaxing to play
-Outstanding music
-Despite having no real challenge to overcome, completing quests and finding things somehow gives just as much a sense of accomplishment as it does in a full fledged RPG
-100% frustration-free without feeling like it's holding your hand (at least after you finish the tutorial scenes)
-The hidden object aspect is really well done.  Objects are tough to find despite technically being in plain sight. 
-Have you ever added a task to you to-do list after already completing it, just for the satisfaction of being able to cross it off?  This game was made for you.

Absoluter Pluspunkt sind auch die wirklich gut gemachten Übersetzungen - was bei einem derart kleinen Game nicht unbedingt üblich ist.

Der Preis scheint mit 7 Euro zwar auf den ersten Blick etwas hoch, aber immerhin gibts 6 Sprachen und die Entwickler stecken die Erlöse offenbar in die Entwicklung eines zweiten Teiles (siehe Greenlight).

Hero of the Kingdom ist ein Wimmelbild-Spiel mit einigen RPG- und Abenteuerspiel-Elementen. Man klickt sich von Gebiet zu Gebiet und sammelt dabei verschiedene Dinge die teils offensichtlich und teils versteckt herumliegen. Gespräche erfolgen durch Textboxen die man der Reihe nach durchklicken darf. Antwortoptionen hat man keine, sodass jedes Gespräch einen festen Verlauf hat und auch die Story ist sehr stringent gehalten ist. Diese ist im übrigen auch nur 0815. Ebenso der Sound der lediglich zweckmäßig ist. Er passt zur entsprechenden Situation bzw. zum entsprechenden Gebiet ist aber sehr simpel gehalten. Die Grafik ist auch sehr schlicht, fand ich aber vollkommen ausreichend, da es meiner Meinung nach eben in erster Linie ein Wimmelbild-Spiel ist. Die Achivements gehen recht schnell und motivieren zum weiterspielen, auch wenn ich mir noch ein paar kniffligere gewünscht hätte (z.B. mit besser versteckten Objekten). Nach nicht einmal 4 Stunden war ich dadurch leider schon fertig. Für 2 entspannte Abende hat es aber zumindest gereicht und mir irgendwie auch Spaß gemacht.
Wer auf freie Charakterentwicklung, ein mindestmaß an Aktion oder eine Interessante Story Wert legt sollte auf jeden Fall die Finger von diesem Spiel lassen. Wer nur ein Spiel für zwischendurch sucht oder eines, das auch nebenbei gespielt werden kann, kann aber ruhig zugreifen. Auch Wimmelbild-Fans sollten es mal antesten, insbesondere da es eine Demo-Version hier auf Steam gibt. Mit dem Kauf aber am besten auf einen Sale warten da der aktuelle Preis von 7 € absolut überzogen ist.

13855440.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is a game, I'd probably describe as a [b]light, casual point’n’click-hidden-object-RPG-adventure[/b], which happens to be surprisingly [b]addicting[/b].

It's basically a simple game, in which you click on certain hotspots on the map to interact with your environment (for example shopkeepers to buy or sell items, a camp to restore some stamina or quest-npcs to start or finish the main- or one of several sidequests) and move yourself through about 25 screens of a nice-looking medieval world, advancing in a (shallow and not really innovative) story of a boy from a farm saving his father and becoming a hero at the end.
While you basically always do the same thing (just click on things), the objectives you have to fulfill are actually pretty diverse. Sometimes you have to kill stuff (animals, villians), find things hidden-object-style (eggs, mushrooms, sheep) or collect (and/or buy) the right resources to build buildings or equip an army. There are even some [b]professions[/b] to master (fishing, herbalism).

Still these things are so simple, that [b]literally anyone could succeed to finish the game[/b] in a reasonable time. Optionally you can also try to collect all 38 achievements, which include finding a big portion of all hidden-object items.

Unfortunately, even if you try to 100% the game, it [b]only takes about 3-4 hours[/b] to do so. But that might even be a good thing, because otherwise the simple gameplay could get boring and repetetive after some time.
Also [b]you have to know, what you’re getting with this game[/b]. If you’re expecting a much deeper, complex game, the game will most likely disappoint you. But fortunately [b]there is a demo available[/b] to test the game and see if it is for you.

[b]Overall, I think, this is an awesome game, that can be fun for ANYONE: Casual players as well as actual ‘gamers’, who don’t mind simple gameplay and a shallow story, can enjoy an addicting medieval adventure with a decent atmosphere. Granted: The game might be short, but the price isn’t to high (6$), especially on sale. I encourage everyone to give this one a try (at least the demo)!

On a scale from 1 to 10 I’d give this one an 8.[/b]

13820474.review:
I started Hero of the Kingdom without any idea of what it was going to be about. I bought it at a good sale price, the single screenshot I saw looked nice, and I don't like to spoil myself with trailers or large numbers of screenshots going into a game. I was immediately put off, thinking that it was going to be an extremely boring hand-holding hidden object adventure. I'm not fond of hidden object games in general, and I hadn't really been expecting to play one when I started. 

I wasn't actually wrong in my initial impression--Hero of the Kingdom is a really user-friendly point and click adventure with hidden object elements. The thing about this game, though, is that it is the [i]best[/i] casual point and click adventure. The game is beautiful, the music is both relaxing and adventurous (and a true pleasure to listen to), and the sound effects feel crisp and fit just right. Tons of polish all around, and you can tell that there was a lot of love put into making this game. 

Don't go in expecting to find a particularly detailed story, but what is there is enjoyable as well. Again, very simple, but it feels right. This is a game you can enjoy in small pieces, or devour all at once for a relaxing evening. Sometimes it's nice to play something simple and pleasant. 

Also, the main character solving a lot of problems by being a pretty decent carpenter was oddly refreshing. It's a skill that doesn't really get a lot of serious recognition even in crafting types of games, and it's handled so reasonably and practically within the confines of the story that I couldn't help but smile at moments like finishing construction of the water mill.
