9843208.review:
看截图以为是经营游戏，结果竟然是个RPG。仅有的经营要素是各种采集和倒卖。
作为一个RPG游戏来说，NPC和任务系统做得模有样的，还有主线和支线之分。当然剧情只能说中规中矩。
这游戏简化掉了普通RPG中的奔波劳累和赶路时间。但是依旧保留了探索的感觉，会随着游戏的进行逐步解锁覆盖地图的战争迷雾和隐藏区域。
不过连战斗都完全简化掉这点就比较见仁见智了。满足任务提出的物质要求后战斗就必胜，导致了战斗任务和普通跑腿任务几乎没区别。

硬伤是整体流程不够长，支线也仅仅影响一些商店的开放而已，导致重复游戏的价值不高。倒是也可以说这很适合现代快节奏生活。
另外这游戏里钱几乎是万能的，所以这里HERO的主要任务就是想尽各种办法增涨自己的存款。
游戏中大多数采集需要耗材，而做NPC任务实际上就是一种花小钱赚大钱，花大钱赚更多的钱的过程……

综上所述，其实这游戏叫做《王国投资人》更合适吧？

玩下来整体感觉是这游戏出在平板上就完美了（当然要修改掉一些考验眼力的部分）。作为PC游戏来说只相当于比较好的网页游戏级别。游戏本身倒是也蛮适合碎片时间玩的。

最后关于这种类似文字游戏一样不用操作主角跑路的RPG，
强烈推荐一个叫做《废都物语》的日本独立游戏，剧情曲折离奇，有汉化，有战斗系统，多线，多结局，且有多周目差异。

9817782.review:
Hero of the Kingdom was not the game I was expecting. When looking at the screen shots I got the impression this was going to be a medieval RTS similar to Strongholds, but more casual. I was wrong, but it turned out to be a good thing. 

Hero of the Kingdom is a click your own adventure game. You start out as a never described boy that must make his way through an epic journey to save his father and ultimately the entire kingdom. You play within a static background and must click on various elements to get loot and proceed to other static screens. There are lite crafting elements. You get herbs and wheat and must turn these into goods for profit or to further the story. The quests are not linear. Yes there are some story quests you must complete to proceed, but not all the quests are that way. In terms of quests I would say there are roughly 20 to 30. I would say the average gamer would beat this in 4 hours, but total play time should not exceed 6. 

The story is mediocre, the writing is actually kind of silly, (reads like it was written by a teenager) the amount of clicking is ridiculous, there's no challenge to the game, there's even a hint button that will literally tell you exactly what to do to proceed. Honestly, this game is well suited for young teens and children more so than adults. However, there was just enough fun from all the clicking, crafting, and reading that I didn't mind finishing the game. Actually, I finished the game, realized I hadn't got all the achievements and played it all over again! 

Bottom line: This game is not for adults, but it's fun enough to keep you playing till the end. I only paid $3 for it and the experience was well worth the cash.

9814496.review: ~I quite enjoyed this game, to be honest; more so than I initially anticipated I would.  Yes, it is purely a casual title, but that quality is also precisely what rendered it a pleasure to play. I would recommend [i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i] to anyone who wishes a soothing and relaxing evening. <3

9811025.review:
Ещё одна странная полузаконченная игра. Позиционируется как Adventure-RPG, но скорее это Puzzle+Hidden Objects. С некоторой примесью стратегии. Геймплей, собственно, разбивается на две контрастные части: в одной вы собираете разные разности по картинкам (причём половина объектов не подсвечивается - отсюда Hidden Objects), во второй - выполняете "квесты", условия которых строго заданы и никак не меняются. Никакой случайности или неожиданности: сказали "привести 10 человек и взять 10 волшебных зелий" - значит, именно это и понадобится, и потратится.

Игра, что странно, пытается одновременно быть фермерским симулятором: ловля рыбы, сбор трав и всё такое. "Странно", потому что все ресурсы ограничены, так что через полчаса-час там просто нечего делать, кроме сюжетных заданий. Не менее странно, что меня заваливают сокровищами - которые вообще ни для чего не нужны и никак не используются. Хм.

При этом имеется куча заведомо невыполнимых ачивок, типа "собери 500 грибов" или "поймай 500 рыб". Каким образом?? Там на всю игру столько нет!

Особо меня порадовало, что после открытия, примерно, 2/3 карты я дошёл до последней схватки. О чём меня честно предупредили. Хм. Ок, победил. Конец игры, без возможности продолжения или там New Game+. Супер. И это всё?

В общем, задёшево можно поиграться пару часов. Но настоящих денег не стоит. Недоделано.

9809848.review:
Hero of the Kingdom est un jeu de gestion pour débutant (gestion avec une pointe de Point & Click), et il est vraiment un des meilleurs de sa catégorie.

Le jeu se compose de différents tableaux que l'on explore, et qui évoluent au fur et a mesure que l'on apprends a voir le monde (découverte de la chasse, de la cueillette, de la chasse aux trésors, etc...)

Graphiquement c'est beau, ça rappelle un peu les jeux des années 90, ça m'a un peu fait penser a Zeus, le maître de l'Olympe, même si le gameplay n'a rien a voir.

Je le conseille vraiment, c'est un jeu reposant, et la musique est superbe.

Seul petit bémol: je suis chasseur de succès, et en débloquant les succès a 100%, qui sont tous du genre "chasser 65 animaux", "pêcher 80 poissons", j'ai VRAIMENT eu l'impression de défoncer l’écosystème, a la fin du jeu il n'y avait plus grands choses dans la nature! C'est un peu dommage, j'adore le farming dans les jeux, c'est apaisant je trouve, mais la, les succès aurait pu être un peu plus variés.

Mais je fais vraiment mon difficile: Hero of the Kingdom est vraiment super cool!

9557861.review:
Hero of the Kingdom ist absolut mein neuer Favorit. Das klingt für den ein oder anderen vielleicht überhoben, aber nein, dass meine ich wirklich so. Am Anfang des Spiels klickt man sich erst einmal linear von einer Position zur nächsten, was aber nicht weiter schlimm ist, denn die Erzählweise des Spiels, also die netten Dialoge und die damit kleine verbundene Hintergrundstory über einen verlorenen Vater, lassen euch in eurem Bann ziehen.

Aber nun wirklich zum Spiel:

Die Optik des Spiels lässt vermuten, dass es sich hier um ein reines Aufbau- Strategie Spiel im Sinne von Age of Empires handeln könnte, dem ist aber nicht so. Wenn Man versucht dem Spiel ein Genre zuzuordnen, wird man feststellen, dass man nicht so richtig weiß, das Spiel einzuordnen. Man könnte es vielleicht So beschreiben:
Adventure, Strategie, RPG, Click and Point. Irgendwie sowas. Und das trifft auch wirklich zu.
Wir bestreiten eine abenteuerliche Geschichte, in der es gilt, den eigenen Vater wieder zu finden, der verschwunden zu sein scheint. Dazu müssen wir immer wieder Quest bestreiten, die mit ein wenig strategisches Management in Verbindung mit dem sammeln von Items einhergeht. Und so kommen wir auch schon zum Click and Point Part, denn es geht eben nicht darum in Echtzeit eine Figur per Controller oder Tastatur zu bedienen, nein, in Abenteuer Manier sucht ihr per Mausklick nach diversen Items, die euch im weiterem Spielverlauf weiterhelfen.

Mein kurzes Fazit:

Dieses Spiel hat etwas verträumtes, dazu verhilft wahrscheinlich auch die gut ausgewählte Hintergrundmelodie. Ich bin begeistert über ein tolles und mitreißendes Gameplay.

9405773.review:
"Hero of the Kingdom" die Point & Click Schnitzeljagd für zwischendurch.

Man bewegt sich von einem starren Bild ins nächste muss verschiedene (oftsmals sehr sehr leichte) Quest erfüllen und alles mögliche an Items sammeln. Unter anderem Fisch, Fleisch, Heilkräuter und Algen um mit diesen weiter zu handeln.

Die Story ist ganz nett erzählt erfindet das Rad aber nicht neu. Man spielt den Sohn eines Bauern der nach seinem entführten Vater sucht. Mir hat das Spiel erstaunlicherweise echt Spass gemacht. Nach ca 4 Std hatte ich das Spiel durch.

Wer auf leichte Errugenschaften aus ist, ist hier genau richtig. Die meisten bekommt man hinterher geschmissen oder muss nur eine gewisse Zahl an Gegenständen dabei haben. Man sollte die Errugenschaften allerdings vor der letzten Mission holen sonst darf man, genau wie ich, das Spiel noch einmal spielen.

Das ist der grösste Kritikpunkt. Wiederspielwert ist gleich null ( meine Meinung ). Story bleibt immer gleich und man kann nicht verlieren ! Das schlimmste was passieren kann ist das man beim "Angeln" keinen Fisch am Haken hat. *bitter* :)

Grundsätzlich würde ich das Spiel für zwischendurch empfehlen, allerdings hätten ein paar mehr animierte Bilder, Hintergründe und Figuren nicht geschadet. Da sitz noch mehr Potenzial drin aus diesem Spiel mehr zu machen.

Hero of the Kingdom 2 ist ja bereits in der Entwicklung. Ich werds im Auge behalten.

9378481.review:
*Click* *Click* *Click* *Click* *Click* Casual game with a rather pale story and some "search those 5 pixels in a picture"-moments. Good game for easy achievments, bad game if you pay more than 2 bucks. 

Hero of the Kingdom is a point and click adventure mixed with a resource manager. You travel through different overview screens, visiting villages, mountains, forests and so on. On your way, you pick up items either by clicking (said "Search those 5 pixels"-moments) or by buying/trading/questing at NPCs. The more you progress, the more resources you have. For example you need Energy to fight (a boar or wolf costs X energy), which you replenish by sleeping. You can sleep when you pay gold at inns or in the wild, if you have enough food on you (different camping sites ask for different kinds of food). You can also carry items, which hold longer (Weapons and tools, though they might break sometimes)
Sadly, the system is kinda broken after a while for those, who notice how to milk endless gold out of the resource cycle. Maybe a patch would help here?

The artwork is pretty good, I expect the designer to give us a full course of his abilities in the future. Everything looks very detailed and alive and every screen carries a different kind of atmosphere with it The background music is nothing outstanding, but it doesnt kill the atmosphere either. "Generic" comes to my mind here.

Still, seeing as this is an endless orgy of clicking and searching I can not recommend it at its current price of 6 Euro. Maybe some mini-games and riddles would have helped to add simply MORE CONTENT to this game. In the end I just played it to gather all achievments, having absolutely no interest for an ending (and there is only one. Why not make different endings, depending on how you choose to solve quests and stuff? A simple BAD Ending would even give more depth...)

Hero of the Kingdom is a very strange game with a story literally as lackluster as its title. It's actually the most apt title you could give a game with such a children's novel story. The game itself, however, is quite unique.

It's difficult to explain the 'gameplay'. It's primarily resource management and questing. It takes pieces of RPGs, photo hunts, Anno-style management, and exploration and merges them all together into this strange concoction. I'll admit the Age of Empires II style art is what originally drove me to it. There's no real difficulty here, just relaxing puzzles.

I don't know whether or not to recommend it because I think that's impossible to determine. I will say it's the only game of its type on Steam and you could spend four hours doing much worse.

9239019.review:
It starts as a simple point & click RPG, if there even is such a thing, and becomes progressively complex, fun, and in some spots even brilliant. Unfortunately, the story is very short, and grinding around for stuff to do kinda gets repetitive, for that, you can progress through the game however you want. Hunt, gather, fish, and craft potions, trade them around, or sell them for money, complete small quest and you're done. It's true that it could have been more, it even looks like it could have been more. The map screen is large and it unlocks as you visit each area for the first time. However, I initially though it's going to be completely uncovered, but it's not. Still, if you're not using the helpful quick travel and instead try to backtrack area by area, you might get confused at first. The graphics are pretty, there is no animation, but it still looks great and nostalgic. The soundtrack is okay, I guess, although I wish it wasn't just that one song the entire time, accompanied by sounds of cows, goats, dogs, birds, bears, wolves, and other "ambients" over and over again. But you can turn the volume down whenever you wish, fortunately. If more than anything, this game made me nostalgic and opened an appetite for older RPGs. Thanks to this game, I am now craving for Nox.
That being said, I recommend this game.

9223655.review:
This is a game that feels like a mix between a hidden object game and a facebook-style RPG (follow very linear instructions, point and click on things to progress, rinse and repeat till you are done). Its a very casual game and moves at a fairly quick pace but would have preferred it to have been much quicker. Its a fairly mind-numbing game and while that can be ideal for some gaming sessions its a game that is very hard to recommend in most cases.

Other then the normal progression achievements most achievements are tied to finding all of the games resources (which is the games "hidden objects"). 9201759.review:
I feel like this game has its ups and downs but honestly I would not recommend it.
The art style is very nice, every scene is drawn with great detail and you can really tell the artists put a lot of time and effort into it being a rather pretty game and I feel that's what it accomplished. The music is also pretty catchy too.
With that being said, I played this game for a while and appreciated what it was going for but I felt like the type of game it was trying to be is rather dated; It has a storyline, somewhat, you're drawn in for the first hour and a half or so, but then you realize you are just pointing and clicking things for the sake of pointing and clicking them. I was waiting for a moment in the game for it to come out and be more, but it never happened.
Honestly, if you enjoy "Point and Click" games  by all means this is the game for you, but just a little warning, you better love pointing and clicking for the sake of pointing and clicking, or else you will probably fall under my category of somewhat displeased consumers that want more than a somewhat Farmville-ish game.

9198501.review:
Hero Of The Kingdom is a casual game that's actually very relaxing while also being very fun. It uses an isometric 2D view with a bit of animation in there as well. The story isn't all that fancy, or important, but it fits the casual nature of the game.

It's kinda hard to explain the gameplay because it involves a lot of clicking. You'll be accepting quests where you have to find certain items scattered across the map, defeat enemies, build things, sell things, buy things, you name it. There's plenty to do here, but remember, it's all about clicking stuff, so you will only use your mouse. Besides the isometric 2D view there's not much to look at. There are only textboxes and trade windows here. 

But this game is just so damn fun and addictive. It's no good for you if you suffer from OCD, because you will want to complete most of the stuff this game throws at you, it's *that* fun (but casual). Very enjoyable !

Hero Of The Kingdom II is already in development and if it's nearly as good as this one I personally can't wait for it to come out.

[Rating: 80/100]

9119697.review:
Игра удивительно простая и короткая, но в тоже время, удивительно интересная. Это своеобразная ролевая игра, текстовое приключение, которое, не смотря на свою простоту и лёгкость, способно не слабо так затянуть человека. Потрясающая рисовка, приятная сопровождающая атмосферная музыка, интересный сюжет и большое наличие квестов - это Hero of the Kingdom. Вы не надёте тут драйва, бури эмоций или бешенного экшена. Это спокойная, медленная и милая игра, которая ничего от вас не требует. Вы просто споконо сидите, читаете текст и клацаете мышкой, выполняя различные задания под сопровождение приятной мелодии. 

Я ни разу не пожалел о покупке игры. Сначала я хотел её купить по той причине, что это первая игра на украинском, выпущенная в Steam, но теперь я понимаю, что получил от игры огромное количесво удовольствия. Мне очень жаль, что игр подобного жанра почти нет и они не пользуются популярностью, таких творений должно быть больше. Я прошёл её очень быстро - всего 6 часов, и это не смотря на то, что тщательно прорабатывал каждую локацию, пытаясь пройти всё на 100%. Когда она закончилась, я даже расстроился. 

P.S - я советую брать эту игру только при отличном владении английского языка, либо при знании украинского, так как русского в ней нет. В этой игре очень важно читать буквально весь всплывающий текст. И вовсе не потому, что вы не будете знать, что делать. Это придаёт атмосферности, что является наиболее важной составляющей частью игры. Hero of the Kingdom превосходна для тех, кому иногда хочется спокойно посидеть и потыкать пальцем в экран, наблюдая за сюжетом и слушая музыку.

9019396.review:
I just finished Hero of the Kingdom (2.5 hours, give or take). It's a very unique game. Basically you're presented a top-down isometric screen that looks a little bit like Age of Empires 2 or HoMM3 or something. You click through text prompts on the screen in a sort of combination text adventure and hidden object game. You become a hero of your kingdom by moving through screens and helping people out. Maybe someone lost their son, so you hidden object find him. Nothing is difficult, it'll just be like you see a patch of mushrooms, and you click it so you get mushrooms added to your inventory. Or you are on your boat and click a barrel underwater to salvage it. So not really hidden object, more like click-to-acquire. Maybe a farmer needs someone to go to town to sell his flour, so you get flour, click to switch screens to the town, and sell the flour to a merchant. Your inventory has dozens of different types of commodities that you manage, flowers, eggs, swords, handymen, antlers, pearls, etc. Across the world various merchants buy and sell various commodities. There's no actual difficulty in that it seems like it's impossible to make a bad transaction. If you just keep buying and selling stuff and foraging and fishing and hunting you'll eventually get enough of what you need or enough money to buy what you need. I really can't compare it to any other game I've ever played. I had a fun time playing through it. I guess I wasn't really playing. Just kind of clicking everywhere.

I also laughed every time I'd go into some big climactic battle and my guy would be like "We scored a crushing victory over the Dark Goblins. Oh and all of my soldiers died. We will miss them." and then -10 soldiers in my inventory. Hahaha. Made them feel very disposable.

One flaw: The game autosaves and when you beat the game it erases your saves, meaning that if you want to get all the achievements you should do so BEFORE fighting the last boss (the last boss is clearly marked and identified).

9007182.review:
For such a casual, simple, and easy game that's seemingly tailored towards young adults with regards to the writing, this pixel-hunt adventure with the visual trappings of an RPG is oddly addictive. The game takes place in a medieval fantasy kingdom, with a prerendered set of locations that you interact with using the mouse (your player avatar is never actually represented on-screen). You can perform actions such as fighting, collecting crafting materials, trading with merchants, and hunting for hidden loot. The ultimate goal being to get powerful enough to fight an evil lord endboss. Chris Avellone levels of storytelling, it is not. But there's something about the game's simplicity and steady stream of medal unlocks that's strangely appealing. Worth giving a try, especially if you bought it as part of a certain indie bundle...

Completion time: 4-5 hours to 100% achievements

8990984.review:
Nettes kleines... nun, Adventure passt hier am besten. Es sieht zwar aus wie ein Browsergame und die Steuerung ist teilweise ähnlich, es ist aber ein Adventure-angehauchtes Wimmelbild-Spiel mit einer netten Hintergrundgeschichte und vielen Gelegenheiten, nach "Krams" zu suchen.

Im Grunde wackelt man ständig alle Bildschirme ab, sucht nach Pilzen, Kisten, Schätzen etc, erhält nebenbei neue Fähigkeiten wie Angeln oder Jagen, kann Truppen anheuern, gegen Gegner kämpfen (wobei man nicht kämpft sondern nur auf den Gegner klickt) und Quests löst. Sehr simpel gehalten, sehr logisch, sehr zeitsparend.

Nach 3-4 Stunden ist man maximal durch, hat dabe viele kleine Erfolgserlebnisse und kindgerecht ist das Ganze auch noch. Für andere Spieler ist es höchstens eine seichte Sache zwischendurch, die aber dennoch sehr entspannend wirkt.

8990830.review:
Very nice, very casual point&click adventure RPG, Hero of the Kingdom tells a familiar story of a farmboy turned hero.

The wannabe hero begins his journey when bandits burn his family farm down. He gets to do all sorts of jobs from woodcutting to burning to healing wounded people. Gameplay is simple: clicking a marker will give you a short written description (no voice-over here) of your character's thoughts, what you can (and therefore should) do and what you need to accomplish that. You need many kinds of resources in the form of food, vitality, gold and tools.

While the gameplay is a casual adventure, you also have to manage the said resources. You'll gain vitality by resting, which requires food that is acquired by foraging or hunting, which in part require tools and skills. Many parts of this chain could have been removed to smooth the gameplay: with them, however, it is an adventure RPG game, not just a barely visual novel.

There are also many details in the areas that turn out to be significant later on. Some of them are "hidden", though, meaning that you just have to click them to see if they react: stuff like collectable mushrooms and lootable barrels form this category.

The narration is casual and easygoing, containing little to no fancy words. In effect, it would be quite suitable to be played with young children who can't read yet, assuming English proficiency. Like so, the story is rather traditional with the evil dark wizards and all. It's still nice enough to keep in its grip for the while it lasts.

Full completion would have lasted about 4 hours, but I went for all the achievements. This added about an hour to the playtime because I just couldn't find several last mushrooms and hidden caches. While challenging, I was irritated to check the same areas ten times just to find those last missing items. Anyway, this is amended, as I really enjoyed the leisure style.

Replay value, IMO, is meager though. Once played through completely, there isn't much more to accomplish. That said, it is rather alright an experience for its price.

8940937.review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/259550/]Hero of the Kingdom[/url] is a slightly unusual mix of point-and-click adventure and rpg. It looks like an old-school isometric rpg, but there is no character to control - instead all actions are performed by clicking on object like in a point&click title. The basic rpg premise is still here (slight spoilers!) - an ordinary boy on a quest to find his father turns into a hero that saves the land from dire evil. Yeah, like no one expected that, spoilers over. The boy learns skills during the adventure - hunting, herbalism, etc - in order to get closer to his goal. As if the mix wasn't unusual enough the game adds in some Hiden Object elements - there are treasures and extra items hidden around in the bushes, rivers, barrels. 

Visually the game has nothing to be shy of, it's a simple but well drawn style. Map elements are clearly distinguishible and even the hidden items are fairly easy to spot with a little practice. It's overall easy on the eye even for longer sessions. The audio is pleasant enough too, can't say much in detail about it personally but at least it feels right. Sadly, there is very little, if any, voice acting and that might diminish the enjoyment for some players - while lots of detailed text and dialogues can be enrich the world it might also bore the player.

Personally I find the mix pretty entertaining, then again I enjoy casual games so take what I say with a grain of salt. Nevertheless, the story moves at a good enough pace to keep boredom away and it's easy to enjoy this in bite-sized portions if so desired. Time-wise the game takes around 5 hours for a relaxed playthrough, dipping to maybe 3-3.5 for a speedy run and climbing to approx 8 for a single 100% run. At L5 that is pretty good value for anyone who likes a more casual adventure. 

tl;dr: At £5 it's a good mix of point&click, adventure, and casual gameplay.

8935371.review: Very nice, relaxing and interesting game. I was not sure about what I was buying but in the end, this is a great surprise.

8931921.review:
Veeeeeery casual point & click adventure, super short but nevertheless enjoyable and charming. But, to be completely honest, the game is only worth buying if you get it as a part of a bundle or on sale (it's included in the [url=http://www.blinkbundle.com/]Blink bundle[/url] at the moment of writing). 

You begin the game as a [strike]errand boy[/strike] humble farmer. Who, as the game progresses, evolves into the [strike]Badass Errand Boy[/strike] [spoiler]*gasp!* Hero of the Kingdom![/spoiler] But no, seriously, if you dislike "fetch quests", then steer clear of this game altogether. There's no avoiding those.

To sum it up, the entire gameplay consists of jumping between the chunks of the world map, helping the elderly, picking up pretty flowers, hunting for pixels, wild animal genocide and occasional Bad Guy slaying. That's it, really. The (heavily linear) story is like something straight out of a children's book geared towards ages 5-7. No replayability value, unless you're into meaningless grinding and achievement hunting.

So why in the blazing hell am I still recommending this? 'Cause the game is still fun and relaxing, very nice to look at and sends me back to my school days when I was obsessing over Stronghold 1. Not sure what to expect of [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=212391088]the sequel that's in the works[/url], yet, but it definitely looks prettier. Hopefully the game will catch up story-wise, too.

Let's simplify those into a 5 hour long game point n' click game." While the idea might not be as brilliant as it sound, but the execution in Hero of the Kingdom proved that the idea is simply refreshing. 

The game is linear. There is no way to lose the game. It is a game to play while sipping a cup of tea. The story is nothing worth mentioning. You might find the game is a bit expensive for a really short experience.

This amazing game was definately worth it's price!

Hero of the Kingdom is a point'n'click game focused pn the storytelling. You live on a small farm settled far away from the civilization. I actually take a fairly neutral stance on this game, but for the sake of leaving a review I lean towards 'recommend.'

Pros:  The artwork is beautifully done and the navigation layout isn't bad.  Although the storyline is a bit hackneyed, I still found myself getting into it.  The text based narration was decent and the sound effects were well done.  Finding all the hidden goodies throughout the game felt like a flashback to Where's Waldo books.

Cons:  Don't expect a lengthy game!  I beat it twice in under 10 hours for all the achievements.  The entire game only encompasses a small group of tiles, so not much exploring.  The harvesting can be tedious when combined with the constant need to rest and exchange for supplies.  Most of the harvesting is only used to monotonously build up money instead of crafting or building.

If you're looking for a game to relax and kill a few evenings, it will do well.  The game has so much potential but it just stops far short.

7826916.review:
Hero of the Kingdom is a pretty solid adventure/very light RPG hybrid. It's a bit odd to describe it, as the game wants to seem like an adventure but it comes out as something fairly unique. You start as a simple farm lad trying to find where your father went off to after bandits ransacked your farm, and end up being, as the title says, the hero of the entire kingdom.

To achieve this end result, you must click, and click, and click! This can be from anything as simple as delivering a letter from clickable person to clickable person #2 to defeating various armies of villainous foes by gathering troops and supplies. There's also objects in the background that, when clicked upon, give various items relating to what they are. These can be very helpful for trading for what you need or selling to get extra gold, though none of them are necessary typically and are just there to make the game last longer.

Speaking of length, it took me 3.3 hours to beat the game, including all my clicking of the extra objects (of which I got about 95%). I was somewhat annoyed to find that I couldn't go back and clean up the last few objects I needed once I had beaten it, but this will only affect you if you're a completionist or achievement hunter. If you are, just be wary of that.

The story is very basic of course, even just basing it on the summary I gave, but it's a quaint little adventure-sorta game. At $7 (and cheaper on sales presumably), this is a nice choice for an interesting game to check out.

This is a cute, casual point & click RPG, where the emphasis should be on the word CASUAL. That means no deep story, no fancy graphics, no complex battle-system. Having that said, by "casual" I don't mean "dull". Not on this case, anyway. :)

In "Hero of the Kingdom" you follow a simple, somewhat childish story, where the gameplay consists of completing quests, gathering items and improving your skills, all by means of pointing and clicking with the mouse. Also, the game is pretty short - I beat it in 5 hours.

Okay, so.... Where's the recommendation part? :P
Well, the truth is, that despite the game's obvious casuality and simplicity, or maybe in a way thanks to those elements, the game *IS* fun to play. At least it was for me. 
I hear some people moan and complain that a game like this shouldn't cost money. Well, if that is what you think - don't pay for it, just pass on it and move on. Personally, I think paying $5-$6 for such a game is an okay deal. Obviously not a bargain, but not a bad deal either. Sometimes a game like this is exactly what I need to relax and unwind. If that's what you're looking for - Hero of the Kingdom is good for exactly that.

7678381.review:
Although it feels like a game originally designed for the mobile platform, Hero of the Kingdom is a treat nevertheless. The story is nothing special: your home is destroyed, your father is missing, and you must track him down. Your adventure quickly becomes larger in scale, and the eventual revelations are interesting, fitting, and satisfying. The gameplay is quickly accessible, but it takes a good deal of planning and resource management to get the tools, soldiers, medicines, and weapons you'll need to overcome your many foes. There are a variety of secrets to find in the environments, so that each new map is a treasure hunt for necessary materials and wildlife. 

Hero of the Kingdom is a brief game and can be completed at around 5 hours. Achievements come regularly and keep you motivated. While the art style is simple, I found it charming and appropriate for this sort of adventure. I easily recommend this game for my friends who enjoy games which are a little different yet delightful.

Ich will gar nicht soviele Worte über das Spiel verlieren. Das Spiel ist eine Art Point and Click  Adventure was keine Raetsel bietet sondern die ganze Zeit leichte Quests besitzt wo man andauernd nur Sachen sammeln muss. Nebenbei ist das Spiel noch eine Art Wimmelbildspiel (kleine Pilze suchen).

Die Geschichte ist nichts besonderes, sie ist ganze klassisch. Die ganze Story ist letztendlich linear, nur Nebenmissionen kann man nach einer beliebigen Reihenfolge loesen.

Die Kaempfe sind zudem auch nichts besonderes. Man braucht bestimmt viele Gegenstaende und sobald man diese hat, kann man auch den Feind angreifen und nie verlieren (Freunde sterben nur so, wie es die Story vorschreibt).

Die Spielzeit betraegt zwischen 3,5h (wenn man sich nur durchklickt) und 8 Stunden (wenn man auch etwas Geld farmt und jeden Dialog liest). Somit ist 5€ ein ganz guter Preis und wenn man mal schnell alle Achievements haben will ist es auch okay.
